story:
What most people don't know is that atomic batteries have been around for years. Most people think they are science fiction, and the only thing that is powered by atomic fuel cells is The Terminator. But atomic fuel cells are used in many industries where long life power is a must. Satellites and space probes are powered by atomic batteries, they have even been used in pacemakers they need to work for times measured in decades.

When people think of atomic power they think of Uranium and Plutonium. Hazardous materials that leave radioactive waste that lasts for millennia. But there are other radioactive materials like Strontium 90. Which is used in medical practice as it is more atomically safe then other radioactive materials. As it's primary product is beta decay. You can literally wrap strontium in aluminium foil, and keep it for 100 years, the foil will keep you and your food safe till it decays into a stable element.

Unlike other radioactive materials it is not fissionable. You can't make it into a weapon of mass destruction. And you can literally buy 50 ounces, about a kilogram off the internet for less then $100AUD!

This makes atomic batteries a long lasting, cheap and safe alternative to lead acid or Lithium batteries as the cost per watts to produce is similar, but the batteries put out power for decades and not just a few minutes. They never need to recharge.

Apart from the lack of general understanding of how incredibly safe Strontium is to use there in no reason not to, and there are very little government restrictions in using it. Realistically Strontium 90: is used and stored in nearly every hospital in the world because it is so useful and safe. So when you think about it it safer to store Strontium in the fridge, then it is to store petroleum in your shed.

HOW ATOMIC BATTERIES WORK

Atomic batteries use the thermoelectric effect, much like the photoelectric effect, or solar panels. It uses heat and semiconductors in a similar way that solar panels use light. That is you use a heat source at the top, and a colder region at the bottom, the heat difference creates a current.

And Strontium is used as the heat source, using decay heat. So trapping an amount of Strontium 90 inside a small black of aluminium does two things. It shields the user from radiation, whilst the decay heat, over time, heats the aluminium. That safely generated heat will be hot for years. And instead of building a coolant to keep the other side cool. We surround it by vacuum. As a vacuum cannot get hot, there is nothing in it to heat up. So the heat differential between the heat source, and the vacuum creates a differential and constant electric current. This is then also cased in carbonate plastic, making it light weight, heat resistant, and furthering its radiation shielding inside the vacuum. This is simply put without fully disclosing my exact intellectual property.

What you end up with is a little square the size of an brick that supplies decades of power safely until its atomic core radiates its heat away into a safe element!!!

story: We are raising money to improve Zen Maker Lab by adding a powder-based, full-colour, ZPrint Z510 3D printer, an 8-station Raspberry Pi / Minecraft Lab, a Tinkerine Ditto Pro and a new metal work lab.

story:
I am concerned about our environment.


Kyle Schmutz. I am a native Nevadan, and I want to help cut down carbon footprints, and feel that while the big
unaffordable electric cars, and hybrids are great, but what about those who can't afford transportation.

I will change that.  Follow me that we can make this change together. A change that will benefit us all.

My objective:

 is a unique personal vehicle,

Update: 5/21/15 The  vehicle will look similar to the Jurassic world Gyrosphere.

street legal, affordable, and it looks really cool,  in return I am asking for small  amount of 30, 000.00.  That's 1,000 people donating $30.00, is the research, and development that I plan to devote my life to, to make a better world, for us.

The Lab, and workshop space and rental is pretty small so about $1,000
Documenting and independent testing. (we need to make sure it's safe) 2,000 - 4,000
Licenses and patents 3,000 - 5,000
Material, around 8,000 - 10,000

If donated the Asked amount

Mad perks of course.  Stickers, posters, blueprints and building plans. And to two working personal powered
vehicles.

Failure is not an option.

Even if half the desired amount is raised, it will still go towards environment awareness, and help in the direction of a cleaner tomorrow.

I believe that we can make a difference

Impact, it’s not just for me, the environment impacts us all.  Another impact, getting to and fro, and my vehicle will make a huge impact by leaving almost no carbon footprint, but doing it in style getting you from point A to point B.

Every day, to go to work, school, the gym, the coffee shop, or just your friends Roy’s four miles away, we drive, take a cab, or bus it. And the price of gas is going up, were shelling out over 2.00 a gallon, even if the gas tank is 10 gallons that almost 30.00, a bus pass if it’s available in your area may be over 40 dollars for a week. And a taxi cab is about 4.00 an hour plus tip.

WHY?


Here is the hard part, and the risk.

Risk is all around us, here is the bigger risk, if we don’t do something now, the future impact on the word may be
catastrophic.

There are many potholes, red traffic lights, detours, and dead ends, but I will never give up.

I am a designer, and the one asking for help, I have an engineer in my small group, a motorcycle mechanic, I am an artistic, author, and a computer programmer in my group.

Some of the funding will go to their services, as we research, designing everything, testing everything in simulated environments, step by educated step, we build test models, test safety, register, before we come to product that is ready for the public.

You want one!

I have seen youtube videos of crowdfunding, best/worst, and all that have expired, wishing I had gotten in on, so don’t let this one be the one that got away from you. Our vehicles are guaranteed to be unique, and we are designing 3 types, 1.)  A person powered Diwheel. 2.) A small electric Dicycle, and 3.) A luxury Hybrid Dycycle.

You don’t know what a Diwheel or Dicycle is? Here is a link to Wiki’s definition of a Dicycle. (http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dicycle) Seams simple enough, sure, I hope to make them popular, to ride in style, and to help the world in the long run.

So if you want to help, spread the word, and even it’s a dollar, I’m going to give back. The power is yours, and I hope to use the Dicycle to help educate the world the importance of traveling smart, green, and efficient.

Thank you for your time.

Kyle Schmutz

story: .

About Fuse

Fuse SPS’s coworking space opened in December 2014 based on a need to support our tech and entrepreneurial community. By nurturing our community through events and activities, such as supporting students in STEAM programs, we are supporting economic development and playing a critical role in the entrepreneurial ecosystem of the Tri-Cities. Our membership includes Startup businesses, freelancers, small businesses, telecommuters, and others who enjoy a non-traditional office environment.

With an energetic board of directors and a new Executive Director, Fuse has supported and continues to assist with StartUp Weekend, Pasco Enterprise Week, Tri-Cities Launch University, TriConf, Hackathons, Code Camps, and other community events and meetings core to our social purpose.  As a result of StartUp Weekend, two businesses were formed that continue as active members of Fuse SPC: Solar Spirits and Red Level Games. Fuse SPC needs your help to achieve further support of community needs including greater events to benefit the entrepreneurial and tech community, and increased space for coworking offerings.

Why We Need Your Support!

We need your help in order to provide Fuse members with additional resources, build connections through a shared work environment, and inspire the community.

Breakdown of how our donations will be used:

  • We need more room and the second floor is open for the taking. Much of the funding will go to improving the upstairs space for more members and educational events to help inspire entrepreneurs.
  • We will be adding business suites to the upstairs for some of the new startups that have already outgrown the collaborative workspace and smaller offices.
  •  We will be adding a quiet work space that overlooks that park to complement our larger open collaborative workspace.
  • We will be bringing in some new technology, including a commercial printer, video conferencing, and prototyping equipment.
  • We will be adding additional support structures for our members including staff assistance, marketing assistance, and general business education support.
  • We will be working on a new educational publication line to support both our community authors as well as our ability to reach, educate, and inspire new businesses.

Please Visit Fuse!

If you are in Tri-Cities, WA stop in for a complimentary day of coworking at Fuse. You will be inspired. Please donate to, and share our campaign with your social media networks.

Thank you

www.fusespc.com

story:
Who we are!

The Sugar Beet Food Co-op was opened in July of 2015 by 1,100 owners and families in and around Oak Park, IL.  We're a community owned grocery store, open to everyone, featuring local and organic products.

Now just the second food co-op in Chicagoland, we're working hard to spread the word on what a grocery store with soul looks like.  The Sugar Beet is about good food, supporting local growers and creating a vibrant, healthy community educated on food issues that affect them & their families.

What we need!

We see the positive impact that food Co-ops have in their communities all over the country and are excited about bringing those values and contributions to the near west suburbs of Chicago. That starts by making sure everyone is aware of the Sugar Beet with good signage and that's where you come in.  A large sign had always been in our plans prior to opening, but we ran into a bunch of issues. Landlord, permitting, and cash shortage all kept us from getting the sign in place before we opened, but we've now removed all those barriers...except the cash.

We're out to build and install a beautiful, lit sign facing east and west on Madison Street for the 22,600+ cars a day that drive by our store.  As it sits now, our building can look very dark when you drive by.  To maximize space in the store we've had to put shelving and equipment up against the south wall of glass windows.  Another element is that this building is LEED Certified and has thermal energy saving blue glass windows.  We love this, but it does create a darker look and can make the building look unoccupied.  This sign will help change that and help us create more new customers and owners.  

We're projecting sign costs to be at $20K, with indiegogo getting 10%, so we're shooting for $22K. It sounds like a lot, but it's really just $1 per car that drives by every day.  We can do this!

 

And what you get!

We've got some really awesome gifts and promotions lined up for this campaign.  This isn't a charity after all, so we're trying to give some really cool stuff back for your support.  

Supportive Strawberry!

$15:  "I heart my Co-op" sticker and a shout out on Facebook/website/etc.

 

 

 

Passionate Peach!

$35:  Sugar Beet t-shirt and shout out!

 

 

Fabulous Fig!

$100:  Sugar Beet T-shirt, $50 Gift Card and shout out!

 

 

 

Addicted Apricot!

$200:  Sugar Beet Travel Mug and free coffee every day for a year!

 

 

 

Terrific Tangerine!

$300:  Gift Ownership in the Sugar Beet (for yourself or someone else), plus a $50 Gift Card and T-shirt

 

 

 

Groovy Grape Wine Goddess (or God)!

$1000:  Wine for a year!  Every month, 4 new bottles of wine await you at the Sugar Beet!

 

 

Smooth Sugar Plum

$1000: Create and name your own Smoothie or Juice at the Co-op!  Then get a free one(or any other juice/smoothie) each for you and a friend every week for a year!

 

 

Partying Pear!

$1000:  Sugar Beet Soirée!  The Sugar Beet caters and serves a party at your place for 25 folks, full of delicious wines and catering platters from our in-house kitchen.

 

 

 

Ballin' Blueberry!

$1000: Annual Beet Box Subscription:  A curated, monthly box full of new, hot and local foods and beverages (adult beverages or some innovative, non-alcoholic cocktails). 

 

Other ways to Help!

We know that not everybody has extra cash around to help us get our sign up and THAT'S OK. There are other ways to help the Sugar Beet reach it's goal.  Sharing this campaign on your social media site or page is amazing and really helps us spread the word.  And we'd be silly not to say just shopping at the Co-op really helps us raise funds for this and other great projects we're working on.  Even just getting doing some of your gift shopping at the Co-op can help.  Of course we have Gift Cards that make every food lover's holiday dreams come true. 

Thanks so much for reading all these and helping our campaign in whatever way you can!

 

In Gratitude and Cooperation,

                                      The Sugar Beet Family

story:
Support AngelaCARES!

Hello! AngelaCARES, Inc. is a 501(c) (3) nonprofit organization headquartered in Jersey City, NJ, whose vision is to encourage a caring and helpful world. We value teamwork, respect, accountability and innovation. With these values, we go out into the community and create sustainable programs and meaningful relationships to enhance the quality of life through empowering our seniors, their caregivers and the youth.



Help Us Help The Community

With the start of a new year comes new goals, new projects and new operating expenses. We are hoping to raise $4,000 or more in the next few months. Your contribution would directly fund the following programs and initiatives:

  • Keeping the doors open at our Jersey City main office and our satellite office in Newark, New Jersey

  • Here4Seniors projects including workshops, advocacy efforts, weekly walks and other events

  • Our collaborative efforts to bring the youth and the elderly together through our J.O.Y.S. (Joining Our Youth and Seniors) programming with events like proms, luncheons, feeding the seniors, intergenerational activities and more

  • Outside collaborative volunteer efforts like our MLK Day of Service with Family of Colors Hudson County and Astor Place Neighborhood Association

  • Informational, educational and emotional support for senior caregivers

  • Assisting and helping a senior apply for food stamps to put food on the table

  • Engaging a youth to spend their time volunteering to build their character and make a difference

  • And many, many more!


Our Impact Thanks To People Like You

This year alone, with the help of supporters like you, we've made a great impact on our community and those surrounding us! Here are some of the ways your contributions made a difference:

  • We successfully packaged and delivered 500 meals to seniors for our 3rd Annual Thanksgiving Senior Feeding with the support of 130 volunteers, many of which came from Jersey Cares and we had enough food leftover to help feed the homeless.

  • We helped create the Sandy’s Hudson County Long Term Recovery Committee to help Sandy victims.

  • We successfully had our 2nd Annual Senior Citizen Prom where more than 60 seniors had a great time and our 3rd Annual AngelaCARES’ Joining Our Youth & Seniors Holiday Celebration in conjunction with Snuggle Bear Kidz Learning Center.

  • AngelaCARES, Inc. successfully ran our 1st 6-week Summer Youth Volunteer & Enrichment Camp.

  • We had a 6-week Wellness Initiative Senior Education (WISE) Workshop where we partnered with Partners in Prevention to bring awareness to seniors.

  • We partnered with the City of Jersey City Department of Recreation to start a Senior Power Walking Group, our second walking group.

  • We helped Jersey City, Belmont Avenue Fire Residents move forward, including helping to send a precious youth to her Senior Prom after losing their homes and belongings.

Other Ways You Can Help AngelaCARES

AngelaCARES understands making a financial contribution can be difficult for some people. So, there are other ways you can show your support: 

  • Spread the word about AngelaCARES and all the great things we do for the community

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter and Instagram using the IndieGoGo tools

  • Volunteer with us helping the elderly and mentoring youth if you live in the Hudson County area or contact our founder, Angela McKnight to see if there are any opportunities to volunteer remotely in your area

  • Tell us about any businesses or organizations who might be interested in collaborating with us

For more information about AngelaCARES, Inc. visit our website at www.angelacares.org or send us an email at mailbox@angelacares.org. Even a small donation could mean the difference between another senior in need, struggling youth or discouraged caregiver from getting the help and support they need. Help us help the community!

Thank you!

We successfully packaged and delivered 500 meals to seniors for our 3rd Annual Thanksgiving Senior Feeding with the support of 130 volunteers, many of which came from Jersey Cares and we had enough food leftover to help feed the homeless.
We helped create the Sandy’s Hudson County Long Term Recovery Committee to help Sandy victims.
We successfully had our 2nd Annual Senior Citizen Prom where more than 60 seniors had a great time and our 3rd Annual AngelaCARES’ Joining Our Youth & Seniors Holiday Celebration in conjunction with Snuggle Bear Kidz Learning Center.
AngelaCARES, Inc. successfully ran our 1st 6-week Summer Youth Volunteer & Enrichment Camp.
We had a 6-week Wellness Initiative Senior Education (WISE) Workshop where we partnered with Partners in Prevention to bring awareness to seniors.
We partnered with the City of Jersey City Department of Recreation to start a Senior Power Walking Group, our second walking group.
We helped Jersey City, Belmont Avenue Fire Residents move forward, including helping to send a precious youth to her Senior Prom after losing their homes and belongings.
Other Ways You Can Help AngelaCARESAngelaCARES understands making a financial contribution can be difficult for some people. So, there are other ways you can show your support: 
Spread the word about AngelaCARES and all the great things we do for the community
Share our campaign on Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter and Instagram using the IndieGoGo tools
Volunteer with us helping the elderly and mentoring youth if you live in the Hudson County area or contact our founder, Angela McKnight to see if there are any opportunities to volunteer remotely in your area
Tell us about any businesses or organizations who might be interested in collaborating with us
For more information about AngelaCARES, Inc. visit our website at www.angelacares.org or send us an email at mailbox@angelacares.org. Even a small donation could mean the difference between another senior in need, struggling youth or discouraged caregiver from getting the help and support they need. Help us help the community!Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, this is Michael Lavery and Antonio Appling and we are starting a breakfast restaurant called, "The Nest!"

Background

Antonio was teaching high school in the inner city in Los Angeles for the last 6 years while Michael was working various management jobs in the food service industry in San Francisco. 

We have a common love for food and people that started in 2006 at the Olive Garden in San Francisco.  Fast-forward to 2014 and we now have an opportunity to open up a space that will serve good food, to even better people like you. Sounds easy enough. The cost to open a restaurant (even a small one) is tremendous, and after going to college, the last thing we want is more high interest debt. With your help we can get The Nest off the ground and start contributing to the community through food and service. If we cannot pull our people together around this idea, it might stay just that…an idea. 

We have extensive experience in the industry, from chain restaurant management, trendy hotel restaurant management, to local neighborhood eateries and nationally recognized neighborhood markets.

There is no going back, we quit our jobs and moved from afar to make this dream a reality. But we need your genuine help.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get our doors open and keep them open we need $30,000.

That sounds like a lot, but remember, you only have to contribute what you can. There is no doubt that there is someone who could give the whole amount, but we believe this effort will be championed by everyday folks giving out of the overflow of their hearts. We would not ask for money if we didn't need it and we waited months before starting this campaign because we were scared no one would give, or that our friends and family would feel imposed upon. Well, a closed mouth doesn't get fed and people can't bless what they don't know exists. We have both had experiences where we had the resources to help a loved one but didn't find out until it was too late that they needed help.

If we don't reach our goal the funds will still go towards to paying our rent, paying our employees, keeping the lights on and initial food costs, but we will have to push a little harder to accomplish our goal.


 We have some awesome Gifts/Perks to offer you when you chose to invest from naming your own dish, to free food and drinks.*

The Impact

The Nest has an opportunity to offer community through food in an area that desires change. Bellflower is currently devoid of a thoughtful breakfast spot. Imagine driving down Alondra Blvd and knowing that you played a vital role in building up a community. Even better, imagine coming in for breakfast and knowing that you have legit ownership in The Nest!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people just cannot contribute. Don't be discouraged. You can still help. Please post our link on your page, or pass our information on to someone you know who would like to make a difference.

Help us make The Nest a reality.

We love you and can't wait to serve you!

- Antonio and Michael


*Any contribution will automatically sign you up for our e-mail list. We will send you awesome, food, community related e-mails. No junk. If at any time you don't want to hear from us any more you can unsubscribe.

story:
Why Bushwick needs KERF:

1) Bushwick is home to a number of designers, artisans, and makers. Right now there is no local venue to showcase all of the furniture and other designs created in Bushwick.  As a person who loves furniture I really appreciate good design and would really like other people to be exposed to it too.  I’ve seen some stunning work done in Bushwick and once you’ve seen it, I think you’ll agree. 

2)For better or worse a large part of the changes that have been going on in Bushwick has come in the form of bars and restaurants opening.  In fact 11 bars have opened here in the last 6 months.  In order for a neighborhood to really grow we need more than just bars and restaurants.

3) There is a lot of construction going on here too.  Apartments are being renovated at a fast rate, and new buildings are going up all the time.  More people are moving here all the time- a creative class of people that will need furniture and other housewares to decorate their new living space.  Their option now? Ikea.  And Ikea is well…Ikea.  Not to mention the closest one is on the other side of Brooklyn.

  

My Story:  After graduating four years ago with a degree in Furniture Design, I moved back to NY and started working in Bushwick.  At the time I was honestly surprised to be working in Bushwick.  The neighborhood didn’t have the best reputation.  But I could quickly see a neighborhood in transition.  I now live in Bushwick and in the four years I’ve been back, I have to say there are some pretty amazing changes going on here. 

This is where KERF comes in.  KERF will add to the neighborhood as a showcase of local culture, providing a place to buy some brilliant furniture and giving the opportunity to local designers to grow their business.

Why we need your money: 

Right now KERF is moving from an esoteric idea to an actualized storefront.  We’ll use the donations to secure a physical location in Bushwick.  It will also allow us to get on our feet, pay for advertising, and aid with other business expenses.

 

The best part: THE PERKS!

One of the coolest things about donating to KERF is the awesome furniture and products we have available.  Scroll down to see what we have to offer. We’ve profiled some of the local designers that will have their pieces for sale at KERF once we open.  Eleonora Zorzi, Kahokia, Rutledge Radio, and SAW have been cool enough to help the campaign by offering a few of their pieces as incentives for donations to KERF.  I know some of these prices seem high, but remember you are donating to a worthy cause and I want to get these designers top dollar for their participation. (Please note that international shipping rates may increase cost)

Model D by Rutledge Radio.  Locally Designed and Built. Your perk for $500 

The Model D is a self contained, amplified speaker unit with an 1/8" (3.5mm) auxiliary input compatible with smart phones, iPods, tablets, laptops, etc... Designed as a reaction to mass-produced plastic iPod docks and clumsy computer speakers, our speaker units are constructed of domestic walnut hardwoods with traditional box joints, bone knobs and linen speaker cloth. The emphasis is on natural materials and longevity of the product. The most sustainable design is one where the materials are renewable, the aesthetics are timeless, and the product is well made. 

Andy by Kahokia.  Locally Designed and Built.  A perk for $200  Soon to be offered by Kerf, Andy is the 4 tier wall vanity from the Manity line by Kahokia.  Andy includes an elegant side mirror and each cubby is large enough to store a "Watch Log", sunglasses (including a bulky case) or any other accessories you see fit. Andy holds up to four watch logs or four pairs of sunglasses. The elegant and simple "Watch Log" is sold separately and holds up to 3 male wrist watches. Please note contents are for illustration purposes. 16"W x 14"H x 4"D.  Clear pine with a light natural stained finish. 

Gatsby Table by SAW.  Loacally designed and built.  Yours for $1200 

The Gatsby Dining table is a hand built composition repurposed wood (varies on supply) and a hand welded steel frame. It has a powder-coated finish is (shown in MINT but many colors available) and adjustable feet. Easy assembly required (ten screws). 60"L x 30"W x 30"H, overall

The No. 007 Shelf by HackettDesign.  Locally Designed and Built.  Your Perk for $100 

Inspired by the art of Mondrian and the mystique or the golden ration, No. 007 structures FSC Certified plywood into a clean geometric composition. Ideal for books, glasses, or to bring order to whatever chaos surrounds you. Available in your choice of 3 backboard colors: daphne blue, lipstick red, or pale chartreuse. (shown in maroon).

Ponte Side Table by HackettDesign.  Made of repurposed church pews.  A perk for $250 

 

Poster and tShirt design exclusively for Kerf by Eleonora Zorzi.  A beautiful design inspired by Kerf and traditional playing cards, these hand screen are printed on a beautiful French Paper.   18x24

Get yours now!

story:
Summary

I was struck by the news and video capture of a blatant abuse of power (by the rich) over the very poor.  Inspired by the campaign of the bullied bus monitor in upstate New York, while seeing the video reminded me that the inequality and human abuse tolerated in Philippine society is very real - it is not far from the dehumanization experienced in the deep south in the early 1900s - they exist today in the Philippines.

What We Need & What You Get

The victim is Saturnino Fabros - a poor Traffic Enforcer who seems to be just doing his job, poor, humble and helpless when assaulted by a big rich bully.  A dollar in Manila will go a long way, I'd like to raise $500.00 for his family and more importantly, to make a statement.

The Impact

To make a statement and raise awareness among the Filipinos (and other societies in the world that live amidst inequality and abuse, where human rights is non-existent and the rich has free to reign to bully the weak and the poor. It is time to relinquish the chains of Spanish colonialism that has plagued us Filipinos for centuries and morph'ed into this very disgusting manifestation of self-entitled bully phenomenon.

A small token for the victim, will hopefully bring us a step closer to social change.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, please pass on this video and raise awareness that there is a cancer that exists in Philippine society - the rich and powerful bully the poor - and this has to stop.

story:
I will be traveling in September 2012 as a Family Nurse Practitioner with a team of 13 UCLA nursing students to Uganda, East Africa. For 2 weeks we will be participating in clinical service projects in collaboration with Bringing Hope to the Family and Global Support Mission. We will be working to provide six free medical outreaches encompassing triage, patient consults, laboratory (malaria, HIV, syphilis and Typhoid testing), pharmacy and HIV/AIDS and malaria education to the local community. 

             The areas of service that we will be providing are based off of careful research on the health statistics for this region of Uganda. Unfortunately, Kaihura is plagued by malaria, high infant mortality rates, and HIV/AIDS. I have a specific passion/interest in oral re-hydration therapy education and implementation for mother's with young children. 1 in 7 children in Uganda die before their 5th birthday, according to The 2006 Uganda Demographic and Health Survey (UDHS). This rate may be reduced with proper oral re-hydration therapy.

             I'm inviting you to be a part of this journey with me. I’m asking for financial assistance for the mission. Myself, and each of the student's on the team are responsible for raising at least $2,000 in order to make this experience a reality. With these funds, we hope to support the communities we’ll be visiting during our trip. Any contribution you might be able to offer is greatly appreciated.

Please donate through the paypall account on this IndieGoGo campaign site.

             I’ll be carrying with me throughout this experience all of the people who have been a source of support and wisdom in my life. Please know that you will be with me in this journey, and I look forward to sharing stories of what I learn with you throughout the experience, and hearing your perspective as well. Thank you for whatever support you might be able to offer.

 -Hannah Bampton, RN, MSN, FNP

story:
UPDATE 10/24/12 @ 1:25 pm

HEEEEY YOOOOOU GUUUYS!!

This is huge news!!! I had a long talk with Katie Gonzalez, the Executive Director of the service dog organization that we are working with. She was completely overcome with joy and gratitude for what all of you have done, not just for me, but for others. You have given her renewed faith of the good in people.

I asked her who of the people waiting to receive a service dog are the most in need of a service dog and quickly. We talked about two of the most disabled people and how much they really need the assistance.

One of them is a young woman named Jessica, she has cerebral palsy and related syndromes and is a quadriplegic. She was also diagnosed with leukemia in 2010 and is now in remission. She has dedicated her life to cerebral palsy research funding, cancer research funding, and turning pediatric oncology units from drab hospital floors to "rainforests". Even with her challenges, she gives to others freely. She has been waiting a very long time for a service dog and has essentially run out of people who can help by donating, and since she rarely gets out, her network is small.

Here's the best part:

I get to call Jessica and tell her that SHE IS GETTING HER SERVICE DOG...NOW!!!

YOU donated enough money to make this happen for her! Right now! You are giving her a miracle. I am so grateful.

AND

There is another girl, Kathleen, a spunky, loving girl. She's also a teenager with permanent brain disorders and serious mobility challenges. The amount of money you raised will not only get Jessica her dog, but will put Kathleen within $2,500.00 from getting her service dog! I will be calling her next week to give her this great news as well.

What all of you who donated have done is nothing short of a miracle. Your kindness and generosity is touching people's lives and filling their hearts. You all had the trainers in tears last night. You made a huge difference in my life and so many others.

I will never be able to thank you enough, but I will live my life trying. I promise. I love you turkeys. I really really love you.

P.S. If you didn't donate, but would like to help get Kathleen to her goal sooner, you can donate through my IndieGoGo page that Amy, Kate, and Mare set up. If we could get Kathleen her dog too (putting this campaign at $20,702), just think of the incredible impact your generosity would have on them. On the world, really.

As ever,
I'll eat you up I love you so. xo
-Sara Santiago

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

UPDATE 10/23/12 @ 8:45 am

Many people have asked if they can still donate on behalf of the other disabled people waiting to receive the service dogs that they need so desperately. Four of them are small children. If you wish to help, you can donate through this campaign - everything raised above what is needed for Sara will be donated directly to the children on the waiting list. Many of them are not blessed with Sara's amazing community of kind and generous human beings. Love you. xo

UPDATE 10/23/12 7:35 am


Last night, Sara wrote a blog post, thanking everyone for their support. 

 

UPDATE 10/16/12 7:17 pm

Our cups runneth over.

You turkeys have renewed our faith in humanity – and have proven that Milwaukeeans are the best people. Ever.

We are so overwhelmed by your support and love for Sara.

Do you think we can reach $15,000?

Let’s do this.

Because no one deserves our support more than Sara.

- Team Sara

 __

If there's one thing we know about the people of Wisconsin, it's that they have some of the biggest hearts of anyone anywhere. This is especially true of Milwaukee. 

Milwaukeeans have hearts the size of Texas (and, let's be honest, better beer).

Milwaukee, one of our own needs a little help.

You know her. You love her. And if you don't know her, you are missing out. Sara Santiago is the most loving, giving, smart, funny, snarky, thoughtful and talented woman we've ever met. *

We know you want to help. And she could use some right now.

After several months with increasing epileptic episodes and the continued weakness, incapacitating pain, and mobility challenges due to her related neurological conditions, our dear friend, @sarasantiago, was encouraged to apply to a service dog training and placement organization. After completing the application process, Sara and her extended family participated in an interview with the organization, and she was accepted into the program. 

A Seizure and Mobility Assistance Dog will keep Sara safe both during and after a seizure. It will be trained to alert someone nearby or to use a specialized "phone" to dial a pre-programmed number if she is alone, and bring her its special vest that may hold a prepaid cell phone, medication and anything else Sara might need. The dog will also be trained to keep Sara from physically putting herself in an unsafe situation. (It is possible for Sara to continue walking during certain types of seizures, albeit in an altered state of consciousness.) It will be able to assist her in getting up from a lying down or seated position, help to stabilize her when she is having a bad balance day, and will be trained to retrieve things for her, should she be too weak to do it on her own.

For her safety, we want Sara to receive this incredible dog as soon as possible. 

This is where you come in.

Seizure and Mobility Assistance Dogs are highly trained and expensive. They go through up to two years of specialized training before they are able to be placed with someone in need. 
 
It is the goal of the organization providing Sara's service dog that all dogs are placed at no cost to the disabled handler. "We understand the importance of adding a service dog to your life. We would never want finances to be the deciding factor. Each dog's training, medical, and boarding comes to an average of $10,000.00, which is covered through fundraising efforts for the organization."

Your contribution will help cover the cost of training, boarding and medical care for Sara's service dog while it is going through its rigorous preparation to assist Sara, as well as airfare and a hotel room for the family while they work with the professional handlers for two weeks to transfer the service dog into Sara's care as its new handler.

Please consider opening your hearts (and your wallets, duh).

We can't do this without you.

In the words of Sara, We'll eat you up, we love you so.

If you have a few (or a lot) of dollars to spare, please consider contributing to this campaign. Every little bit will get Sara one step closer to receiving the incredible gift of this service dog. 

Funds contributed to this campaign through Indie Go Go are the efforts of Sara's devoted friends and family and are not tax-deductible. Any additional funds raised through this campaign will be given directly to the organization training Sara's service dog, to help cover the costs of training other medical assistance dogs for the many people in need. 

If you have any questions, please contact amykant@gmail.com or kdbarrie@gmail.com. 

* True Story. Check it out, yo.

One of them is a young woman named Jessica, she has cerebral palsy and related syndromes and is a quadriplegic. She was also diagnosed with leukemia in 2010 and is now in remission. She has dedicated her life to cerebral palsy research funding, cancer research funding, and turning pediatric oncology units from drab hospital floors to "rainforests". Even with her challenges, she gives to others freely. She has been waiting a very long time for a service dog and has essentially run out of people who can help by donating, and since she rarely gets out, her network is small.
Here's the best part:
I get to call Jessica and tell her that SHE IS GETTING HER SERVICE DOG...NOW!!!
YOU donated enough money to make this happen for her! Right now! You are giving her a miracle. I am so grateful.
AND
There is another girl, Kathleen, a spunky, loving girl. She's also a teenager with permanent brain disorders and serious mobility challenges. The amount of money you raised will not only get Jessica her dog, but will put Kathleen within $2,500.00 from getting her service dog! I will be calling her next week to give her this great news as well.
What all of you who donated have done is nothing short of a miracle. Your kindness and generosity is touching people's lives and filling their hearts. You all had the trainers in tears last night. You made a huge difference in my life and so many others.
I will never be able to thank you enough, but I will live my life trying. I promise. I love you turkeys. I really really love you.
P.S. If you didn't donate, but would like to help get Kathleen to her goal sooner, you can donate through my IndieGoGo page that Amy, Kate, and Mare set up. If we could get Kathleen her dog too (putting this campaign at $20,702), just think of the incredible impact your generosity would have on them. On the world, really.
As ever, I'll eat you up I love you so. xo-Sara Santiago
♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥
UPDATE 10/23/12 @ 8:45 am
Many people have asked if they can still donate on behalf of the other disabled people waiting to receive the service dogs that they need so desperately. Four of them are small children. If you wish to help, you can donate through this campaign - everything raised above what is needed for Sara will be donated directly to the children on the waiting list. Many of them are not blessed with Sara's amazing community of kind and generous human beings. Love you. xo
UPDATE 10/23/12 7:35 am
Last night, Sara wrote a blog post, thanking everyone for their support. 
 
UPDATE 10/16/12 7:17 pm
Our cups runneth over.
You turkeys have renewed our faith in humanity – and have proven that Milwaukeeans are the best people. Ever.
We are so overwhelmed by your support and love for Sara.
Do you think we can reach $15,000?
Let’s do this.
Because no one deserves our support more than Sara.
- Team Sara
 __
If there's one thing we know about the people of Wisconsin, it's that they have some of the biggest hearts of anyone anywhere. This is especially true of Milwaukee. 
Milwaukeeans have hearts the size of Texas (and, let's be honest, better beer).

Milwaukee, one of our own needs a little help.

You know her. You love her. And if you don't know her, you are missing out. Sara Santiago is the most loving, giving, smart, funny, snarky, thoughtful and talented woman we've ever met. *

We know you want to help. And she could use some right now.
After several months with increasing epileptic episodes and the continued weakness, incapacitating pain, and mobility challenges due to her related neurological conditions, our dear friend, @sarasantiago, was encouraged to apply to a service dog training and placement organization. After completing the application process, Sara and her extended family participated in an interview with the organization, and she was accepted into the program. 
A Seizure and Mobility Assistance Dog will keep Sara safe both during and after a seizure. It will be trained to alert someone nearby or to use a specialized "phone" to dial a pre-programmed number if she is alone, and bring her its special vest that may hold a prepaid cell phone, medication and anything else Sara might need. The dog will also be trained to keep Sara from physically putting herself in an unsafe situation. (It is possible for Sara to continue walking during certain types of seizures, albeit in an altered state of consciousness.) It will be able to assist her in getting up from a lying down or seated position, help to stabilize her when she is having a bad balance day, and will be trained to retrieve things for her, should she be too weak to do it on her own.
For her safety, we want Sara to receive this incredible dog as soon as possible. 

This is where you come in.

Seizure and Mobility Assistance Dogs are highly trained and expensive. They go through up to two years of specialized training before they are able to be placed with someone in need. 
 
It is the goal of the organization providing Sara's service dog that all dogs are placed at no cost to the disabled handler. "We understand the importance of adding a service dog to your life. We would never want finances to be the deciding factor. Each dog's training, medical, and boarding comes to an average of $10,000.00, which is covered through fundraising efforts for the organization."

Your contribution will help cover the cost of training, boarding and medical care for Sara's service dog while it is going through its rigorous preparation to assist Sara, as well as airfare and a hotel room for the family while they work with the professional handlers for two weeks to transfer the service dog into Sara's care as its new handler.

Please consider opening your hearts (and your wallets, duh).
We can't do this without you.
In the words of Sara, We'll eat you up, we love you so.

If you have a few (or a lot) of dollars to spare, please consider contributing to this campaign. Every little bit will get Sara one step closer to receiving the incredible gift of this service dog. 
Funds contributed to this campaign through Indie Go Go are the efforts of Sara's devoted friends and family and are not tax-deductible. Any additional funds raised through this campaign will be given directly to the organization training Sara's service dog, to help cover the costs of training other medical assistance dogs for the many people in need. 

If you have any questions, please contact amykant@gmail.com or kdbarrie@gmail.com. 
* True Story. Check it out, yo.

story:
We are Wirenet International and we started the first and only International Association of Internet Consumers (IAIC). Our goal is to gather members interested in saving funds and earning, and all with great entertainment. What we are pushing most important is the preservation of the environment and the promotion of "green" activities, events, education and bringing people from all over the world who want to make our planet more beautiful.

What do we have?

We own proactive portal, where each activity is measured as the cost savings on the one hand, and saving emissions on the other.

 

Goal

Our goal is to unite and connect the people all around the world, and through gamefication processes proactive contribute of enviorment protection.We encourage you to start thinking about global pollution and greenshouse effect, through subsidize compensation of CO2 emissions (footprint offseting).

Life is a game!

We already started and made basic info portal and first service (carpooling). From here, everything else started 

We are the first company with carpooling service in the region. Our web portal is located and settled in a way, that can easily be used on a global scale.

Currently, our project "PodeliTroškove" is activly followed on Facebook social network page https://www.facebook.com/PodeliTroskove which is localized in Serbian language, and currently has more than 30,000 fans, which provides a lot of opportunities for education, interaction, recognition and enforcement activities along with current and future customers.

And how big will be our community in a few years? We are sure it will be much bigger! We'll see 

 

Founds we need will be invested in software developement, project organisation and marketing.

Once started, collected funds (see Funds below) we want to invest in projects protecting the environment at the local level, both in the countries where we already have a franchise, and others, where we'll get a new franchise partners. The funds will be primarily used for projects that will be implemented in these countries, and in case it gets surplus funds or a higher priority is activated on another country, the funds can be diverted to other projects.

This is precisely the reason why the international fund will be used by decision committee responsible for managing the funds.

The projects to be done are:

  • Afforestation and placement of green spaces, parks and ecological environments in local urban areas.
  • Education through trainings, seminars, promotional activities and increasing awareness of the importance of environmental protection and green campaigns will be conducted via internet, social networks, with even greater impact and results.
  • Help local organizations for environmental protection in the form of support and assistance to the projects.
  • Renewable electricity - Electricity from renewable energy sources can be cheap. Lots of countries and companies uses wind energy, solar, biomass, and water currents to produce electricity for a long time. These resources are free and available to us on a daily basis to use.

 

Project components and software solutions :

Members backend (already done)

Transportation

  • Carpooling (already done)

  • Carsharing (developement already started)

  • Bikesharing (developement already started)

  • Parksharing (developement already started)

Trading

  • Green product shopping mall (almost done)

  • Second hand shop and trading

  • Green Energy trading

  • Carbo Credits trading

Production

  • Share the farm

Education

  • Rent a Green Man

 

If you want to know more about each part of project download attached document with full description here and visit gallery for more documents.

 

Funds

Sources of funding for these projects are commercial and non-commercial.

Non commercial includes: grants, membership dues (as gratitude to the members, will be planted tree, grove, forest ..), monetary compensation emissions, support of the ministries and government institutions, as well as support of local organizations and funds that are oriented towards environmental protection.

The commercial includes: Franchising, renting individual shops within the shopping mall on the website, as well as services related to the maintenance of your store within the portal (monthly maintenance, importing new products, etc..), advertising campaign partner corporations, as well as campaigns associations and companies that wants to help the environment.

More than 90% of income from non-commercial sources will continue to be invested in environmental projects, and arranged in order of priority projects.

 

How to thank our members?

As we said save money, earn and have fun. 

Essential element is gamefication, where members through their actions accumulate points, reach a certain level, progress and achieve set targets. This is intended to motivate members in addition, personal satisfaction and proving to the community.

Gamefication can generate a certain income in-kind and cash prizes. Gamefication levels can adapt to country, region, or any other criteria.

To thank you as members and donors, based on accumulated points within gamefication , some fee will be returned to members in very different forms:

  • Subsidizing of compenstate for CO2 pollution: Based on the results achieved through play and entertainment, members generate a number of points that can be used as a substitute for money, amounting to 50% of all subsidies to compensate for CO2 polutins (The other half is paid for and used local projects).

  • Vouchers for discounts and coupons shopping. Based on the results achieved can generate vouchers and coupons with which you can get discounts on products and services in all areas offered.

  • Affiliate commissions for referrals to other customers and their active participation in the projects.

 

That's all folks!

But we want much more from that and it’s the reason we made this concept with unique and affirmative gamification mechanisms, which we’ll support with software services.

That’s why we need YOU!

Become a part of Wirenet green community, and make this planet a better place with us.

story:
The Sen Sok Water Campaign brings water to the Community of Sen Sok in Northwestern Cambodia near the Angkor Temple City. Through this program, over 9,000 villagers will receive the gift of safe water. Very often for those families, it will be the first time they have access to water that will not harm their health of that of their children.

To date, and thanks to the generosity of the Pasadena Rotary Club (CA), four villages, and hundreds of families reveied the gift of safe and clean water. But there is still a long way to go and we'd like to expand access to water in the community with five more wells. Each well costs $1,600 and can bring a sustainable source of water water to a total of 500 families over five villages.

With a $16 donation, you can change an entire family's life! 
Find out how much of difference you can make by learning more about Kok Yeang village where we are working towards bringing new water wells here.

Discover how we work with the villagers here and how five simple steps can ensure the long term sustainability of the wells you help hund here.

Or, learn more and visit us on our site at cfi-asia.org

story:
SAVE LAGU!!

Lagu James is a very sweet, gentle, and friendly 19 year old orphan and personal friend of mine who is currently suffering from health complications of all different kinds; chronic Hepatitus B, Cirrhosis of the liver, as well as bacterial infections and blood blisters  in his esophagus which have recently started bursting and causing him to throw up copious amounts of blood and jello-ey chunks of god knows what, requiring multiple blood transfusions. You can help  save his life without even giving blood!
 
He needs a specific kind of treatment called Sclerotherapy, which impacts the blood vessels, and costs an estimated 2,000 USD.
 
Lagu lives at Cornerstone orphanage in Nimule, South Sudan, which is where I had the pleasure of getting to know him. However the hospitals there are insufficient to meet his needs, and he would need to be transported to Kampala, Uganda, for treatment.
 
3,000 dollars is my estimate to cover the 2,000 dollar treatment plus travel and hospital expenses, but any and all donations are greatly needed and appreciated, as Lagu seems to encounter one health problem after another.
 
Lagu is very special to me, and everybody else at Cornerstone. He has an extraordinary ability to brighten up the compound with his mile-wide smile that greets you as you approach him. I even told him he does not look like Lagu unless he is smiling. He is very compassionate, keeping an eye out for others and asking everybody how they are doing even while he was lying prostrate and helpless on the hospital bed. My words cannot do justice to his character. Help us give him the treatment he needs! If anyone deserves to live a full, happy life, it is someone like Lagu.
 
Lagu means so much to me and the people around him, so if you can contribute ANYTHING, or just spread the word to those who can, I will personally be very grateful. And it will save his life. Thank you so much!
 
-Griffin Barnes
