story:
What is this about?

Janela Sagynbaeva is 24, she's a girl from a village in east Kyrgyzstan. She has to pay a family debt wich is way beyond her financial means. Today, nearly all her time and resources are focused on that effort.

The debt that has accumulated is the result of an unfortunate event.

Janela's Father has been selling fruits in Kazakhstan. The fruits he was selling were not only his but also those of his neighbours. He was supposed to collect and bring back the money to be shared among the villagers. When going back with the money, he was robbed at gunpoint.

Unfortunately, the neighbours requested their money no matter what, hence a $5000 debt. The event had occurend in 1997; since then, through various interest rates and further credits, the debt has risen to $15,000. The current interest rate is 13% which makes it hard for the family to pay the percentage, let alone the initial sum.

What are the consequences?

  • The first and least of all consequences is that Janela had to abandon her high school education. She will use that time to work for the debt. Then she threw away her dreams of singing. No one is saying she would become a famous singer but everyone is entitled to have a dream, a hobby and to pursue it. No singing lessons, all the money she earns goes to the black hole of debt. And while she's at it she abandoned all her remaining dreams as well.
  • She's not going to get married because in Kyrgyzstan, a wife earns money for her husband's family and not her own. It gets worse. Being a single at 24 is considered shameful, especially in the rural areas and the social pressure on Janela is enormous. Besides insults, she risks bridenapping, a custom which consists to kidnap a girl and force her into marriage. In spite of being unlawful this tradition is still common and Janela was already kidnapped once; she managed to call the police and escape.
  • She's working 13 hours a day in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan) in a sewing factory in very poor conditions.
  • When she's not working in Kyrgyzstan, she's working in Siberia, Tomsk region as a salesperson. At her workplace, sexual harassment is common and she isn't exempt from it.
  • Her brother is working on construction sites in Russia in poor conditions also and without security measures.
  • If it all wasn't enough, her mother got ill, at first from too much stress. It has now gotten serious, she has suffered two heart attacks. Her medicine is also costing money.

There are no NGOs helping or that could help besides their abundant numbers in the country. The burocracy involved when seeking official help is endless, expensive and uneffective. There are NGOs for teaching english, new technologies in agriculture but few of them touch the sharks of the banking system.

This page is the main, only and last resort for Janela and her family. If this fails, there is no alternative, there is no plan B. Their house will be seized and they will be on the street or worse. Either way, it will be the end for them.

There is no help from the state like in some european countries for people who are poor, destitute or homeless. There is nothing in the most literal and pure sense of the word.

I can attest from my own experience, I have seen Janela running arround borrowing money from her friends, trying to gather the remaining $200 for the month's interest. I have seen her getting refused everywhere, running from place to place in high heels because she didn't even had time to change from the job interviews. I have gathered these first $200 through a quick donation page on my blog and we sent the money merely 30 minutes before the bank's deadline. If the donations were not be there, the house was seized. That's right, for 200 dollars.

This is not abstract, this is not in 10 years, this is happening now.

Is this a scam?

From my perspective, this question makes me want to throw up. When I'm watching Janela killing herself at work, when we're running accross Bishkek to give the money to the bank to meet a monthly deadline for payment and I hear this kind of doubt, I just feel despair. Despair from the contrast between the ease of doubt on one end and the disastrous consequence on the other.

But I have been travelling for a long time, I have lost much of the western doubt. Doubt is in our culture and it is not a bad trait, on the contrary. Unfortunately, it is hard to lift a doubt just by writing. So I'll say this. My story is hard to prove but if you read something about central asia you will find it more likely. Actually, Janela is not the only person in that situation, she told me herself. A lot of girls sewing side to side do it because of credit in a bank. But Janela is one that I want to help because I have got to know that person and I believe that she, of all people, deserves a shot at life.

I, myself am from western europe, France to be more precise. I have been travelling for four months now, by hitchhiking from Prague (Czech Republic) to Kamchatka (eastern Russia). My way of travelling is very low budget (maximum of 2 euros/day, actually it is more 1$/day now). I don't live in hotels or hostels, I don't pay for transportation, I rely on the help of people. For that reason, I often get closer to the culture than mass tourists do. I get to meet a lot of different people, learn the local language and some of the local customs. My stories can be read on http://takemeeast.net/blog/. I have met Janela because she has helped me way before I knew about her financial problems. She has hosted me at the risk of going against a strong local tradition (an unmarried girl beeing seen with a foreigner is very wrong and it's even worse if she brings him to her family's house) and has never asked money from me.

If you want additional information about me or Janela's situation, I'm a very easy person to find online. You can reach me either on my website: http://takemeeast.net or my facebook page, http://www.facebook.com/takemeeast/.

What is your money for?

  • paying the static sum of $15,000
  • paying the monthly interests so the house isn't seized
  • giving Janela some free time she could spend not working. I'm not talking holiday on the beach, I'm talking about easing her 13 hour/day rhytm so she can have friends and see her family a bit!
  • expenses for Janela's mother's health

The whole story 

This is an excerpt from my travel blog all of which you can read here: http://takemeeast.net/blog/janelas-tragedy/

In 1997, Janela and her family lived a fairly happy life. Her parents were farmers as they are now, with a garden, horses, cows and sheep. Father even had a car. Thanks to his car, Father could sell fruits and vegetables a little further, he could even sell them to Kazakhstan!

Since he has a car, why not share it with the neighbours? That's how Father ended up driving his truck all the way to Kazakhstan with a friend of his. Inside the truck, all the fruits and vegetables from his friends and neighbours, about ten people in total.

Business was a success; they were returning from Astana (capital of Kazakhstan) with about 5000 U.S. dollars in cash.

On the way back, they were stopped and assaulted by thieves. In the steppes of Kazakhstan, organised crime is common; we heard about it first hand when we were there. They beat up Father's friend and took Father to the forest. They took all his money and were about to gun him down.

Janela remembers what he then told his kidnappers:

"I know you can kill me; but if you do; the youngest of my five children will never remember me."

They let him live, maybe because, as we learned in Kazakhstan, even bandits live by a certain code.

When Father returned to his village without the money, he lost all respect from his friends and even from his family.

"Here, if you have nothing, you are not a person.", Janela explains. His own brother abandonned him.

As weird as it may seem to most of my readers, few people from the village cared about his story and they all wanted their money back. And Father kept his promise, he gave back every penny. But at his own expense: he borrowed the sum from a bank. In a country like Kyrgyzstan, $5000 is more than a four year salary. The bank accepted to do him credit but only at the dangerously high percentage of about 13%.

It became soon obvious that the poor fruit and vegetable family business won't be enough to cover the debts. And believe me, banks in Kyrgyzstan have a lot in common with sharks. You don't want to be in their debt. That is why Father had to borrow money from another bank, to give the money back to the first bank.

After a while, he had to borrow from a private person for as high as 50%. Nowadays, the family is nowhere near paying back even the interests, let alone the initial sum. As a result, the debt has soared up to 15,000 dollars which is a sum they just cannot afford.

Father has faced the catastrophe bravely but always honestly. He has sold his sheep, his cows, his car and his horses. He has sold all 4 hectars of his land. His house serves as a guarantee for the bank and therefore it may be siezed.

His children have grown up, two of them have married. They have their own families to care about. Two of them work in russia, desperately trying to pay back the family debt. Janela is one of them. She sells fruits in Russia with an asshole boss who wants to sleep with her. In europe this would be called sexual harassment, nothing less.

Her brother works at a construction site and I am not even starting about the security conditions of such jobs in this region.

This is not enough and they all know it. They are strong people so they keep working and keep hope. But sometimes it is too much. Mother couldn't take the stress anymore, she became very sick and suffered two heart attacks. Everyone is very worried even though they try to hide it. Sometimes it's too much for Janela too. She didn't notice me when I woke up in the morning. I saw her silently praying in her room. I am not one too receptive to emotions but I could feel the desperation in the act.

I know that she needs help, that her hope is a leaking bottle, that she won't hold forever. I don't want her to destroy herself like her mother did. And there are just 15,000 dollars, stupid pieces of paper that separate her from a happy life.

How else can you help?

  • Share this page! Share the blog post about it: http://takemeeast.net/blog/janelas-tragedy/
  • Write them a postcard, an encouragement letter. I don't want to give Janela's address details but you can write at 31, Allée des Mimosas, 83320 Carqueiranne, France. I'll send it along. They only read russian and kyrgyz languages but I'm sure they'll find someone to translate and be very happy about it.

  • If you know someone in the press, please, please, ask them to put up this story! It might help even more than if you had given money.


What will you get?

  • $5: A big thanks from the bottom of our hearts
  • $10: I'll mention you in the help section of my travel site
  • $20: send us a picture of you, It'll appear on the "people who helped" album on the facebook page
  • $50: I'll send you a nice thank you note and maybe even draw a picture on it. But I can't draw. 
  • $100: I don't know man, figure something out, we'll try to do it :)
  • $200: At that point, I think Janela might faint :-). If she does, I'll take a picture and send it to you (with her approval of course)

More information

Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/janelastory/

You also might find information about how Janela's rescue is doing (among other stuff, you'll have to do a little digging):
My travel blog: http://takemeeast.net/blog/

My travel facebook: http://www.facebook.com/takemeeast/
story_txt:
What is this about?
Janela Sagynbaeva is 24, she's a girl from a village in east Kyrgyzstan. She has to pay a family debt wich is way beyond her financial means. Today, nearly all her time and resources are focused on that effort.
The debt that has accumulated is the result of an unfortunate event.
Janela's Father has been selling fruits in Kazakhstan. The fruits he was selling were not only his but also those of his neighbours. He was supposed to collect and bring back the money to be shared among the villagers. When going back with the money, he was robbed at gunpoint.
Unfortunately, the neighbours requested their money no matter what, hence a $5000 debt. The event had occurend in 1997; since then, through various interest rates and further credits, the debt has risen to $15,000. The current interest rate is 13% which makes it hard for the family to pay the percentage, let alone the initial sum.
What are the consequences?


The first and least of all consequences is that Janela had to abandon her high school education. She will use that time to work for the debt. Then she threw away her dreams of singing. No one is saying she would become a famous singer but everyone is entitled to have a dream, a hobby and to pursue it. No singing lessons, all the money she earns goes to the black hole of debt. And while she's at it she abandoned all her remaining dreams as well.

She's not going to get married because in Kyrgyzstan, a wife earns money for her husband's family and not her own. It gets worse. Being a single at 24 is considered shameful, especially in the rural areas and the social pressure on Janela is enormous. Besides insults, she risks bridenapping, a custom which consists to kidnap a girl and force her into marriage. In spite of being unlawful this tradition is still common and Janela was already kidnapped once; she managed to call the police and escape.


She's working 13 hours a day in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan) in a sewing factory in very poor conditions.

When she's not working in Kyrgyzstan, she's working in Siberia, Tomsk region as a salesperson. At her workplace, sexual harassment is common and she isn't exempt from it.

Her brother is working on construction sites in Russia in poor conditions also and without security measures.

If it all wasn't enough, her mother got ill, at first from too much stress. It has now gotten serious, she has suffered two heart attacks. Her medicine is also costing money.



There are no NGOs helping or that could help besides their abundant numbers in the country. The burocracy involved when seeking official help is endless, expensive and uneffective. There are NGOs for teaching english, new technologies in agriculture but few of them touch the sharks of the banking system.
This page is the main, only and last resort for Janela and her family. If this fails, there is no alternative, there is no plan B. Their house will be seized and they will be on the street or worse. Either way, it will be the end for them.
There is no help from the state like in some european countries for people who are poor, destitute or homeless. There is nothing in the most literal and pure sense of the word.
I can attest from my own experience, I have seen Janela running arround borrowing money from her friends, trying to gather the remaining $200 for the month's interest. I have seen her getting refused everywhere, running from place to place in high heels because she didn't even had time to change from the job interviews. I have gathered these first $200 through a quick donation page on my blog and we sent the money merely 30 minutes before the bank's deadline. If the donations were not be there, the house was seized. That's right, for 200 dollars.
This is not abstract, this is not in 10 years, this is happening now.
Is this a scam?
From my perspective, this question makes me want to throw up. When I'm watching Janela killing herself at work, when we're running accross Bishkek to give the money to the bank to meet a monthly deadline for payment and I hear this kind of doubt, I just feel despair. Despair from the contrast between the ease of doubt on one end and the disastrous consequence on the other.
But I have been travelling for a long time, I have lost much of the western doubt. Doubt is in our culture and it is not a bad trait, on the contrary. Unfortunately, it is hard to lift a doubt just by writing. So I'll say this. My story is hard to prove but if you read something about central asia you will find it more likely. Actually, Janela is not the only person in that situation, she told me herself. A lot of girls sewing side to side do it because of credit in a bank. But Janela is one that I want to help because I have got to know that person and I believe that she, of all people, deserves a shot at life.
I, myself am from western europe, France to be more precise. I have been travelling for four months now, by hitchhiking from Prague (Czech Republic) to Kamchatka (eastern Russia). My way of travelling is very low budget (maximum of 2 euros/day, actually it is more 1$/day now). I don't live in hotels or hostels, I don't pay for transportation, I rely on the help of people. For that reason, I often get closer to the culture than mass tourists do. I get to meet a lot of different people, learn the local language and some of the local customs. My stories can be read on http://takemeeast.net/blog/. I have met Janela because she has helped me way before I knew about her financial problems. She has hosted me at the risk of going against a strong local tradition (an unmarried girl beeing seen with a foreigner is very wrong and it's even worse if she brings him to her family's house) and has never asked money from me.
If you want additional information about me or Janela's situation, I'm a very easy person to find online. You can reach me either on my website: http://takemeeast.net or my facebook page, http://www.facebook.com/takemeeast/.
What is your money for?


paying the static sum of $15,000

paying the monthly interests so the house isn't seized
giving Janela some free time she could spend not working. I'm not talking holiday on the beach, I'm talking about easing her 13 hour/day rhytm so she can have friends and see her family a bit!

expenses for Janela's mother's health



The whole story 
This is an excerpt from my travel blog all of which you can read here: http://takemeeast.net/blog/janelas-tragedy/
In 1997, Janela and her family lived a fairly happy life. Her parents were farmers as they are now, with a garden, horses, cows and sheep. Father even had a car. Thanks to his car, Father could sell fruits and vegetables a little further, he could even sell them to Kazakhstan!
Since he has a car, why not share it with the neighbours? That's how Father ended up driving his truck all the way to Kazakhstan with a friend of his. Inside the truck, all the fruits and vegetables from his friends and neighbours, about ten people in total.
Business was a success; they were returning from Astana (capital of Kazakhstan) with about 5000 U.S. dollars in cash.
On the way back, they were stopped and assaulted by thieves. In the steppes of Kazakhstan, organised crime is common; we heard about it first hand when we were there. They beat up Father's friend and took Father to the forest. They took all his money and were about to gun him down.
Janela remembers what he then told his kidnappers:
"I know you can kill me; but if you do; the youngest of my five children will never remember me."
They let him live, maybe because, as we learned in Kazakhstan, even bandits live by a certain code.
When Father returned to his village without the money, he lost all respect from his friends and even from his family.
"Here, if you have nothing, you are not a person.", Janela explains. His own brother abandonned him.
As weird as it may seem to most of my readers, few people from the village cared about his story and they all wanted their money back. And Father kept his promise, he gave back every penny. But at his own expense: he borrowed the sum from a bank. In a country like Kyrgyzstan, $5000 is more than a four year salary. The bank accepted to do him credit but only at the dangerously high percentage of about 13%.
It became soon obvious that the poor fruit and vegetable family business won't be enough to cover the debts. And believe me, banks in Kyrgyzstan have a lot in common with sharks. You don't want to be in their debt. That is why Father had to borrow money from another bank, to give the money back to the first bank.
After a while, he had to borrow from a private person for as high as 50%. Nowadays, the family is nowhere near paying back even the interests, let alone the initial sum. As a result, the debt has soared up to 15,000 dollars which is a sum they just cannot afford.
Father has faced the catastrophe bravely but always honestly. He has sold his sheep, his cows, his car and his horses. He has sold all 4 hectars of his land. His house serves as a guarantee for the bank and therefore it may be siezed.
His children have grown up, two of them have married. They have their own families to care about. Two of them work in russia, desperately trying to pay back the family debt. Janela is one of them. She sells fruits in Russia with an asshole boss who wants to sleep with her. In europe this would be called sexual harassment, nothing less.
Her brother works at a construction site and I am not even starting about the security conditions of such jobs in this region.
This is not enough and they all know it. They are strong people so they keep working and keep hope. But sometimes it is too much. Mother couldn't take the stress anymore, she became very sick and suffered two heart attacks. Everyone is very worried even though they try to hide it. Sometimes it's too much for Janela too. She didn't notice me when I woke up in the morning. I saw her silently praying in her room. I am not one too receptive to emotions but I could feel the desperation in the act.
I know that she needs help, that her hope is a leaking bottle, that she won't hold forever. I don't want her to destroy herself like her mother did. And there are just 15,000 dollars, stupid pieces of paper that separate her from a happy life.
How else can you help?


Share this page! Share the blog post about it: http://takemeeast.net/blog/janelas-tragedy/

Write them a postcard, an encouragement letter. I don't want to give Janela's address details but you can write at 31, Allée des Mimosas, 83320 Carqueiranne, France. I'll send it along. They only read russian and kyrgyz languages but I'm sure they'll find someone to translate and be very happy about it.


If you know someone in the press, please, please, ask them to put up this story! It might help even more than if you had given money.




What will you get?


$5: A big thanks from the bottom of our hearts

$10: I'll mention you in the help section of my travel site

$20: send us a picture of you, It'll appear on the "people who helped" album on the facebook page
$50: I'll send you a nice thank you note and maybe even draw a picture on it. But I can't draw. 
$100: I don't know man, figure something out, we'll try to do it :)
$200: At that point, I think Janela might faint :-). If she does, I'll take a picture and send it to you (with her approval of course)

More information
Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/janelastory/
You also might find information about how Janela's rescue is doing (among other stuff, you'll have to do a little digging):My travel blog: http://takemeeast.net/blog/
My travel facebook: http://www.facebook.com/takemeeast/

story:
What is A/WAY?
A/WAY is a microgranting organization that works with community organizations and individuals with creative ideas to better our Albuquerque community. In 2013 we will host:

  • Recurring public dinners funding micro-grants for local creative projects that contribute to the Albuquerque community
  • Hackathons to build websites for these organizations or individuals
  • Junkado, a bike and human powered kentic sculpture parade with a microgranting component

We rely entirely on donations to fund creative projects. A/WAY, formerly called ABQ Sprout, was initally modeled after an international meal-based micro-granting initiative called Sunday Soup; however, we have expanded to include investing in community in other ways!

What did A/WAY accomplish in 2012?

  • We raised $7032 at our dinners, 100% of which went back into the community. 
  • We funded these 10 local projects:
    • Share the Harvest by Rio Grande Community Farms
    • Friends of the Orphan Signs
    • South Valley Seniors Outreach Program
    • Building Futures & Foundations Mentoring Project
    • Learners Chess
    • Seed2Need
    • Open Space Alliance
    • Homework Diner
    • Edible Landscape
    • Centro Salvia
  • We hosted two Hackathons creating websites for local community organizations
  • We presented at Ignite NM twice
  • We spoke at TEDxABQ, creating and facilitating the experiential portion for the audience. 

What are the goals of A/WAY?

  • Help initiate and fund local innovative, creative projects that benefit the ABQ community
  • Facilitate bringing ideas to reality
  • Bridge innovators with volunteers
  • Build community relationships and infrastructure

How do A/WAY dinners work?

  • 10 randomly chosen grant proposals present their ideas at a community dinner.
  • Venue, supplies, and locally grown food are donated.
  • Volunteers prepare dinner.
  • Proposals are presented in 5 minute sprouts.
  • Everyone receives a ballot and votes on what they believe best fits Albuquerque’s needs.
  • All sliding scale fees ($15-30) collected at the door for the dinner create the micro-grant awarded to the winner at the end of the evening.

Lean more about our A/WAY Dinners.
Learn more about our Hackathons.
Learn more about our Junkado.

What will we use the funding from this fundraiser for?

Dinners
We plan to have two this year. It costs around $1000 per dinner. There are overhead costs that change with every venue and dinner, and include things like venue cost, table & chair rental, liability insurance, food permits, lighting, and some food costs. However, the microgrant for winners come from the sliding scale fee of the dinner.

Junkado
Our overhead costs for the Junkado parade will cost $1,000 and include overtime for law enforcement and promotion.

story:
On behalf of Women Rights Initiative,

(WORI) is an action oriented women’s organization that was founded in 2007 by three young women to respond and arise to the challenges of human and women’s rights, fighting poverty, creating awareness on Sexual Reproductive Health and Rights, capacity building in leadership and governance at grass root levels.

We envision a society free from violence recognizes the needs and rights of women and youths and on a mission to empower women and youth to advocate against violence through human rights education, skills and information sharing to strengthen capacities and visibility.

Over the last four years WORI has been campaigning to raise awareness on domestic violence, in the eastern region of Uganda, Increasingly victims have been awakened and are coming out to seek help that can enable them come out of the abusive environment. On a weekly basis WORI receives 10 to 17 cases of victims who seek counseling, space for a night, health care as well as legal Aid advice. This is however difficult as we lack a decent facility and resources to enable them rest with their children and figure out a plan that can enable them embark on having peaceful and violent free lives together with their families.

WORI needs funds to acquire land to enable the shelter stand. Money well sacrificed will enable women and children discover their value as unique and precious children of God.

At this stage the project needs 10,566 us dollars to acquire land for construction of a shelter for victims of domestic and gender based violence.

 Domestic and Gender Based Violence is widespread in Uganda, with estimates of 60% of women experiencing violence weekly. Gender Based Violence  is highest in rural areas, if women only have a primary education, or if women are employed but not for cash. Gender Based Violence  varies on geographical area, with the Eastern area having the highest prevalence of violence at 75.3%

With the anticipated outcome WORI hopes to have a fully constructed shelter in Jinja with the ability to accommodate at least 30 victims per night, provide basic needs emergency medical care, cloths, legal aid services and above all counseling and psycho social support.

Women Rights Initiative has extensive experience working with women who have been abused. We are currently conducting community sensitization and holding break the silence action groups where victims share experiences on how they can overcome violence heal, and move on after experiencing violence. The increase awareness has increased the number of victims that report cases and seek for counseling, health care, legal aid as well as a safe shelter. We have faith that with our experience we will be able to not only administer but provide lasting solutions to survivors of violence.

It is anticipated that  people may not be willing to join the campaign and donate for the cause because the shelter concept is new in Uganda; however, WORI will ensure continuous awareness and fundraising efforts to make the concept familiar and believable.

  Take a step, be a change agent because a violence free society is a prerequisite to development.

story:
UPDATE December 11 2014: Car is in the shop and a fuel pump is being installed, but the starter is also bad on the car.

In June of 2003, I was called in to work on a Sunday morning at my maintenance job in Pawleys Island/Litchfield Beach SC. I was lifting banquet tables when pressure started in my back. I continued working until I finished my assignment. After going home my wife talked me into calling my supervisor and telling him about what happened. He suggested going to the ER where I was given treatment for muscle spasms and prescribed meds and physical therapy. I worked on light duty for a month before being sent to a specialist only to learn I had ruptured every level of my thoracic spine. I was told surgery was NOT an option and was given 7 Epidurals in a 6 month period. I later learned that I had Bi-Lateral Avascualar Necrosis in my hips. I was 35 years old. Doctors do not like to replace hips in people under 50. Due to the injuries in my back and hips, I filed for an after 4 attempts, got approved for Social Security Disability. My medicine alone is over $100 a month with 2 insurances.

My car (2007 Chevrolet Uplander) broke down a few months ago and I have been told it needs a fuel pump. I need my car to make Doctor appts and run errands to pay bills and what not. It is VERY humbling when you can no longer work or provide and you have to ask for help. I am asking anyone who reads this: Please help me to get my car back running so that I do not have to worry about finding a ride. God Bless in advance and Merry Christmas.

story:
Update!

Thank you for your support! Thanks to you, we've achieved our initial goal of $20,000 in the very first day and were the top trending technology campaign on Indiegogo. But we are not stopping there... With the momentum we've got going and your help, let's really expand the Presence Security compatible products. How about Presence compatible lighting, thermostats, and IP cameras? That's right! Help us reach these stretch goals and we will accelerate our development efforts and deliver them at a very nice price:

Our new stretch goals:

  1. $75,000 - We will enable an Internet connected and Presence compatible light bulb. - UNLOCKED!
  2. $100,000 - We will enable an Internet connected and Presence compatible thermostat.
  3. $150,000 - We will enable a Presence compatible IP camera.



What is Presence Security?

Presence is the award-winning free app that turns old smartphones and tablets into Wi-Fi security cameras and you can download it today from the App Store or Google Play.

Presence Security is the addition of easy to install wireless sensors that notify you and your trusted circle when something important happens to fit with today's mobile lifestyle. Best of all, no monthly fees are required! We want security to be affordable for everyone because we all have homes, loved ones and valuables that we want to protect.


Why create Presence Security?

"My mother's home was broken into twice! Imagine her anxiety, fear, and frustration. I called a name brand security company for help and they quoted $1,800 to install a security system, plus $48 a month. That's crazy expensive and our solution is twice as good for almost ten times less!"
- Gene Wang, Co-Founder and CEO

"My younger brother was overseas during a cold winter, when the heater in his house failed. The temperature dropped, the pipes froze, and his house flooded. It was days before his neighbors noticed, and by then, there was more than $30,000 in damages to his home. If he had the Presence Security temperature sensor and water sensor back then, his friends could have come to the rescue before there was such an expensive problem."
- David Moss, Co-Founder and CTO


What's in the Packs?

The Presence Security Entry Pack gets you started by protecting two entries and adding motion detection where you need it most.


The Presence Security Pack covers all the bases and these amazing sensors turn your house into a smart home in minutes.


The Presence Security Premium Pack will take your home to the next level keeping a watchful eye over many different rooms and entrances.









More about the entry sensor:

More about the water sensor:


  • 2" Inside the Window Sticker: Stick these static cling stickers on the inside of any window to show passers by that your house is secured.

  • 6" Inside the Window Sticker: A larger octagon version that also goes inside any window. See that you house is secured from the street.

  • Best Out-of-Box Experience: Open the box, scan the Presence Gateway and place your sensors around the house. You'll be up and running in minutes. If you're planning on moving, Presence Security will easily move with you.

  • Access from Anywhere: Use iOS, Android or a web browsers to manage Presence Security.


  • Friends & Family: Enlist the help of your trusted circle of family and friends to get alerts from your home and check if things are okay.

  • Open to Endless Possibilities: Developers and researchers will love our completely Open APIs. Teach your Presence Security system new tricks, create your own apps and analytics, or expand the existing Presence app with your own devices and sensors. Check out the Application API at http://docs.fabruxapps.apiary.io, or sign up at http://fabrux.peoplepowerco.com to add your sensors and gadgets directly into the Presence mobile app.

  • No Monthly Fees: No contracts. No commitments. No stress. Unlimited sensors. Unlimited cameras. Unlimited rules. Unlimited alerts. Unlimited Friends and Family. Unlimited Sharing.


Presence Security expands on Presence to deliver a complete security solution for your home and mobile lifestyle that is convenient and flexible. Go out in the world and do your thing and let Presence Security keep a watchful eye on the things you care about most.

Plus, Presence Security makes neighborhood watch mobile and available anywhere. Invite your trusted circle of family, friends, and neighbors to help protect your home and loved ones when you are on vacation, sleeping, or simply away from home.

Here's how it works. Say you're going on vacation and plan to disconnect for awhile. First, invite someone using the friends list in Presence and grant them access to the alerts from your home while you're in "Vacation" mode. Then when you switch into Vacation mode, your alerts will be automatically shared with the people you've selected, so they can stop by and have a look when you can't.

Crime is a serious problem everywhere. In 2013, there was $4.5 Billion in property losses from crime, and 74% of that was from residential burglaries. Let's face it, anyone can fall victim to crime at anytime. But securing your mobile lifestyle might be even more important. We're talking about like seeing if your kids get home safely, making sure your garage door is closed, and seeing if your pet's water dish is empty all from your smartphone from anywhere. Do all this and more with Presence Security. Many folks have already paid the big bucks for traditional security systems to protect themselves. Get even better protection with Presence Security for much less.

Protect the people and things you love most. That's why we built Presence to give anyone with a spare device a chance to protect their home and loved ones absolutely FREE. Here are just a few of the many stories that Presence users have shared with us:

If you like what you see here, please support us. Help us define the future of home security! Be the first in your neighborhood to put Presence Security to work. We will work tirelessly to deliver a world-class security solution that will bring you and your family peace of mind. Your smartphone is about to learn some new tricks. Plus, you are putting the things that are most important to you first - your family, your home, your pets - by providing them with the best protection for the money.

FAQ

Q: How easy is it to install Presence Security?
A: Extremely easy.

  1. Download the Presence app to your smartphone and sign in.
  2. Tap the "Add Device" button and scan the QR code on the back of your gateway. Plug your gateway into ethernet and USB power. A video plays in the app showing what to do next, which also puts the gateway into pairing mode.
  3. Pull the battery tab on a sensor and wait for 10 seconds. The sensor will pair automatically to the gateway, and you will be asked to give it a name.
  4. Peel off the sticky backing on the sensor and place it where you want it to go.

Q: How many sensors can a single gateway support?
A: 25

Q: Can I add multiple gateways to my home?
A: Absolutely. Your Presence app supports unlimited devices and gateways.

Q: Can you add ZigBee or Z-Wave Sensors, or just "Presence" Sensors?
A: The current gateway supports ZigBee Green Power and ZigBee Home Automation, and can connect many different types of devices that already exist in the market. The Presence app layers the UI's and rules on top of those devices, so new devices are usually brought into the app under careful quality assurance to offer the best experience for our users. The Presence app, and the FabrUX cloud software that powers it, connects to many other devices, clouds, and protocols.

Q: What is the wireless range of the sensors?
A: Our range testing shows about 2-3x the performance of WiFi. We are consistently seeing about 130+ feet indoors, through 4 walls. In the same test, WiFi connected about 30-60 feet through 2 walls.

Q: What is the lifetime of the batteries? What type of batteries? Does the motion sensor need to be connected to a power source?
A: The sensors are extremely low power and are expected to last 2 - 5 years on batteries, depending on use. Most sensors use a CR2032 Lithium coin cell battery, which makes them small and unobtrusive and has a shelf life of 10+ years. The motion sensor users 2x AA batteries.

See http://www.edn.com/design/power-management/4421334/2/Long-Live-Coin-Cells--Getting-years-of-battery-life-from-small-batteries-in-low-power-devices

Q: Will I be able to purchase individual sensors?
A: Yes. We will be offering sensors available for individual purchase on the Presence store at http://presencepro.com/store.

Q: In the video you show an old smartphone as a camera, but I don't see a smartphone included in the Presence Security packs?
A: Presence can transform old smartphones and tablets into free Internet security cameras. It's optional, and you'll have to provide your own. This works on iPhone 3GS and newer, iPad 2 and newer, iPod Touch 4th and 5th generation, and Android 4.0 and newer. Used smartphones capable of running as a Presence camera can be found on Amazon.com for less than $40, no cellular service is required. You can do this right now by searching for 'webcam' and downloading the Presence app on the app store.

Q: In the video, what is that robotic mount that holds the camera? Is it required?
A: This is an optional add-on to Presence, called a Motrr Galileo. It is not required. It can be purchased directly on the Presence Store at http://presencepro.com/store/

Q: Can the Presence app installed on your primary phone detect when you leave the house and automatically arm all the sensors?
A: Yes, we are in the process of adding Geofencing to Presence. This feature will first be available on iOS, and then on Android.

Q: Any plans for a siren?
A: Yes! The Presence camera features a built-in siren. Create a rule like, "If my 'Front door' opens and I am away, then make my 'Presence cam' activate the alarm." When triggered, the alarm will go off at maximum volume, and won't exit until a valid password is typed in to the app. If you just want an audible alert in the background whenever someone opens the door for example, you can also make your camera beep once, beep twice, or beep three times instead of sounding the alarm.

Q: Can you connect any wireless video camera to this system?
A: At this time Presence only supports the free Presence camera, by turning a spare smartphone or tablet into a free Internet security camera. If we achieve our stretch goals, we'll be adding connected IP cameras to the mix.

Q: I'm a developer. Can I connect my own gadgets to Presence?
A: Absolutely. Sign up at http://fabrux.peoplepowerco.com to learn how to connect up your own devices into Presence, and customize your own device UI's.

Q: How does this differ from other smart home systems?
A: Every company in the smart home space has to have some basic table stakes: connectivity with various protocols, mobile apps, and sometimes a rules engine (that is usually not optimized for mobile!). Presence simply does more. Instead of a technology-centric bottoms-up design that starts with a solution looking for a problem, we took a unique user-centric and top-down approach to the design of Presence, designing for real-life scenarios that really matter.

  • Presence is the only smart home solution that truly starts free by giving users free security cameras.
  • We are a mobile first company. We believe people experience smart homes as added features on their smart phones.
  • We have moved beyond the basic smart home and 1990's style security systems, into smart communities. Presence does this by allowing your home to intelligently share alerts and notifications with your trusted circle of friends, family, and neighbors, at the times you specify. Other smart home systems simply aren't there yet.
  • The rules engine in FabrUX (the cloud software behind Presence) is optimized for the mobile experience, and enables an intuitive natural language way to orchestrate all the connected products in homes and offices.
  • Our API's are completely open, and developers can create their own apps or instantly add their own connected devices directly into the Presence mobile app, with completely customizable device UI's.
  • Unlike other smart home systems, Presence Security features unlimited devices, unlimited cameras, unlimited rules, unlimited alerts, unlimited friends, and unlimited sharing, with no subscription fees required.
  • The out-of-box setup is designed to be so simple, even the most non-technical person will find it easy to install.
Presence Security represents the future of home security.

Q: When are you shipping?
A: We're currently on schedule for delivery in August. (The early orders of Presence Security Packs should arrive in late July.)

FREE shipping in the United States. Ships worldwide. We will contact you if additional fees are required to ship to your international address (duties/taxes not included).
story_txt:
Update!
Thank you for your support! Thanks to you, we've achieved our initial goal of $20,000 in the very first day and were the top trending technology campaign on Indiegogo. But we are not stopping there... With the momentum we've got going and your help, let's really expand the Presence Security compatible products. How about Presence compatible lighting, thermostats, and IP cameras? That's right!  Help us reach these stretch goals and we will accelerate our development efforts and deliver them at a very nice price:
Our new stretch goals:


$75,000 - We will enable an Internet connected and Presence compatible light bulb. - UNLOCKED!


$100,000 - We will enable an Internet connected and Presence compatible thermostat.

$150,000  - We will enable a Presence compatible IP camera.




What is Presence Security?
Presence is the award-winning free app that turns old smartphones and tablets into Wi-Fi security cameras and you can download it today from the App Store or Google Play.
Presence Security is the addition of easy to install wireless sensors that notify you and your trusted circle when something important happens to fit with today's mobile lifestyle. Best of all, no monthly fees are required! We want security to be affordable for everyone because we all have homes, loved ones and valuables that we want to protect.

Why create Presence Security?
"My mother's home was broken into twice! Imagine her anxiety, fear, and frustration. I called a name brand security company for help and they quoted $1,800 to install a security system, plus $48 a month. That's crazy expensive and our solution is twice as good for almost ten times less!"
- Gene Wang, Co-Founder and CEO
"My younger brother was overseas during a cold winter, when the heater in his house failed. The temperature dropped, the pipes froze, and his house flooded. It was days before his neighbors noticed, and by then, there was more than $30,000 in damages to his home. If he had the Presence Security temperature sensor and water sensor back then, his friends could have come to the rescue before there was such an expensive problem."
- David Moss, Co-Founder and CTO

What's in the Packs?

The Presence Security Entry Pack gets you started by protecting two entries and adding motion detection where you need it most.


The Presence Security Pack covers all the bases and these amazing sensors turn your house into a smart home in minutes.


The Presence Security Premium Pack will take your home to the next level keeping a watchful eye over many different rooms and entrances.
















More about the entry sensor:

More about the water sensor:






2" Inside the Window Sticker: Stick these static cling stickers on the inside of any window to show passers by that your house is secured.




6" Inside the Window Sticker: A larger octagon version that also goes inside any window. See that you house is secured from the street.



Best Out-of-Box Experience: Open the box, scan the Presence Gateway and place your sensors around the house. You'll be up and running in minutes. If you're planning on moving, Presence Security will easily move with you.



Access from Anywhere: Use iOS, Android or a web browsers to manage Presence Security.




Friends & Family: Enlist the help of your trusted circle of family and friends to get alerts from your home and check if things are okay.



Open to Endless Possibilities: Developers and researchers will love our completely Open APIs. Teach your Presence Security system new tricks, create your own apps and analytics, or expand the existing Presence app with your own devices and sensors. Check out the Application API at http://docs.fabruxapps.apiary.io, or sign up at http://fabrux.peoplepowerco.com to add your sensors and gadgets directly into the Presence mobile app.



No Monthly Fees: No contracts. No commitments. No stress. Unlimited sensors. Unlimited cameras. Unlimited rules. Unlimited alerts. Unlimited Friends and Family. Unlimited Sharing.




Presence Security expands on Presence to deliver a complete security solution for your home and mobile lifestyle that is convenient and flexible. Go out in the world and do your thing and let Presence Security keep a watchful eye on the things you care about most.
Plus, Presence Security makes neighborhood watch mobile and available anywhere. Invite your trusted circle of family, friends, and neighbors to help protect your home and loved ones when you are on vacation, sleeping, or simply away from home.
Here's how it works. Say you're going on vacation and plan to disconnect for awhile. First, invite someone using the friends list in Presence and grant them access to the alerts from your home while you're in "Vacation" mode. Then when you switch into Vacation mode, your alerts will be automatically shared with the people you've selected, so they can stop by and have a look when you can't.

Crime is a serious problem everywhere. In 2013, there was $4.5 Billion in property losses from crime, and 74% of that was from residential burglaries. Let's face it, anyone can fall victim to crime at anytime. But securing your mobile lifestyle might be even more important. We're talking about like seeing if your kids get home safely, making sure your garage door is closed, and seeing if your pet's water dish is empty all from your smartphone from anywhere. Do all this and more with Presence Security. Many folks have already paid the big bucks for traditional security systems to protect themselves. Get even better protection with Presence Security for much less.
Protect the people and things you love most. That's why we built Presence to give anyone with a spare device a chance to protect their home and loved ones absolutely FREE. Here are just a few of the many stories that Presence users have shared with us:

story:
What is Pro Haapamäki?

Pro Haapamäki in a non-profit organizing yearly events for everyone having ties to, or other interests, toward the historical "railroad town" of Haapamäki, Finland, founded around 1880.

What We Need & What You Get

This three (3) day event, from June 26th to 28th, is organized and brought to life by volunteers. Events include i.e. art exhibitions, football, class reunions, nostalgic steam engine rides, bands, etc.

We promote the event via dedicated blog, Facebook, giving out interviews and writing to local papers. What we need from you is funding for four (4) road side banners to attract- and remind people in more traditional way.

Select perk that suits you best. Attend brunch and meet old and new friends, get mentioned or get your (company's) name printed on the banners!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's just fine, too! You can spread the word via indiegogo's share tools. 

Mikä on Pro Haapamäki?

Pro Haapamäki on kesäisin Haapamäellä (Keuruu, Keski-Suomi) järjestettävä tapahtuma kaikille, jotka ovat kiinnostuneet Haapamäestä. Pro Haapamäki -päivät saivat alkunsa vuonna 2014. Idea päivistä syntyi Facebookin Pro Haapamäki -ryhmässä.

Mitä me tarvitsemme & mitä sinä saat?

Kolmipäiväinen tapahtuma järjestetään täysin vapaaehtoisvoimin. Tänä vuonna tapahtuma on viikko juhannuksen jälkeen, 26-28.6.

Luvassa on kylän täydeltä tapahtumia. Myös Ukko-Pekka Markkinat ovat samana viikonloppuna Höyryveturipuistossa.

Ohjelma alkaa Haapamäen urheilukentältä ja Wanhalta. Myös Suojan suosittu musiikkibrunssikin saa jatkoa. Ohjelmasta vastaavat paikalliset yhdistykset, seurat ja aktiivit.

Promoamme tapahtumaa Pro Haapamäen omassa blogissa, Facebookissa ja mediassa. Nyt keräämme avustusta mainoslakanoiden valmistamiseen. Yksi lakana maksaa 250 euroa.

Valitse siis itsellesi sopiva tapa olla mukana tukemassa tapahtumaa. Osallistu brunssille, tapaa vanhoja tuttuja Wanhalla tai Yhtenäiskoululla - tai saa firmasi tai oma nimesi Pro Haapamäen mainoslakanaan!

Muita tapoja auttaa

Jokainen on tervetullut kantamaan kortensa kekoon tapahtuman onnistumiseksi. Vapaaehtoistyöntekijät ovat tervetulleita useampaankin tapahtumapisteeseen. Otat yhteyttä: prohaapamaki@gmail.com

story:
When I began my journey as a hair stylist, I had no idea that I would one day rebel against standard practices in the beauty industry. Within my first year, I worked with five color lines and four styling lines. Several were cruelty free, however all used ammonia and other ingredients that I now know can cause issues - both for the stylist and client - such as contact dermatitis, respiratory problems, and cancer.

Three years later, I had changed to a cruelty-free lifestyle and was unable to find a salon in Denver that felt right, let alone used products that were vegan and wouldn't cause issues for my clients. Thanks to support from friends, clients, and family, I was able to open my own cruelty-free salon, Ametrine Salon, two years ago! Today I'm excited to announce that we have a new home on Sante Fe Drive, near art galleries and taco stands!

We need your support to make 1145 Santa Fe the salon you've all been waiting for! Our plan is to add an outdoor lounge within the front gate, and bring on a second botanic based & synthetic fragrance free product line. With your help, Ametrine will become the amazing, welcoming space it's meant to be!

We have planned to bring OWay on for some time to meet demand from allergenic clients. However, as a small boutique line, opening orders are prohibitively expensive. $5,000 will allow us to place the initial order of the entire OWay line and create a plant filled shaded space outside for all of you to relax in, have your color process, or wait for your appointment. The area just outside of Ametrine already exists, but making it an enjoyable space to relax in will not be possible until next year without your support!

As a thank you, we are offering perks that are a blend of services and products. Both Original&Mineral and OWay are exclusive to Ametrine Salon in Denver and we are so excited to share them with you. This is an opportunity for you to try new products that will transform your hair!

At the end of the campaign, we will also have a grand opening party at Renegade Brewing (only two blocks away!). There will be a door prize drawing with the opportunity to win amazing services, products and gift cards from other local vegan businesses. All proceeds from the drawing will go to 4 nonprofits chosen for 2016. Starting in September we will also begin donating a portion of sales to a different nonprofit each month!

Your contribution will provide us with the capability to enhance your experience at Ametrine Salon. We have grown organically by word of mouth and social media in the past 2 years - each day becoming better & busier. Having the opportunity to create a storefront space that is 100% vegan + conscious is amazing in itself - and we invite you to join in making it better!

story:
Kansas City, Here We Come!

Pots on Wheels (POW!) is a non-profit mobile pottery and outreach project. We're heading to Kansas City in March for the National Council on Education for the Ceramic Arts (NCECA) convention, and you can help us get there.


We're a group of six potters from New England who've outfitted a big yellow van as a pottery gallery. For the past year we've been bringing local ceramics programs to underserved communities and all kinds of people in the Northeast, but now for the first time we are taking the truck on a road trip to the Midwest. We'll be offering workshops and other programming to anyone who'd like to participate. No experience necessary! You can watch others make pottery – or you can roll up your sleeves and get dirty yourself.

Along the way from New England to Missouri, we'll stop several times to offer people the chance to make pottery. Once we get to Kansas City, our truck will be parked in the vibrant Crossroads District for easy access to any and all. We're planning a free program for local school children in Kansas City, and on exhibit in the gallery will be a celebration of clay and community, "In Situ: Pottery Tours and Clay Culture".


What's in it for you? Aside from the great feeling that you've helped make this trip possible, we're offering a few perks to say "thanks!" Choose from a stylish T-shirt, a nifty cap, or go all out for a sponsorship that gets your name out there for all to see. And be sure to take a look at our trip map, to see if we're stopping near you--we hope to see you on the road!  

Cow mug by Hannah Niswonger $100
story_txt:
Kansas City, Here We Come!Pots on Wheels (POW!) is a non-profit mobile pottery and outreach project. We're heading to Kansas City in March for the National Council on Education for the Ceramic Arts (NCECA) convention, and you can help us get there. 
We're a group of six potters from New England who've outfitted a big yellow van as a pottery gallery. For the past year we've been bringing local ceramics programs to underserved communities and all kinds of people in the Northeast, but now for the first time we are taking the truck on a road trip to the Midwest. We'll be offering workshops and other programming to anyone who'd like to participate. No experience necessary! You can watch others make pottery – or you can roll up your sleeves and get dirty yourself.Along the way from New England to Missouri, we'll stop several times to offer people the chance to make pottery. Once we get to Kansas City, our truck will be parked in the vibrant Crossroads District for easy access to any and all. We're planning a free program for local school children in Kansas City, and on exhibit in the gallery will be a celebration of clay and community, "In Situ: Pottery Tours and Clay Culture".
What's in it for you? Aside from the great feeling that you've helped make this trip possible, we're offering a few perks to say "thanks!" Choose from a stylish T-shirt, a nifty cap, or go all out for a sponsorship that gets your name out there for all to see. And be sure to take a look at our trip map, to see if we're stopping near you--we hope to see you on the road!  
Cow mug by Hannah Niswonger $100

story:
A Passion for Beer

From test batches made on a dirty kitchen stove in Allston, Mass. to being available in 3 states, a commitment to quality has earned us the respect of customers, peers and mortal enemies alike.  

Our Own Home

The catch is, we haven't had a brewery of our own this whole time.  We've been brewing in other people's breweries where we can, and it has been a great way to start, but we are ready to take the next big step to open our own brewery and tap room. The brewery will allow us to make more great beer and give us the flexibility to experiment even more than we already do.

Community

The tap room will give you a place to come and hang out with us while you enjoy delicious craft beverages- but more than that, it will give us a chance to make a difference in our community by supporting local art, music and neighborhood organizations. We are serious about having a positive impact and being a force for good with this project, or at least as serious as we are about anything... (just kidding, totally very serious...mostly)

What We Need & What You Get

Opening what will be just the 5th brewery in Boston proper is no small task, but with your help we can make it happen.  Our $30k goal is what we'll need to put the finishing touches on our taproom and really bring it to life and make it special. 

We value your contributions and are showing our thanks with a slew of awesome rewards. 

The Rewards:

 

Founder's Glass:

 

Founder's Tee Shirt:

 

 

Founder's Hoodie:

 

 

The Collective Membership:

 

 

The Collective Members' Glass:

The Collective Members' Tee Shirt:

 

 

The Impact

The past 5 years have been leading up to this moment.  We searched far and wide and finally have a place that will be perfect for the brewery of our dreams.  Your contribution to this project represents a very unique opportunity to be a part of something special and impactful. 

Thanks so much for checking our campaign out - if you can't contribute, please consider sharing this with your friends and helping us spread the word!

Sincerely, 

The Backlash Team

story:
OUR STORY

Aaron and Sarah Wooten, the owners of Cranford Cove, have been big supporters of Greeley's historic downtown since they moved to Greeley in 2006. In June 2013, a space opened up next door to Cafe Panache on 10th Street downtown. Even though it was in pretty rough shape and needed a full renovation (not kidding - the previous tenant was a trash wear and tattoo shop complete with a stripper pole), Aaron and Sarah saw an opportunity to invest in the city that they love. They leased the space, and after much hard labor, Cranford Cove Tea Tavern was born.

For the past three years, Cranford Cove has served downtown Greeley as a place to linger over coffee, cocktails, or local beer, delight in loose leaf tea, experience delicious fast-casual dining, and savor local live music.

In addition to supporting local musicians, Cranford Cove is heavily involved in the community, advocating for and donating to local charities that fight sex trafficking, District 6 school district, and the local library. We like to get our neighborhood moving--Cranford Cove hosts a weekly run club free to all runners. 

 

OUR PLANS

We are so excited to build onto Cranford Cove with you and grow this wonderful community with an expansive menu and a renovation of our current space including air conditioning, more seating, and a great outdoor patio.

We will expand Cranford Cove next door into the space previously occupied by Cafe Panache. We've excelled in bringing you inventive drinks and delicious baked goods, and you've made us into Greeley's favorite stop for grabbing lunch with a friend. With the addition of the Cafe Panache space, we want to bring you incredible dinners, too. We will consolidate and improve upon the kitchen, ultimately building a proper commercial kitchen equipped for full restaurant and bakery use.

We will renovate the Cafe Panache space into a formal dining space, more than doubling our current seating capacity.

Simultaneously, we plan on expanding outside behind Cranford's to create an intimate, fenced patio for breezy imbibing day and night. We will expand our liquor license to include the new outdoor seating, so your favorite local brews and creative cocktails can be savored under the sun and moon behind Cranford Cove.

We often have local bands and musicians play at Cranford's, and we love that you guys come out to sip wine with us while  jamming to the tunes. A permanent, intimate music venue at Cranford Cove will bring live music to the shop throughout the week, giving more opportunities for you to discover Greeley's talents.

 

WHO WE ARE

That welcoming vibe you feel when you walk into The Cove? That's Aaron. That delectable blend of tea you smell wafting up from the counter? That's Aaron. Since its inception, Aaron Wooten is the brains behind Cranford Cove. Starting with just $300 in the bank, Aaron has grown Cranford Cove into a Downtown fixture. His skills include Human Resources, event planning, management, and local networking. He has a background in leadership development, a Bachelor's in communication, a Master's in Divinity. 

Ken King brings over 40 years of restaurant ownership and expertise to the leadership team of Cranford Cove and is instrumental in mentoring and helping to guide the overall trajectory of the expansion. Ken has owned five restaurants in the state of Colorado, receiving several awards for his cuisine.

 

COOL PERKS FOR YOU

Oh boy, we had a lot of fun coming up with ways to say a huge "thank you" to you guys. We appreciate every single ounce of support you choose to send our way, and are so proud that you are joining with us in this endeavor. In addition to thank-you postcards and discounted drinks, food, and gifts, we have a few unique things to help us say thanks.

HEY! CHRISTMAS IS COMING! A lot of these perks make excellent gifts. We are happy to save any perks you purchase for Christmas delivery. Please choose your perks now, and once the campaign is over we will contact you to ask if you would like your perks delivered immediately or if you would like them sent in early December. Great gifts include the Giftcard Bundles, Personalized Tea Chest, Tea of the Month Club Memberships, and branded mug and travel bottle.

Proudly show your support with Cranford Cove mugs, travel bottles, and T-shirts. This isn't standard branded fare--we've chosen some neat "campfire" mugs to bless with our name. These mugs are dark blue, thick-walled ceramic, and speckled all over with white glaze. It's classic camping gear all grown up for your kitchen table. The double-wall insulated stainless steel bottle will keep drinks cold for more than 10 hours and hot for 8. This must-have perk is detailed with a gorgeous wood pattern on the outside fit for the yoga studio or your favorite hike.

 

Looking for a great gift for a UNC student or for a recent high school grad headed to UNC this fall? Grab a Cranford Cove Black Card good for unlimited tea, espresso, and coffee for a year. It's basically like hiring a tutor for your beloved college attendee. But hey, this doesn't have to be just for students--it's a great way to save money if you come to Cranford Cove a lot.

Do you often say "thank you" with a gift card? Our Gift Card Bundles come with a coupon for free food and/or drink, so while you're busy being generous and giving stuff to other people, you can enjoy some Cranford's for yourself, too. 

For the true tea lovers out there (treat yo'self!), our personalized tea chest is sure to put the "oooo" in oolong. A set of three custom-blended loose leaf teas, personalized to your tastes and desires, created and mixed by blendmaster Aaron himself, are packaged in tins and arranged in a wooden storage chest. The perk comes with a detailed booklet of information, origins of the teas, and brewing instructions.

For our faraway friends, the Out-of-Town tea Lover's Bundle keeps you in tea and in love with Cranford Cove. Start with the customized tea chest, travel mug, travel bottle, and a year of membership into the Tea of the Month club, ensuring that you are stocked with our premium loose leaf.

Fans of our popular 10th Street Supper Club might drool over this prime experience: an exclusive wine-paired dinner for two or eight at Cranford Cove. On top of the delicious food and drink, each guest will receive a Cranford Cove branded wine glass to take home.

If you want to hang out and dance with all of your friends, throw a private concert at Cranford Cove with live music from a local band, cocktails, beer, wine, and light fare for your guests. A great option for parties of any kind. After the campaign, we will contact you to plan your awesome party!

 

Now for the perk you've been waiting for your whole life (no? just me?)--have a sandwich, crepe, or specialty drink named after you. Cross this one off your list of life goals! This perk gives you the naming rights to one of these items. The title is up to you and can range from being as simple as your own name to being a creative, goofy representation of your whole gang of friends. If you choose this perk, we will contact you by email after the campaign to get the ball rolling. The "naming rights" perk also comes with an attractive certificate detailing and authenticating your item naming signed by Cranford Cove staff that you can frame and hang in your home, as well as a round of your new signature item for you and three friends.

Invest in Cranford Cove, get passive income: if you are eager to directly invest in Downtown Greeley, consider purchasing a share of Cranford Cove. Through this campaign, we are offering ownership percentages at the $5,000 and $10,000 levels. Please contact us for a full run-down of the business numbers, where we've been, and where we are headed; we would love to meet with you and share our passion face to face.

 

JOIN US IN OTHER WAYS

Get the word out and help us continue to transform Downtown Greeley! Share this campaign with friends and family through social media, emails, and always by word of mouth. Bring your friends to Cranford Cove and show them who we are. Thank you!

 

HOW IS THE MONEY BEING SPENT?

We chose to use flexible funding for the campaign so that no matter what amount is contributed, we can continue working towards our expansion goals. We are adding AC, an intimate music venue, a full-service kitchen, new menu items, more seating, and an outdoor patio to our space no matter what--this money will help us get there faster. The order in which these things are accomplished will be largely determined by the amount contributed. Remember, Aaron started Cranford Cove with a $300 renovation budget; imagine what we can do with $35,000!

 

 

 
 
 
If you are looking for investment opportunity, please contact Aaron Wooten to set up a meeting. Cranford Cove is currently seeking investors.

story:
Anyone in the SCA knows, the biggest best event of the year is Pennsic.  For everyone.  Whether you are a merchant, a fencer, fighter or just a participant.  But unlike most people, for the merchant a lot of the battle is getting there, so that you can make your money.


It's been a tough year for us.  We've been struggling like everyone else, and we need funds to help us get to pennsic.    We're offering you items at very close to retail as perks.  We just need some up front money to get us there and through the door.  You will have our undying gratitude for your help.

At the $25 perk level, we will send you a handmade gem in a bottle necklace just for you.  (Ask about color choices)

At the $50 perk level we will make a leather pouch for you.

Pennsic pickup for these items may be possible depending on demand.  Just ask.

Pennsic is one of the biggest events every year for vendors.  If we cannot get to it the impact on our family will be great.  
I understand many of you are in the same situation as we are.  If you can't contribute, please share our campaign on any social media site you use.  Any exposure we get can help us reach our goal.
Please feel free to peruse our website, etsy store and ebay store.  Maybe you'll find something you can't live without.  That will help too.
Finally, thank you for reading this to the end.  I know a lot of people have a lot of campaigns up, and we appreciate your taking the time to read ours through to the end.
