story:
Hello everybody! We are Luke and Reyne and Paisley Collie, a devoted and hardworking family who recently moved out from Vancouver to small town Alberta. We have been planning for a long time to run ourselves a small cafe/bistro with the extensive cumulative experience we have among us, and believe we have stumbled upon the most perfect opportunity we could have hoped for.

We intend to revive the currently empty Blackbird Cafe. It is located in a converted Roman Catholic church, circa 1905, in the town of Coleman, AB. The building is absolutely gorgeous, as anyone who has been inside it can attest to. Our pitch image is of the original painted ceiling in the main cafe area, and below is a shot of one of the half dozen stunning stained glass windows. The acoustics are also incredible and there is a rather impressive list of musicians who are eager to play on a regular basis. It is located directly on Highway 3 in the Crowsnest Pass, which would of course allow for some amazing foot traffic throughout the year, as lots of people head that way from the Calgary area towards Fernie for skiing in the winter and BC in general for the summer. There is also a residence incorporated into the building, which would allow our family to live onsite and consolidate some of our expenses, and generally make things easier for us! This space is almost a dream come true, we don't think we could possibly have found a better opportunity to put our plans into action!

Our lease agreement would include a lot of the equipment we would need, but there are a few bits and pieces, not to mention some personal touches, that we would like to acquire before we open for business. Your contributions would allow us to purchase the needed equipment, get our inventory set up, begin merchandising, produce a website and social networking hub, and if our goal is obtained, transform  it into the music venue of epicness that this place was obviously meant to be. Anything above and beyond our goal would, besides making our hearts explode with joy and thankfulness, go towards a down payment to purchase the building.



Goals and Rewards!


We are looking for $10,000 for start-up capital. We have been tentatively approved for a Leadership Grant of $10-25k, but require matching funds in order to be eligible. If we can procure at least the ten grand in this fashion, it will be doubled, and will blow our socks off, and the Blackbird will become the grooviest joint in Coleman for all time. But if we fall short of the mark, as long as we can pull in at least $5000, we should be able to get up and running as a small operation.


Here is a breakdown of our projected funding allocation:

    If we can make:                       It will go to:

  • $5000                                   espresso machine, till system, inventory
  • $8000                                   merchandise, website and pro graphic design
  • $10,000 ($20,000)           music equip and stage, building make-over
  • <                                             down payment on building

We are very pleased to offer perks to our supporters, and we hope you can feel the overwhelming gratitude coming from our souls as well!


At the $10 pledge level you get your choice of a sticker or badge with our logo!

At the $25 pledge level you get a ceramic coffee mug and your choice of a sticker or badge, all with our logo!

At the $50 pledge level you get a $20 gift certificate for the Blackbird, and your choice of a sticker or badge!

At the $100 pledge level, in addition to the mug and choice of sticker or badge, you will receive two complimentary tickets to the musical event of your choice that is being hosted at the Blackbird, with a value of up to $30 per ticket. Tickets may be redeemed separately for different events if desired. No more than two complimentary tickets in total per event, first come first serve. Please contact us ASAP when the event you wish to attend is announced to secure your spot!

At the $500 pledge level you will receive all of the rewards offered thus far! Sticker, badge, mug, $20 gift certificate and two complimentary tickets to the event(s) of your choice with the restrictions mentioned above. You will also receive a personal mention and thanks on our website as a much appreciated investor.

At the $1000 pledge level you will receive every reward offered, as well as FREE COFFEE FOR LIFE! That's right, every time you set your blessed and generous feet on our premises you will be anointed with delicious beverages and hailed as our personal savior! No blasphemy intended, and with a limit of one regular coffee per visit. Oh, and your praises will be sung online as well, through our website and social media portals!


Also, please note: If we do surpass our minimum funding requirement, we would like to have some professional branding done, which means that this logo design could end up being a limited edition! 


Why?


This is a goal that Luke and Reyne have been envisioning for quite a few years now. Luke has the experience any cafe owner would die for, and Reyne has the background for the bookkeeping, website design, merchandising and retail end, not to mention a divine passion for tea. We truly believe we are a dream team, and we have never seen such a promising location within our reach. This place deserves to be revived, it has a wonderful history, in an incredible location, and musicians like Lester Quitzau, Fred Eaglesmith, Garnet Rogers, Bocephus King, The Warped 45's, etc, contacting US to come play the venue. If we can get this off the ground, it will be just a magical time for us, and we would love it if you thought so too and decided to be a part of it with us. Thanks you guys for even being interested enough to read this far, we appreciate it!


The Risks


One of the things we are considering is the timing. If we get the funds together, we will be taking over the cafe in September, which is a slow season. Although winter will see decent traffic from resort goers off the highway, the fall will be considered an off season. We plan to use this time to tweak our set up, menu, floorplan, and hopefully get a few smaller reno's in as well, without having to close up shop. So it could be as much of a blessing as a hindrance, and we will make the best of it!

Another thing I'd like to mention is the merchandise rewards we have offered as perks. If we fall really close to the $5000 minimum, there will most likely be a wait for fulfillment on those, as merchandising will not be an immediate priority until we have secured a decent revenue, We will be as open and honest as we can about the progress, and promise to stay in contact with regular updates and posts. It will happen, no worries! 


Also!


We really appreciate the support of everyone and thanks to all who choose to help us out with a pledge. We understand if you are unable at this time to do so, and want you to know you'll be so welcome at our cafe regardless! If you are interested in helping us out in another way, we would sure be happy if you could share this and send it to everyone you know who may be interested in supporting a new start-up business. There are share tools built in to Indigogo so it should be relatively easy! 

Also, if you have any musical connections who might be interested in performing at this amazing venue, please pass our info on to them as well and let them know we would be delighted to talk about a possible show once we're ready to go.

 

That's all there is to it, folks! I hope everyone is as excited as we are and will find the opportunity to drop by when we're installed in our new life! We can't wait to see you and serve you the best Americano you've ever had in the most amazing atmosphere you've ever sat down in!

Catch you on the flipside.   ;D
story_txt:
Hello everybody! We are Luke and Reyne and Paisley Collie, a devoted and hardworking family who recently moved out from Vancouver to small town Alberta. We have been planning for a long time to run ourselves a small cafe/bistro with the extensive cumulative experience we have among us, and believe we have stumbled upon the most perfect opportunity we could have hoped for.
We intend to revive the currently empty Blackbird Cafe. It is located in a converted Roman Catholic church, circa 1905, in the town of Coleman, AB. The building is absolutely gorgeous, as anyone who has been inside it can attest to. Our pitch image is of the original painted ceiling in the main cafe area, and below is a shot of one of the half dozen stunning stained glass windows. The acoustics are also incredible and there is a rather impressive list of musicians who are eager to play on a regular basis. It is located directly on Highway 3 in the Crowsnest Pass, which would of course allow for some amazing foot traffic throughout the year, as lots of people head that way from the Calgary area towards Fernie for skiing in the winter and BC in general for the summer. There is also a residence incorporated into the building, which would allow our family to live onsite and consolidate some of our expenses, and generally make things easier for us! This space is almost a dream come true, we don't think we could possibly have found a better opportunity to put our plans into action!
Our lease agreement would include a lot of the equipment we would need, but there are a few bits and pieces, not to mention some personal touches, that we would like to acquire before we open for business. Your contributions would allow us to purchase the needed equipment, get our inventory set up, begin merchandising, produce a website and social networking hub, and if our goal is obtained, transform  it into the music venue of epicness that this place was obviously meant to be. Anything above and beyond our goal would, besides making our hearts explode with joy and thankfulness, go towards a down payment to purchase the building.




Goals and Rewards!
 We are looking for $10,000 for start-up capital. We have been tentatively approved for a Leadership Grant of $10-25k, but require matching funds in order to be eligible. If we can procure at least the ten grand in this fashion, it will be doubled, and will blow our socks off, and the Blackbird will become the grooviest joint in Coleman for all time. But if we fall short of the mark, as long as we can pull in at least $5000, we should be able to get up and running as a small operation.


Here is a breakdown of our projected funding allocation:
    If we can make:                       It will go to:


$5000                                   espresso machine, till system, inventory


$8000                                   merchandise, website and pro graphic design


$10,000 ($20,000)           music equip and stage, building make-over


<                                             down payment on building





We are very pleased to offer perks to our supporters, and we hope you can feel the overwhelming gratitude coming from our souls as well!
At the $10 pledge level you get your choice of a sticker or badge with our logo!
At the $25 pledge level you get a ceramic coffee mug and your choice of a sticker or badge, all with our logo!
At the $50 pledge level you get a $20 gift certificate for the Blackbird, and your choice of a sticker or badge!
At the $100 pledge level, in addition to the mug and choice of sticker or badge, you will receive two complimentary tickets to the musical event of your choice that is being hosted at the Blackbird, with a value of up to $30 per ticket. Tickets may be redeemed separately for different events if desired. No more than two complimentary tickets in total per event, first come first serve. Please contact us ASAP when the event you wish to attend is announced to secure your spot!
At the $500 pledge level you will receive all of the rewards offered thus far! Sticker, badge, mug, $20 gift certificate and two complimentary tickets to the event(s) of your choice with the restrictions mentioned above. You will also receive a personal mention and thanks on our website as a much appreciated investor.
At the $1000 pledge level you will receive every reward offered, as well as FREE COFFEE FOR LIFE! That's right, every time you set your blessed and generous feet on our premises you will be anointed with delicious beverages and hailed as our personal savior! No blasphemy intended, and with a limit of one regular coffee per visit. Oh, and your praises will be sung online as well, through our website and social media portals!

Also, please note: If we do surpass our minimum funding requirement, we would like to have some professional branding done, which means that this logo design could end up being a limited edition! 



Why?

This is a goal that Luke and Reyne have been envisioning for quite a few years now. Luke has the experience any cafe owner would die for, and Reyne has the background for the bookkeeping, website design, merchandising and retail end, not to mention a divine passion for tea. We truly believe we are a dream team, and we have never seen such a promising location within our reach. This place deserves to be revived, it has a wonderful history, in an incredible location, and musicians like Lester Quitzau, Fred Eaglesmith, Garnet Rogers, Bocephus King, The Warped 45's, etc, contacting US to come play the venue. If we can get this off the ground, it will be just a magical time for us, and we would love it if you thought so too and decided to be a part of it with us. Thanks you guys for even being interested enough to read this far, we appreciate it!



The Risks

One of the things we are considering is the timing. If we get the funds together, we will be taking over the cafe in September, which is a slow season. Although winter will see decent traffic from resort goers off the highway, the fall will be considered an off season. We plan to use this time to tweak our set up, menu, floorplan, and hopefully get a few smaller reno's in as well, without having to close up shop. So it could be as much of a blessing as a hindrance, and we will make the best of it!Another thing I'd like to mention is the merchandise rewards we have offered as perks. If we fall really close to the $5000 minimum, there will most likely be a wait for fulfillment on those, as merchandising will not be an immediate priority until we have secured a decent revenue, We will be as open and honest as we can about the progress, and promise to stay in contact with regular updates and posts. It will happen, no worries! 


Also!

We really appreciate the support of everyone and thanks to all who choose to help us out with a pledge. We understand if you are unable at this time to do so, and want you to know you'll be so welcome at our cafe regardless! If you are interested in helping us out in another way, we would sure be happy if you could share this and send it to everyone you know who may be interested in supporting a new start-up business. There are share tools built in to Indigogo so it should be relatively easy! 

Also, if you have any musical connections who might be interested in performing at this amazing venue, please pass our info on to them as well and let them know we would be delighted to talk about a possible show once we're ready to go.

 
That's all there is to it, folks! I hope everyone is as excited as we are and will find the opportunity to drop by when we're installed in our new life! We can't wait to see you and serve you the best Americano you've ever had in the most amazing atmosphere you've ever sat down in!
Catch you on the flipside.   ;D

story:
Short Summary

Our Goal

The Freedom Burger and UP Macaroons are food products that are very common in our area that is why our first goal was to build a different impression to the customer. How? We have our own home-made recipe for the products.

The Small Business will be the source of our income to support our studies as college students because we want to become successful using our own creativity and being less dependent to our parents. 

Who are we?

My name is Kristine Irah Lunes,

22 years old and I am the one who thought that the project Freedom Burger and UP Macaroons is a great business plan. The story of the idea begins when my bestfriend Christan Dan Tecson

(21 years old) and I were talking about the future and other hobbies that we could make while we're still in college. I was thinking that since I love cooking, I love business and Christan at the same time is also a business-minded man, it can really happen.


I started to make UP Macaroons at home and boom! I had a 150 dozens order for only 3 weeks. Yes, my macaroons are completely different from others because I made my own recipe with four distiguish flavors ( mango, strawberry, yam and buko pandan).I was so happy that time and I thought it's really amazing to start some business here near my school. But the problem came up while planning. Other people were looking for other type of food. Yeah burgers are common in all areas but this time I have a new idea. Actually the name Freedom reflects to the service I am planning to give to every customer that I will serve. Freedom because every customer have their rights to choose their preferred ingredients from the type of buns or bread up to the condiments and etc. My home-made patties (chicken, beef, pork) will also contribute to it's popularity since I have a different recipe for all of this.



Then, my UP macaroons will also be presented in the small burger restaurant I am planning to since it can be a potential dessert/ delicacy that is also available for take-outs. 

The money from this campaign will allow us to put a place wherein I can start to serve larger amount of people in a most convenient way and in a comfortable room. 

The funds will also give us the opportunity to continue and to grow our plans to meet the people's satisfaction in our area especially we're planning to start the business outside the University wherein all types of people are looking for something new, something to try and most of all something to eat!

Reaching our goal $2,500 would be a great achievement for us and if we are able to reach beyond our goal, it will be a very big help to continue our exciting ways of making unique ingredients for our Burger and different flavors for our macaroons. We're also looking forward to launch other products in our restaurant in the future.


    Risks & Challenges

    Growing any kind of business has many challenges! In our case, a food project requires different ingredients, and different ingredients could be seasonal and their prices may vary all the time. There are also lots of competitors existing in the are that we're planning to put up the Freedom Burger and UP Macaroons Project.  We're also thinking that hiring or looking for someone we could depend the business when we're busy at other things would be a problem someday.

    Knowing all of the possible consequences, we're planning to make a survey and list of all ingredients to monitor the prices and which season should we buy more certain ingredients so we need to increase our storage facilities. We also need to innovate our products by giving extra effort of making different and unique products as possible. And lastly, we should learn to trust other people and try to communicate well in order to have good outcomes in and outside the business.

    As long as we know how to do it and how to grow it, I know, we can survive and we can be successful in a short period of time.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We're very lucky to have this opportunity like others to express our ideas and gain different types of help from different types of people at the same time. You can also help us through indiegogo tools by spreading to your friends about our planned project, what we're planning to do, and our about our goals.You can also support us not only just by money but also through sharing opinions and suggestions. These things would be very helpful for the success of our project.

story:
MTG Players Need Easier Ways To Connect

With nearly 60,000 subscribers on Youtube I hear the same story all the time, in fact, it's true of myself too!  People love to play magic but they don't always have a local shop or have an existing playgroup.  How do you find people to play with other than word of mouth?  There simply is NO easy way.

My goal is to create an interface where new and old magic players can easily find other gamers in their area with similar interests and make it easier to play the game we all love.


Here is how the shell of this app is going to work. 


People with existing home pages will be able to list their game type, location, times, and whatever other useful information they might need.  Then, people looking for a home page will be able to search their local area, by type of game and connect with other players!


Let me give you a very real world example.  Say you want to play a game of EDH, but don't have a play group, find one easily using this application, on the flip side if you run a home game for EDH, but are always looking for new players, you will be able to list your event and meet people looking to play EDH.

This process works if you are looking to do everything.

Standard Deck Testing
Drafting
Trading
Modern Play Testing
So Much More!


For operators of home games or local game shops, the process is simple, fill out your information, the types of games you are running, a sample of times, and other helpful information.  Then you will be entered into the game database.  For players looking for a game, you will come to the application, select what type of game you are looking for, the city you are located in, and the app will deliver results back to you of all local games matching your criteria.  You will then be able to message those running the game, meet some new friends, and play a whole heck of a lot more Magic The Gathering.


At $1500 I can add an amazing MTG meetup application so you can search for a local home game anywhere in the world.  Looking to play casual EDH?  Looking to standard legacy or modern playtest?  You will be able to locate other magic players near you to do all of this.  There is simply no application like this in the entire world and I feel strongly this will be an amazing and FREE tool for magic players all over the world.  This level of the application will be a simple city search, meaning you will be able to search for home games, or game shops by game type and see listings and contact information.


At $2500 I will be able to make that application accessible as an app for both Iphone and android mobile devices.  You will be able to use this application from your phones, anywhere in the world to locate other magic players in your city, contact them for game nights and so much more.


$2500+ Means we get to start adding features that YOU the backers would like to see in this application.  Have something you would like added to this amazing tool for magic players?  At this level we can start to really get crazy!   We can even start to think about tying it with your phones GPS, Facebook integration, more diverse search features and much more.



$3000 Means We can add the "like dislike" system as proposed on reddit.  Rank your experience with a particular player or game shop!


$3500 Means we can start looking at adding GPS functionality to this App!  Have it auto locate where you are instead of being manual!


$4000 Means we can start looking at customizable profiles, trade indicators, local store feedback and more


Check Out The Sleeves!

(actual card sleeve design)



Help Keep The Tradition Going!

Want to support the MTGHeadQuarters community?  Now is the time to pick up your custom HQ Swag!

  • Get A playmat shipped anywhere in the world
  • Help support the channel continue to make the content you love
  • Have a unique LIMITED EDITION Custom Playmat

I am so often humbled by the amazing support of the MTG Community.  I got to personally meet a LOT of you at GP Chicago and it warmed my heart!  I wanted to do something we could all share so I hired an amazing artist to help capture this year in a limited edition playmat for the community.

Check Out The Playmat!


Ajani & Elspeth-A Memory


Risks & Challenges

Being able to do a bulk purchase on these playmats allows us to get a reasonable price for a cool way to show your support to the MTGHQ Youtube community.

  • Purchasing 200 at a time will give us the bulk pricing we need
  • Every mat counts!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have enough cash to donate now for a playmat, the channel always needs support from amazing people like you.  I only do this sort of thing one time a year and would love any help you could provide.

  • If cash isn't your thing, help us out by sharing this to facebook or twitter!

story:
Introduction

In order to have a dairy license so we can sell our milk, cheeses and yogurts to the public, we need to build a milk parlor and a creamery where we can milk our dairy goats then process that milk so we can pastuerize the milk and make delicious cheeses and yogurt. Presently we use our kitchen that doesn't meet the strict Maine dairy guidelines even though we keep it very clean.  People we share our products with love them and we're sure we could sell more to the public.  We also make a really good goat milk soap that is very popular at the farmers' markets and online.  In our part of the state, there aren't a lot of goat dairies but there is a big demand for the product.  

We also have a thriving agritourism business here.  We do farmstays where people stay with us to learn about farms.  They pay for their stay but participate in the daily chores and activities of our farm.  We also teach people how to milk goats,how to care for goats, how to make soap, and how to make cheese.  Our hope is that we can utilize one of our buildings here to teach others what we have learned and share our knowledge of the ups and downs of farmlife.  

Our English Shire horses are used to pull carraiges, wagons and farm work implements.  We teach the art of driving for time volunteering to help us with our many other projects on the farm.  We do sleigh rides in the winter and hay rides in the fall.  

We raise USDA pork, chicken and turkey for ourselves and to sell to the public.  All our animals have a good life; they are fed well with lots of fresh water and pasture.  We are striving to be organic certified which means everything we do on this farm is free of chemicals, growth hormones or GMOs.  

Our gardens produced an abundance of delicious veggies and fruits this year.  It takes a lot of work to do this and not use pesticides or chemicals.  We use composting and mulch to keep the soils good.  We've started worm composting to make the best soils.  We plan to use this and sell it to the public.

All of this takes a lot of work, but we have the will and dedication and we can do this!  We need some help financially to meet our goals.  Our farm will help our community and teach others to become more self sufficient.  We open our farm up to the public.  People bring their children here to see the animals.   Couples have their weddings here. Families get together here for sleigh and hay rides. 

 The political and economic climate has made this endeavor very challenging, but we believe in what we are doing. The world needs small farms like ours to survive to provide good nutrition, teaching to live in good company and harmony with nature. In addition, we do business cooperatively, not competitively, which means we cooperate with other farmers to prosper via barter and sharing. Our state slogan is "Maine - The way life should be" and we are living it.

Why is this an important project?

We want to plan for a thriving future. Not just survival, but an efficient sustainable future. Which means no waste. We have dreams of utilizing the full potential of this beautiful land and want this land to always be a farm. A lot of work and love has already gone into keeping this a small sustainable living farm. Small farms are essential, and they are slowly disappearing. It takes a lot of resources to keep the animals fed, and there is always a lot of work but this is the life we have chosen. 

What do we need the money for?

We are not greedy. We can do a lot with a little! The following is a list of the specific supplies and what needs to be built to create the milk parlor and creamery in a building that is already built.  1)Wood,drywall, insulation and 2 doors; 2)put a floor drain in each of the 2 rooms; 3)Bring in the electricity and water from the barn 4)Build platform for goat milking stanchions in milking parlor;5) shelves and counters for supplies and equipment in both rooms; 6) install lighting and heating system and water heater; and last but not least 7) install wash up areas for both rooms.  

Equipment and supplies needed: stainless steel(ss) counters, sinks and faucets, industrial scale, 2 refrigerators, ss draining shelf, hooks and basin to drain cheese and collect whey, plastic storage bins, wax heater, cheese press, cheese brush, food grade thermometers, salter, vacuum packer,vat pasteurizer,ss measuring cups and spoons, ss ladles, molds, and 2 burner electric heating unit.

If we exceed our financial goal, any additional money would be used to buy farming implements so we can use the horses to till the soil, and plant seed for hay and grains. Another dream is to fix up a shed on the property into a living and teaching space; installing an outhouse; and to install a wind turbine and solar panels so we can generate our own power. Maybe we will need another fund raiser. There's a lot to do, and the motivation to do it, so please donate as generously as you can!
story_txt: IntroductionIn order to have a dairy license so we can sell our milk, cheeses and yogurts to the public, we need to build a milk parlor and a creamery where we can milk our dairy goats then process that milk so we can pastuerize the milk and make delicious cheeses and yogurt. Presently we use our kitchen that doesn't meet the strict Maine dairy guidelines even though we keep it very clean.  People we share our products with love them and we're sure we could sell more to the public.  We also make a really good goat milk soap that is very popular at the farmers' markets and online.  In our part of the state, there aren't a lot of goat dairies but there is a big demand for the product.  We also have a thriving agritourism business here.  We do farmstays where people stay with us to learn about farms.  They pay for their stay but participate in the daily chores and activities of our farm.  We also teach people how to milk goats,how to care for goats, how to make soap, and how to make cheese.  Our hope is that we can utilize one of our buildings here to teach others what we have learned and share our knowledge of the ups and downs of farmlife.  Our English Shire horses are used to pull carraiges, wagons and farm work implements.  We teach the art of driving for time volunteering to help us with our many other projects on the farm.  We do sleigh rides in the winter and hay rides in the fall.  We raise USDA pork, chicken and turkey for ourselves and to sell to the public.  All our animals have a good life; they are fed well with lots of fresh water and pasture.  We are striving to be organic certified which means everything we do on this farm is free of chemicals, growth hormones or GMOs.  Our gardens produced an abundance of delicious veggies and fruits this year.  It takes a lot of work to do this and not use pesticides or chemicals.  We use composting and mulch to keep the soils good.  We've started worm composting to make the best soils.  We plan to use this and sell it to the public.All of this takes a lot of work, but we have the will and dedication and we can do this!  We need some help financially to meet our goals.  Our farm will help our community and teach others to become more self sufficient.  We open our farm up to the public.  People bring their children here to see the animals.   Couples have their weddings here. Families get together here for sleigh and hay rides.  The political and economic climate has made this endeavor very challenging, but we believe in what we are doing. The world needs small farms like ours to survive to provide good nutrition, teaching to live in good company and harmony with nature. In addition, we do business cooperatively, not competitively, which means we cooperate with other farmers to prosper via barter and sharing. Our state slogan is "Maine - The way life should be" and we are living it.Why is this an important project?We want to plan for a thriving future. Not just survival, but an efficient sustainable future. Which means no waste. We have dreams of utilizing the full potential of this beautiful land and want this land to always be a farm. A lot of work and love has already gone into keeping this a small sustainable living farm. Small farms are essential, and they are slowly disappearing. It takes a lot of resources to keep the animals fed, and there is always a lot of work but this is the life we have chosen. What do we need the money for?We are not greedy. We can do a lot with a little! The following is a list of the specific supplies and what needs to be built to create the milk parlor and creamery in a building that is already built.  1)Wood,drywall, insulation and 2 doors; 2)put a floor drain in each of the 2 rooms; 3)Bring in the electricity and water from the barn 4)Build platform for goat milking stanchions in milking parlor;5) shelves and counters for supplies and equipment in both rooms; 6) install lighting and heating system and water heater; and last but not least 7) install wash up areas for both rooms.  Equipment and supplies needed: stainless steel(ss) counters, sinks and faucets, industrial scale, 2 refrigerators, ss draining shelf, hooks and basin to drain cheese and collect whey, plastic storage bins, wax heater, cheese press, cheese brush, food grade thermometers, salter, vacuum packer,vat pasteurizer,ss measuring cups and spoons, ss ladles, molds, and 2 burner electric heating unit.If we exceed our financial goal, any additional money would be used to buy farming implements so we can use the horses to till the soil, and plant seed for hay and grains. Another dream is to fix up a shed on the property into a living and teaching space; installing an outhouse; and to install a wind turbine and solar panels so we can generate our own power. Maybe we will need another fund raiser. There's a lot to do, and the motivation to do it, so please donate as generously as you can!

story:
Who are we?

We're Cookies and Milk, Sacramento's own late night cookie and milk delivery business. Right now you can call us Thursday-Saturday 7 pm to 1:30 am just about every week for some warm cookies and cold milk delivered straight to your door, but please first check the delivery area map on our website :)  www.cookiesnmilkdelivery.com  

However, we'd like to change that.  With the money from the campaign we will outfit a location large enough to house our cookie lovers that might want to stop in for a change. It would also allow for us to expand our hours and menu for the masses, and not just the late night crowd.With this funding, Cookies and Milk would be able to give Sacramento the service it demands.

Why we need you!

$50,000 is what we have worked out to be a conservative estimate on what a fully operational cookies shop in downtown Sacramento to cost. This would give us the funds to make a welcoming location with some great upgrades in equipment and staff development. 

But whats in it for you? T-shirts, aprons, oh and UNLIMITED  COOKIES FOR LIFE! Yes, if you are willing to take the wild ride with us and donate $750 or more we will offer you all the cookies you can eat when you come in, and let you leave with a dozen on any day. 

If for some reason we don't reach our entire goal we are still going to be dedicated to creating an established cookie bakery in downtown Sacramento.


Risks & Challenges

Making cookies for the masses definitely has its challenges, and so would taking this next step in serving the Sacramento community. We believe that our near two years of successful business has qualified us to take this leap in reaching out for help to take our business further.

What else can I do?

If you would like to help us out besides tossing us some cash for a sweet perk? Please share this campaign with anyone and everyone. For media contacts please feel free to send us an email at cookiesnmilkdelivery@gmail.com 

Or you can follow us here:

http://instagram.com/CookiesAndMilkD

https://www.facebook.com/CookiesAndMilkSac

https://twitter.com/CookiesAndMilkD

story:
Back in the ring, part II

Back in the Ring begynte som et prøveprosjekt i 2013. Med Yoga som virkemiddel ønsket vi å utforske alternative veier i behandlingen av rusavhengige. Etter positive resultater fra mange av våre deltagere har prosjektet nå fått nasjonal oppmerksomhet. 

  • Ett år etter første runde er syv av ti deltagere rusfrie
  • Tre av deltagerne har blitt yogainstruktører og jobber nå med å hjelpe andre gjennom prosjektet
  • Prosjektet har stor pågang og opptil 40 rusavhengige kommer til yogaklasser i Oslo ukentlig

I november reiste 18 nye deltagere i Back in the ring II til India for et to måneders opphold hvor de skal bli rusfrie gjennom yoga og samfunnsnyttig arbeid. De skal blant annet bygge et tempel for fattige og pengene vi samler inn nå skal være med å finansiere dette arbeidet.

Vi ønsker oss 150 000

  • Prosjektet har ingen offentlig støtte og deltagerne har selv betalt reisen til India. Purple Valley yogasenter i Goa støtter prosjektet med gratis innkvartering
  • Innsamlingen går i sin helhet til å dekke materialkostnader for bygging av tempelet

Hva vil ditt bidrag hjelpe til med?

Et viktig resultat av ditt bidrag er jo at fattige i India får et nytt og etterlengtet tempel de ellers ikke ville fått. Det er en god ting i seg selv, men det er andre sider ved dette som er enda viktigere:

  • Gjennom å hjelpe andre får deltagerne i prosjektet oppleve den viktige følelsen av å gjøre noe godt for noen som trenger det, det blir hjelp til selvhjelp
  • Det å hjelpe andre og være betydningsfull for noen, er en viktig ingrediens i prosjektet Back in the ring, vi vet at det gir kraft og styrke
  • På den lange veien til målet om å leve et rusfritt liv er det å jobbe sammen, skape noe bra, kjenne tilhørighet og bli sett utrolig viktig. Turen til India og jobben som gjøres der danner et veldig bra utgangspunkt for å nå det målet, og ditt bidrag vil hjelpe!

Andre måter du kan hjelpe oss på

Om du ikke skulle ha midler til å hjelpe oss rent økonomisk så blir vi også veldig glade om du kan gi litt av din tid. Hjelp oss å dele informasjon om denne kampanjen i sosiale medier, fortell om oss og jobben vi gjør til venner og kjente, snakk om det i lunsjpausen, jo flere som vet om prosjektet, jo bedre! 

  • Bruk Indiegogos verktøy for deling og spre budskapet! Tusen takk! :)

Du kan lese mer om Back in the ring på www.yogaforlivet.no

story:
The Background:

  • Jewish women have been dancing from biblical times to the present. 
  • Jewish women have shared particular challenges in life from biblical times to the present.
  • Jewish women’s voices have often been absent, ignored, or silenced from biblical times to the present.

Let us give voice to our collective experiences through DANCE.

Women’s Voices in Motion is Beit Midrash in Motion’s platform to share women’s voices with the world, and to inspire social change in the Jewish community.  Women’s Voices in Motion is comprised of dance performances choreographed to interweave and express the personal stories of biblical and contemporary women.  These powerful performances interactively engage audiences in text study and thoughtful communal reflection.  Women’s Voices in Motion seeks to propel social change through dance.

Women’s Voices in Motion’s first project:

UPROOTED: A Jewish Response to Infertility.


"I am a woman of sorrowful spirit...I pour out my soul before G-d."  (Hannah, Samuel I 1:15) 
"I am so angry at G-d for making me this way" (H. K, 2014)


The Inspiration: 

As the wife of a community rabbi, an active community member and friend, I have encountered numerous women confronting infertility.  In fact, 12-20% of all couples will have some trouble conceiving. I have listened to stories of pain and alienation and watched as some of my peers embrace motherhood while others suffer the paroxysms of infertility.  Additionally, I have noted the frequency of potentially damaging remarks typically asked at Jewish communal functions.  Such questions sound innocent enough, (How many children do you have?...Nu, what is taking so long?), but can crush the spirit of those who suffer--in silence--from infertility.   All of these stories I have heard, have inspired me to create this project. 

My experience as a Jewish educator influenced me to utilize Jewish texts in search of some means of solace for those who are enduring these struggles.  However, I found that the infertility struggles of Biblical texts are often portrayed by commentaries and educators in simple terms, inconsistent with a more nuanced reality.  (If only infertility could be solved for everyone struggling nowadays by crying out to the Almighty!) 

As a Jewish-dance educator and choreographer, my milieu for expressing ideas is through movement.  Seven-years of producing and choreographing for Jewish dance companies has made me a firm believer in the immense power of dance--and movement--to convey ideas.  Ultimately, UPROOTED draws upon this skill set as well as my background with classic Jewish texts and my training in an MA program for Marriage and Family Counseling. The result is an experience intended to raise awareness and ease the silent suffering of so many individuals.    


Our community needs this project! 

Have you ever been to a Jewish communal event and been accosted with an invasive comment or asked a personal question?  Are you dating anyone, you should go to college X, did I hear that you lost your job, (or one that I was personally asked recently--the always inappropriate) are you pregnant? 

Jewish communities of all types are frequently places of congeniality and fraternity--which is a truly wonderful thing! But sometimes, our closeness and our lack of understanding about what others are experiencing leads us to go to far with our words, evoking pain, alienating and UPROOTing people from our community.

It is time we started to understand, and cultivate greater sensitivity within ourselves and inclusivity within our community. 


What is UPROOTED?

UPROOTED: A Jewish Response to Infertility confronts the isolation and pain of infertility as presented in contemporary and traditional Jewish narratives.  ‘Akara’ is Biblical parlance for a barren woman, yet it also means ‘uprooted’.  This indicates the experience of women suffering from infertility as they find themselves silently uprooted from community, continuity, and from their dreams of motherhood.  Through performance, discussion, and gripping personal narratives, UPROOTED seeks to transform the Jewish community into a fertile ground for compassionate questions and conversation.  UPROOTED is about building a Jewish society in which those struggling with infertility can regain their rootedness.

UPROOTED is currently seeking funding for:

*Enhancing its website to include a forum for people suffering from infertility to speak openly, anonymously, and honestly with each other.

*A marketing campaign to find people who are willing to share their personal infertility stories anonymously. (to learn more--www.WeAreUprooted.com)

*Commissioning music for UPROOTED's performance piece that will express the infertility narrative of women from Biblical to contemporary times and will serve as a catalyst for communal education and social change. 

UPROOTED is looking forward to building: 

*An evocative performance piece including original music and dance that will express the infertility narratives of women from Biblical to contemporary times. 

*A resource guide will serve as the basis for communal dialogue focused on fostering sensitivity and inclusivity.  (It can be used with or without the performance.) 

*Discussion and support groups for people who are not familiar with infertility as well as those who know it first-hand.


The Impact

The ultimate goal of UPROOTED is to provide emotional support for those suffering with infertility and to initiate social change to build more sensitive and inclusive communities.  As such, the target market includes women (and couples) confronting infertility, as well as Jewish communities of all types and sizes willing to explore the topic and their respective responses to it.  Statistically speaking, there are unknown thousands of Jewish women confronting infertility.  Let's work together to give voice to their stories. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Any way that you can contribute to UPROOTED is incredibly helpful and much appreciated! 

  • UPROOTED is seeking personal stories: Introduce people to the website www.WeAreUprooted.com so they can share their personal stories, or share a personal story yourself. 
  • Email this campaign to everyone you know!
  • Share any ideas or feedback you have with us.  We would love to hear your thoughts! 
  • LIKE us on Facebook--www.Facebook.com/WeAreUprooted!


Thank you so much for being a part of UPROOTED's campaign!

May we build together a community that is a fertile ground for sensitivity, inclusion and rootedness.

story:
Short Summary

BeThnk is a location based reminder service founded by, Ninad , a London based entrepreneur. With more than half a decade of ageing into the digital world, he is a pro at performance based marketing and user acquisition. An entrepreneur, a risk taker and a dreamer, he also heads a London based digital agency. A team player, he believes and lives innovation!

BeThnk is a virtual secretary you can carry in your pocket, stored in your smartphones. How do you remember your best friend's or your cousin's or your girlfriend's birthdays? Via your Google calendars, right? Imagine how easy your life would be if we told you we could remind you of what needs to be done after what and where! 

Modern hectic lifestyles and increased workloads and pressures as well as modern technology were blamed for the increase in our levels of forgetfulness. The study found the technology boom has also played a part, leaving us with more gadgets than ever before to plug in and charge or take care of. BeThnk is a solution which helps you out to organise your day to day life more effectively and efficiently. We also believe BeThnk can help 100s of thousands of people who suffer from various issue related to forgetfulness.

We have bootstrapped the initial development over the last 4 months with number of sleepless nights, endless mugs of coffees & a heck of agile project management. We need to further enhance our beta version to be able to take it to the mass market. We are adding further features like sharing your reminders, connecting with people within the vicinity and securing discount vouchers for our users to save them money while making their day to day life more effective. We also want to localise the app in a few different languages to make it available globally. Without your help we will not be able to achieve our goals in the shortest period of time.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for £10,000 which will mainly go towards the development of the product, localising it in various languages, securing partnerships with retailers and making the app available for free for year for all our users.

We are offering a few limited edition perks and I am sure they will get you super excited.

In case of not reaching the goal we will be focusing on completing the project with the minimum budget and spend further additional man hours to secure partnership deals with local retailers for our audience and translate our content with the help of volunteers.

The Impact

The average adult forgets three key facts, chores or events every day, a study has found by Telegraph. We tend to forget so many day to day chores and tasks which can help us improve the way we live. The most commonly incident in our lives will be forgetting the most needed grocery item while shopping for you weekly grocery. Or squeezing the last bit of the toothpaste while getting ready for work and not remembering it until the next morning although you cross at least 10 shops in the day where you could buy the toothpaste from. 

The current reminders in the market are mainly based on the time which makes them more predictive instead of being effective. BeThnk can be the tool which will help you organise your life more effectively. 

With my experience as a successful entrepreneur over a year & a digital strategist over the last 8 years,  I have the passion, perseverance, drive & experience  to make this app as one of the best productivity app in the market. 

Risks & Challenges

Since we have a fully functional beta we do not see many challenges in creating a sophisticated app that can act as your personal secretary. I have years of experience in online strategies & creating effective partnership to make a digital product successful.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can help us share the word through your social networks. Please share our campaign through Facebook, Twitter, Google plus and invite your friends, family and colleagues to help us create a product that can help thousands of people to be more efficient .

    We really thank you for backing up this project.

   What We Need & What You Get We are looking for £10,000 which will mainly go towards the development of the product, localising it in various languages, securing partnerships with retailers and making the app available for free for year for all our users.
We are offering a few limited edition perks and I am sure they will get you super excited.
In case of not reaching the goal we will be focusing on completing the project with the minimum budget and spend further additional man hours to secure partnership deals with local retailers for our audience and translate our content with the help of volunteers.
  The Impact 
The average adult
forgets three key facts, chores or events every day, a study has found by
Telegraph. We tend to forget so many day to day chores and tasks which can
help us improve the way we live. The most commonly incident in our lives will
be forgetting the most needed grocery item while shopping for you weekly
grocery. Or squeezing the last bit of the toothpaste while getting ready for
work and not remembering it until the next morning although you cross at least 10
shops in the day where you could buy the toothpaste from. 
The current reminders in the market are mainly based on the time which makes them more predictive instead of being effective. BeThnk can be the tool which will help you organise your life more effectively. 
With my experience as a successful entrepreneur over a year & a digital strategist over the last 8 years,  I have the passion, perseverance, drive & experience  to make this app as one of the best productivity app in the market. 
  Risks & Challenges Since we have a fully functional beta we do not see many challenges in creating a sophisticated app that can act as your personal secretary. I have years of experience in online strategies & creating effective partnership to make a digital product successful.

  Other Ways You Can Help You can help us share the word through your social networks. Please share our campaign through Facebook, Twitter, Google plus and invite your friends, family and colleagues to help us create a product that can help thousands of people to be more efficient .
 We really thank you for backing up this project.

story:
Extra money burning a hole in your pocket? Want to donate to a good cause?  Get behind something you really love?  Sure you could feed the children, save the rain forest, end global warming, or you could end my financial stress, feed me, and save my ass!!!

All jokes aside, I am dealing with a very serious family emergency and I have to be with them in Los Angeles for an undetermined amount of time.  That means I will be making no money to pay my bills or rent in the most expensive city in the whole wide world (or at least it feels like that!). This is why I am turning to you all, my friends and community, for some help and support.  This is very hard for me, but fuck it, I am just going to do this and see if anything happens.

  I am trying to raise $3500 - which will cover my rent and most of my bills for a few months.  I know everyone is broke, BELIEVE ME, I KNOW!  I'm not saving the world, or doing something amazing, or even going to summer camp.  I'm just trying to not get evicted.   I am offering much gratitude and humility, as well as some nifty prizes in return.

This is a very difficult time and I am trying to stay positive. If you can't give monetarily, my family and I could use lots of positive thoughts and energy.  

thank you.



Ps. Go to the gallery tab to see what the perks and prizes actually look like.

story:
THE SHORT VERSION:

At Stillpoint Community Acupuncture, our mission is simple: to provide affordable care for all. We do this by providing acupuncture on a sliding scale starting at $20, where our folks can decide what they can afford to pay. Cool, right?  We think so too; we LOVE what we do!


The problem is, due to circumstances beyond anyone’s control, we have a few jobs that we still need to address.

Here's the jist:

Shortly after starting renovations and doing enough to get the doors open to our second location, we discovered that our expected funding investment had been reduced by half.  Now, we find ourselves a tad stuck. In order to keep Stillpoint moving forward, we need your help!  

A few things that still need doing:

  • Our sign needs a serious do-over (seriously!)

  • There are walls still missing

  • But most of all, the community is asking us to be open full time hours, and it kills us that we just can’t afford to do it.


With your help we are striving to raise $10,000.  This money will go towards:

  • Providing our new community with the care and service they deserve from us, a.k.a extending our hours so we are more accessible.

  • Completing the renovations to the clinic. 

  • Ensuring the new Stillpoint location is visible to the community by investing in proper signage.

But wait! This isn't just about us!  We have lots to offer in return!  Make sure you check out our Perks, which include everything from unlimited high fives, to unique t-shirts, unicorns, and even autographed celebrity photos*!  

(*may not be an actual legit celebrity signature, but a not-so-clever forgery.)

Contributing to our campaign isn’t just about donating to a Community Acupuncture clinic, it’s about supporting a community, making dreams come true and joining the revolution that is Community Acupuncture! Get onboard and get yourself some perks!  From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.




The Longer Version: Here is our story and we are stickin’ to it!


Simply put, Stillpoint Needs Your Help.

We began our journey three and a half years ago after opening our doors in the Westshore. Since then we have given over 15,000 treatments, to just about 2,000 people. They love what we do, and we love what we do too. But, in order for Stillpoint to keep growing, we need your help.


Let’s back up...What IS Community Acupuncture?

The North American model of acupuncture is probably very familiar to you:  You see your acupuncturist for an hour or so, they ask you LOTS of questions before putting the needles in, let you rest a while then come in and kick you off the table, whether you’re ready or not.  Then, when you’re all spaced out and relaxed (we call that being in ‘aculand’), they hit you up for a fee ranging from $60-120 and book you in for your next treatment.

That’s not our style.

Community Acupuncture  is different!  Not only do you get to decide how long your treatments last, it is way cheaper!  Our patients play on a sliding scale between $20-$50, which means if you need those three treatments a week, it's actually affordable! Our treatments occur in one large room, where people sit quietly in comfy recliners, with their sleeves and pantlegs rolled up, all floating in aculand. Because there are numerous chairs to sit in, no one needs to make way for the next patient, if they’re not ready to. Also, you can bring friends, family, random people off the street (not sure why’d you do that, but hey! it’s all good!) and get treated at the same time.

And yes: we treat EVERYTHING that any other acupuncturist treats, just as well. The added bonus is that with more treatments, you’ll often get better even faster!

“I come to community acupuncture clinics to say I sleep with strangers”

So what happened at Stillpoint??

As a Social Enterprise, all of our profits go back into our staff, clinics and community, (Note: if you are looking to become a millionaire, opening a Community Acupuncture clinic is not for you!) After the success of our first clinic, we found ourselves looking to expand our services outward to more underserved communities.

In May of 2014 we found a great location in Vic West, a tight knit working class community that is currently underserved by any form of health care provider. Our new clinic would share expenses with the first, and allow us to put our energy into a community that needed us.

Just as we had started tearing down walls and building new treatment rooms, we discovered that our expected funding investment commitment had, through circumstances beyond anyone's control been reduced by half.

That...was NOT good.

Despite this financial set back, our community came together and saved us. With the blood, sweat and tears of many, we were able to scrape together enough resources to open the doors of our second location in October of 2014.

Although the response from the Vic West Community has been astounding, our funding gap remains. We find ourselves stuck. We are unable to afford some of the basic necessities that our Vic West clinic needs in order to adequately support our new community.

This is our dream of dreams.

Our Vic West clinic needs some serious TLC. Okay, it actually goes beyond TLC. There are walls still missing, and our sign looks like it was put up by a couple of monkeys (actually, the boss put it up!).  Esthetics aside, our community is asking us to be open full time hours, and it kills us that we just can’t afford to do it at this point.

This campaign will provide us the funding we need to make Stillpoint more visible to the Vic West Community and provide them with the care and service they deserve, and need from us.

Contributing to our campaign isn’t about donating to a Community Acupuncture clinic, it’s about supporting a community,  fulfilling a need, and joining the revolution that is Community Acupuncture.  Thank you for your support!

Where Will Your Money Go?

With your help we are striving to raise $10,000.  The money from a successful campaign will go towards:

  • Ensuring the new Stillpoint location be more visible to the community by investing in new signage.

  • Completing the renovations to the clinic.

  • Providing our new community with the care and service they deserve from us, a.k.a extending our hours so we are more accessible.

If we hit $2500…With the blood, sweat, and tears of our community, we are going to complete the build-out inside in clinic.

If we hit $5000 we will get the signage we need to spread the word!

If we hit $10,000 we will be able to hire another acupuncturist, and expand our hours!

If we surpass our goal...it’s party time, and you’ll be invited!

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.
*******************************************

What does Acupuncture treat, you might ask?

Here is a list of some of the conditions and circumstances for which acupuncture treatment is effective:

  • Pain in injuries of all types: back and neck pain, headaches, sprains, joint pain, arthritis
  • Stress, anxiety, depression, and insomnia
  • Respiratory disorders: Cough and Asthma, Cold's and Flus
  • Digestive disorders: Stomach and Abdominal pain, Esophageal conditions, Constipation, Diarrhea, Colitis, as well as Crohn’s disease and IBS.
  • Women’s Health: Menstrual irregularities, PMS, Menopause, Infertility, Ovarian and Uterine problems
  • Pregnancy: Morning sickness, Childbirth, Post-partum depression, Lactation problems, Mammary abscess
  • Men’s Health: Seminal emission, Prostate conditions, Impotence, Infertility
  • Dermatology: Eczema, Psoriasis, Patch balding, Hives
  • Endocrine function: Diabetes, Thyroid dysfunction
  • Ear, Eye, Nose and Throat disorders: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye), Stye, Tearing patterns, Sudden blindness, Nearsightedness, Tinnitus, Nosebleed, Sinusitis, Loss of voice, Sore throat, Toothache
  • Neurological disorders: Bell’s Palsy, Facial paralysis, post-stroke
  • Paediatrics: Cold and Flu, Fever, Cough, Digestive concerns, etc.
  • Surgery: Pre and Post surgical preparation and recovery
  • Other conditions: Addictions, Fibromyalgia

story:
For three years, Caffe D’Amore has brought fair trade coffee and catering services with ethically sourced and local ingredients to the Pittsburgh Public Market. Now, we’re looking to expand. Operating a pop-up store in Upper Lawrenceville, we’ve found that residents have eagerly embraced the presence of a calming space which can serve as a friendly, community meeting place for both work and play.

This is where you come in! We’re seeking $30,000 to transform a space right near our current pop-up installation and make Caffe D’Amore a permanent fixture in Upper Lawrenceville. Those funds will allow us to fully renovate and equip a space which we think has the power to be staple in the community and a positive influence on the neighborhood for years to come. 

We’ve got some great rewards lined up — from swag like shirts,

                      

pins, brew bar classes and free coffee to a trip to visit one of the farms where our beans are grown. Every dollar and share helps us to effect change, both in our community and in those of our growers and roasters.

Thanks for helping us keep Pittsburgh local and caffeinated!

story:
For those who don’t know, Raye Roeske is a fabulous gal who has spent YEARS supporting indie authors and small press publishers. If you are at all involved in the bizarro fiction community, this is no surprise to you. But those outside of that community or are just becoming familiar with it, you’ll soon see how much Raye does (and has done) for everyone.

My name is Jordan Krall, an author and publisher. I've known Raye for quite some time and she is like the older sister I should have had (instead of the older sister that I got, haha!). She has not only been supportive of me during the ups and downs of my life, but she's also helped countless friends and colleagues of mine.

Last Spring, her partner of many years passed away suddenly. Raye was left in a very precarious situation with her vindictive landlord and was (and is) struggling financially. Raye is unable to work and is on SSDI as her sole source of income. Though she has since found a new place to live, she is still in a very unstable financial situation and can use any help she can get.

Because of Raye's love of hamsters, I decided to edit an anthology of hamster stories. I was lucky to get TONS of authors who were willing to write a story for this book despite it being a very niche topic. 

All donations and proceeds of this anthology will go to pay for Raye's cost-of-living expenses. 

The authors included are:

Martin Roberts, M.C. O’Neill, Wol-vriey, David Agranoff, Lee Widener, Seb Doubinksy, Rich Bottles Jr., J.R. Richardson, Jimmy James Pudge, M.F., Daniel Vlasaty, Nick Cato, Michael Noe, Jonathan Moon, Jon R. Meyers, Jason Wayne Allen, MP Johnson, Richard J. Austin, David Anderson, Michael Faun, Garrett Cook, Pedro Proença, Donald Armfield, A. Carina Barry, T.E. Grau, Jeremy C. Shipp, Alex S. Johnson, Antonio Magogoli, and Sheila Hall.

story:
MAY IS WATER SAFETY MONTH! 

Join our team and help children overcome their fear of the water and learn how to swim through our #imsafe program. Your generous donation will bring our water-safety program to four (4) new Boys & Girls Clubs. 

Water is a critical resource, but is also a silent and life-threatening fear for children. Here are some of the startling statistics that we are working to change:

  • Half a million people drown every year around the world
  • More than half of the drowning victims are children
  • 6 our of 10 African-American and Hispanic/Latino children do not know how to swim; nearly twice the number of Caucasian children

The Michael Phelps Foundation’s signature program – im – provides learn-to-swim instruction, as well as goal-setting and healthy living lessons, to the Boys & Girls Clubs of America.

JOIN OUR TEAM

A generous donation of $65 provides water-safety instruction to at least one child who does not know how to swim…and you will be providing them the opportunity to learn to swim through the same program that introduced our founder, Michael Phelps, to the water as a child. (And yes, he too had a fear of the water in the beginning!) 

We are offering perks and will be adding more as the campaign goes on so be sure to check back.

"I was first introduced to the sport of swimming through water safety. I learned to be comfortable and confident in the water and my passion for swimming grew with each visit to the pool.  Now, with the support of the Boys & Girls Clubs, we are able to offer children a program that will help them become safer in the water, and live a healthier and more active life. " - Michael Phelps

   

ABOUT OUR PROGRAM

im  was developed in collaboration with KidsHealth.org and the Michael Phelps Swim School, in an effort to bring world-class water-safety, recreational aquatic activities, health and wellness education, and goal-setting activities to children. Developed in 2009 and launched as a pilot program across 6 Boys & Girls Clubs in 2010, the program has successfully reached more than 8,000 Club kids through 37 Clubs across 22 States. The demand for im  within the Boys & Clubs of America grows each year and we are committed to bringing the program to every State in 2016.

ABOUT THE MICHAEL PHELPS FOUNDATION

The Michael Phelps Foundation, a charitable, tax-exempt organization under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, is focused on growing the sport of swimming and promoting healthy and active lives, especially for children. Since being founded in 2008, the Foundation has provided learn to swim, healthy eating and goal setting curriculum to over 10,000 children around the world by partnering with the Special Olympics and Boys & Girls Club of America.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP  

Help educate others on the importance of water safety through social media. Share our posts and make your own. If you have a story about how our programming has helped you be safer in the water, please post your story and we will share. 

Here are some suggested posts. Be sure to use our hashtag #imsafe.

* May is Water Safety Month! Join the @MPFoundation team and help bring #imsafe water programming to 4 new @BGCA_Clubs: http://igg.me/at/imsafe

 * May is Water Safety Month! Make sure to:  1) Take swim lessons and be comfortable in the water #imsafe 2) Never swim alone and 3) Know your surroundings. Visit http://igg.me/at/imsafe to find out how we can help prevent drowning deaths. 

* Drowning is preventable! Work with @MPFoundation to spread awareness to help prevent drowning deaths #imsafe. How are you being safer in the water? Visit http://igg.me/at/imsafe to find out more.

Water is a critical
resource, but is also a silent and life-threatening fear for children. Here are
some of the startling statistics that we are working to change:

Half a million people drown every year around the world
More than half of the drowning victims are children
6 our of 10 African-American and Hispanic/Latino
     children do not know how to swim; nearly twice the number of Caucasian
     children


The Michael Phelps
Foundation’s signature program – im – provides

story:
Hello everyone! For those who don't know me, my name is Paulius Ruksenas, and I'm the publisher of LTnews.net. Together with Editor-in-Chief Linas Johansonas, we have passionately developed LTnews.net from a tiny idea back in 2010, into the current phenomenal movement that reaches over 100,000 people. Many people aren't aware that Linas and myself are the only full-time contributors to LTnews.net, and that we use our own funds to keep this puppy alive.

We are coming up on our 5th anniversary and want to continue taking LTnews.net to higher levels. Between improving/maintaining the website, time needed for research/updating, development of a LTnews smartphone App, we are in need of an influx of capital.

The $20,000 we are seeking for will ensure LTnews.net stays online for years to come with steady and continual improvements. We have visions to bring on more contributors, be on location and reporting at major Lithuanian events, and having the largest collection of Lithuanian photos and videos in the world. We are just getting started!

We need your help. If every one of our readers donated just $1, we would reach our goal by the end of the day. If you aren't in the position to donate, don't worry, we still love you :) but please share this fundraiser with your friends and family.  

Any donations of $50 or more will get the Motorcycle Vytis shirt:

To claim the shirt with your $50 click "GET THIS PERK" before donating.

Aciu, Thank you, and GO LIETUVA!!!

story:
Please Help Kathy Heal !

   On 3/12/13 Tuesday morning after getting off of work I intervened in a brutal beating of a woman on her way to her factory job. She was incapacitated and unable to defend against her attacker. I stopped the beating and the man was arrested and is being charged with a felony battery charge. The victim's name is Kathy and her battle isn't over yet. She has a shattered left orbital bone in her face and could possibly need reconstructive surgery to fix this. She will no doubt be stuck with the medical expenses unless you can help. Please help Kathy heal inside and out with your support we can do this. I am Charlie Blackmore Jr. a Marine Corps Disabled Veteran and I ask you to be one of the few and the proud. Thank you !

 

Anything you can donate will help 

   I am trying to raise at least $35,000 not only to help with the medical expenses but to send her on a vacation with her children to help forget about this horrible morning. Every cent raised will go to Kathy and her children. If we reach the goal I will try to have their time documented on video and shared on YouTube for you all to view what happiness you helped accomplish. 

 

   Kathy also takes the bus to work every morning even during the brutal Wisconsin winters.  I know it's a stretch but to get her very own vehicle for transportation would just be the cherry on top. Please help in any way you can and if you want to contact me personally I have set up a separate email for anything concerning this incident. Thank you once again for your time. Contact me at ccw.blackmore@yahoo.com for any questions.

This is a real event and here is the proof

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KHb9zdr92SY

 

http://www.todaystmj4.com/news/local/198539501.html

 

http://www.jsonline.com/news/milwaukee/marine-veteran-stops-beating-holds-man-at-gunpoint-qs95000-197766101.html

story:
About Anahata International

We are a volunteer-run, DC-based nonprofit organization with a mission is to share the physical and mental health benefits of yoga and holistic wellness services with individuals in need. We provide teacher trainings and build sustainable wellness programs to trauma and conflict-affected communities around the world. Right now, we are halfway through a 2-part project in the West Bank — training teachers and empowering local women to build sustainable, yoga-based programs to help their communities cope with the daily stresses of living in conflict.

About Farashe

Partnering with Anahata on this project is Farashe Yoga Center in Ramallah. Opened in 2010, Farashe's small volunteer staff has been offering safe, accessible yoga throughout occupied territories. Through this training, the organizations seek to empwer members of the local community to be a part of this effort — making it more sustainable and increasing the reach significantly. 

What We Need 

We are just $4,000 away from raising the funds we need to send 3 teachers back to Ramallah this June for the second phase of teacher training. We need your help to cover travel costs, training materials, and yoga supplies to make this happen!

The Project

In July 2012, we completed a 60-hour foundational teacher training for 16 women in the West Bank City of Ramallah as part of our ongoing partnership with Farashe. Trainees were taught how to facilitate yoga and meditation classes with an emphasis on making self-care skills available to all while empowering women as local community leaders.

This summer's training will build on the foundation set last summer, with a focus in offering additional tools and resources in:

  • Trauma-sensitve yoga
  • Children's yoga & prenatal yoga
  • Yoga Nidra & meditation

The Impact

Everyone deserves a path to wellbeing—especially in areas of the world where conflict and restricted movement are a fact of daily life. Yoga has the power to promote healing and social change. Here is a little more on the difference our work in the West Bank has made so far:

  • Our 2012 trainees have been actively teaching and sharing what they have learned—introducing yoga to children in schools, to the elderly, to expecting mothers and other members of the community through local health organizations and public classes. Some of them are teaching as many as 8 classes per week!
  • Two of the 2012 graduates are in the process of opening up yoga studios to serve populations where they live—the very first yoga centers in Bethlehem and Nablus.
  • One graduates also share yoga as a tool for self care with people who have limited access to healthcare and who are living with diabetes and heart disease.

"I stopped being angry. I no longer have racing thoughts that keep me worried and awake through the night. I have this tranquility inside of me that I didn’t have before I started yoga." - 2012 graduate, 25-year-old Abeer Abu Amrieh from the village of Zatara, near Bethlehem

Every little bit makes a big difference; please help us with $10, $50, $100, or whatever you can manage.

THANK YOU!

story:
Hello, my name is Wanda Sewell.  I am starting my own business designing, producing and selling quality adaptive clothing for seniors and the disabled.  My goal is to make dressing easier and more comfortable for anyone with mobility issues and those that care for them. 

I have been accepted into a government program that would provide me with education, professional business advice, mentoring and personal financial support for one year.  This program will enable me to reinvest any profits realized back into my growing business.  However I require start up capital.

 

Where the money from this campaign will go.

Material and supplies for inventory - $4,690.00

Office equipment upgrades and software - $860.00

Brochure printing and mailing costs - $872.00

 

Extra money will go to:

Graphic design fees to help with the brochure

Development of new product designs

Web development fees to help with the website

 

 

Several years ago I began designing adaptive clothing as a hobby and donated what I made to the nursing home where I was employed.  Some of my co-workers asked if they could purchase some of my designs for their parents.  After the CEO of the facility asked if they could purchase additional nightgowns and agreed to test my future designs at their facility.

In March of this year I was forced to take a medical leave from my job.  I have since found out that it may be some time before I can expect a full recovery.  Running my own business will allow me to work around my medical condition and be a contributing member of my community.  For several years, I managed a small business and dreamed of someday owing my own business.  Now I wish to turn that dream into a reality. 

As our Baby Boomeras are aging there will be more pressure on a Health Care System that is already struggling to keep up.  In the coming years, the waiting lists for long term care beds will only be growing longer resulting in more seniors being cared for at home by family members or care providers.  Adaptive clothing makes dressing easier and less physically challenging for both the wearer and the care provider.  Help me to help make their life a little easier and more comfortable.

I am committed to protecting the environment for our future generations and have taken great effort to keep the company’s ecological footprint as small as possible.  I have found charities that can make use of leftover production fabric.  This will keep it out of the landfill and help out the charities at the same time.  I also believe in helping those in need so $1 of every garment sold will be donated to a charity that supports seniors or the disabled.  Each year we’ll choose a different to support.  I have yet to choose the charity for this year so if anyone has a charity that they’re passionate about please let me know.  If your charity is chosen I’ll make the donation in your name.  

 

About the perks.

Because Indiegogo is all about caring and sharing, all perks come in 2’s, one for you and one to share.  All perks are handmade using the finest quality material and workmanship.  All perk levels include vegetable seeds because it’s my way of giving back to your community so that this campaign can benefit as many people as possible.  All contributors will receive a hand written Thank You note from me as you and your support means so much to me. All contributors of $100 or more will also receive 25% off of any products on my website for 1 year (excludes Market Place page).

 

Please help me make my dream come true and help me make life a little easier for those with mobility issuse and those who care for them.  Please visit my website at http://www.haganscottage.com. 

Thank you for caring.
