story:
Our Story

Hi, I am Darren Alston Black co-founder of skilllyst.com. That’s skill lyst.com

What does the name skill lyst mean? It simply means using your skill as a catalyst for opportunity.

Well, what is skilllyst.com really?

Skilllyst is an open source skills oriented opportunity networking platform, dedicated to persons, small businesses, companies and skilled service providers who need an avenue and catalyst for opportunity and cannot afford to pay for exposure on a global scale. Skilllyst.com will allow registered users to create and capitalize on opportunity by listing, promoting and showcasing their individual skills, competence, ability and talents to potential employers, business partners and colleagues. The platform will be equipped with state of the art technology designed to truly make it easy for persons to seek and find opportunity.

 

Overall, what are we trying to accomplish with skilllyst.com?

1.      Our passion is trying to do our part in reducing global unemployment by giving people an avenue for opportunity.

 

2.      To be the premier opportunity website in the world.

 

3.      To organize and promote all the people in the world’s skills to make them easily accessible so as to create opportunity.

 

4.      To be the website where people go to and get information to verify someone’s skill level by looking at their global, country, state or city ranking in their particular field, along with being able to confirm their credibility by looking at their endorsements and other proof of competence persons choose to showcase.

 

5.      To enable persons to help themselves and each other so as to generate and encourage a truly global community.

 

6.      To be the first and probably only platform in the world that rewards persons for helping themselves and others.


 

The Impact

 

So, why are we building it?

We are building skilllyst.com out of the desperate cry by many of our families, friends, acquaintances and even ourselves, the millions and probably billions of people around the world who just don’t know what to do next to find a job, keep their business open or find some form of opportunity. With the global economy in tatters and global unemployment at an all time high, we believe that a platform like skilllyst.com may be the catalyst that the world needs to stimulate the fragile global economy.

 

Why should people even use skillyst.com? Well firstly, for the great incentive program for all users e.g.

1.      The individual with the most endorsements at the end of every month on the entire site gets their profile showcased on the home page of the website and a cash reward of $500.00 USD. This person will be showcased on the home page as the “most demanded person”.

 

2.      The individual who has sent the most “job for you” messages to their friends and associates at the end of every month receives a cash reward of $300.00 USD and will be showcased on the homepage as a “job Samaritan”.

 

3.      The individual who refers the most persons to their colleagues and friends to help people, at the end of the month receives a cash incentive of $400.00 USD and is showcased on the home page as the “top recommender”.

 

4.      The individual with the most persons in their skill link network at the end of the month gets a cash incentive of $300.00 USD and is showcased on the homepage as the “top networker”.

 

5.      The individual that sends the most “hire me” requests at the end of each month but still cannot find a job from the platform gets a cash incentive of $500.00 USD and is showcased on the homepage as the “most persistent job seeker”.

 

These Incentive amounts will increase as the platform grows in popularity and use.

 

Companies/Small Business

1.      The company/small business that hires the most persons from the site at the end of the month gets to advertise free on those persons profile pages. The more people you employ from the site the more free advertising you receive.

2. The first 100 companies and small businesses that register gets to advertise for free for the first two months after the website is launched.

3. The company/small business that advertises the most on the site at the end of each month gets to be showcased on the home page for the entire preceding month and will be termed “company/small business of the month”.

 

Skilled Service Providers

1.      Free promotion of their skills on the website and on the homepage, which will be ranked based on the number of endorsements.

 

 

Secondly, persons should use skilllyst.com because of the innovative features it has that is not being offered by other professional and business oriented networking sites e.g.

1.      Skill match – This feature looks for and matches your particular skill set to opportunities like jobs, skill exchanges, skill links and colleague links automatically. You don’t have to go searching for anything it’s delivered to you in an instant as you click finish on your profile page.

 

2.       Skill exchange – This feature allows you to find persons with skills that you may need and invite them to negotiate an exchange of skills for either free or an agreed upon offer. This feature not only allows you to save money but it allows you to showcase your skills for future referrals and possible opportunities.

 

3.      Referral – This feature allows users to send a referral on behalf of someone they know to an associate or colleague they may also know asking them to help someone create and capitalise on opportunity.

 

4.      Skill links – This feature will allow registered users to create their own network with persons in their particular field. This is designed to create order and easy organisation of your network.

 

5.      Colleague links – This feature will allow users to invite any random person they deem to be of potential benefit and opportunity to join their network. The colleague link network will be further organized into categories of skills. This is to facilitate order and easy use of the website.

 

6.      Endorse – This feature allows persons to endorse you and acts as a means of adding credibility to you and the information you have on your profile page. The feature also shows who endorsed you, what they said and how many persons endorsed you. It simply confirms a saying in business i.e. “If you are good at what you do then people will endorse you”.

 

7.      Skill ranking – This feature also acts as a means of adding credibility to you by showcasing your Global, Country, State and City rank with respect to your particular area of expertise or skill compared to other persons in your field at the different various levels.

 

8.      Buzz – This feature allows you to interact real time with potential employers, business partners, skill exchangers, colleagues and consumers.

 

9.       Video talk – This feature allows users to dialogue face to face with potential employers, business partners, skill exchangers, colleagues, consumers virtually whoever you need to dialogue with.

 

10.  Notice Board – This feature allows users to post information and showcase any recent achievements, ask questions, get advice, give advice and even launch new products and service and get real time responses.

 

What We Need

We need $5,000 to help us do the following:

a.       To survive, since we will be dedicating 100% of our time and effort to complete development on schedule which is 3 months after receiving funding. Also once the platform is launched we will be spending allot of time doing R & D to improve its usability and effectiveness.

 

b.      To procure dedicated and reliable hosting, ensuring that the platform runs smoothly and quickly.

 

c.       To acquire and provide the best security available for the platform.

 

If we don’t get all the funding required, we will still use whatever funds we raise to complete the platform. We will do whatever it takes to get this project completed because allot of people really need our help to find real opportunity. 

 

The Team

The team consists of two seasoned programmers with over 15 years development experience all together and a PMP certified project manager with an MBA, who has managed numerous successful projects.

 

How far along is the project?

We are about 10% complete, working hard to ensure that we have a rigid yet flexible platform for future expansion and innovation.

 

Our Promise

We promise that skilllyst.com will change the lives of millions in a positive way by giving them hope through opportunity. We intend to have the site completed in 3 months after receiving funding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Please tell all the people you know to tell all the people they know, who need a real avenue for opportunity to spread the word that there is finally a website that truly “helps them to help themselves”.

Finally and most importantly, skilllyst.com is and always will be free for persons looking for opportunity. So, enter a world of opportunities at www.skilllyst.com

c.       To acquire and provide the best security available for the platform.
 
If we don’t get all the funding required, we will still use whatever funds we raise to complete the platform. We will do whatever it takes to get this project completed because allot of people really need our help to find real opportunity. 
 
The Team
The team consists of two seasoned programmers with over 15 years development experience all together and a PMP certified project manager with an MBA, who has managed numerous successful projects.
 
How far along is the project?
We are about 10% complete, working hard to ensure that we have a rigid yet flexible platform for future expansion and innovation.
 
Our Promise
We promise that skilllyst.com will change the lives of millions in a positive way by giving them hope through opportunity. We intend to have the site completed in 3 months after receiving funding. 
 


Other Ways You Can Help

 
Please tell all the people you know to tell all the people they know, who need a real avenue for opportunity to spread the word that there is finally a website that truly “helps them to help themselves”. 
Finally and most importantly, skilllyst.com is and always will be free for persons looking for opportunity. So, enter a world of opportunities at www.skilllyst.com
campaign_city: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

story:
What is the LOLA Mobile Personal Emergency Response Stytem (mPERS)

The recently developed LOLA is the smallest and most technically advanced mPERS and locator device available.  It comes as an attractive lanyard pendant, only 5.4 x 4.0 x 1.6cm in size.  LOLA is ideal for providing freedom, safety and security for the elderly, people with cognitive and physical  challenges, Autistic Children, and, generally for people who are frequently alone working or playing in remote locations.  LOLA is integrated with LocationNow.com, a comprehensive dashboard database that sends alerts, monitors and stores data on the activities of the user, keeping them safe and secure no matter where they are. 

 

 

LOLA's coverage is virtually limitless and covers Canada from coast to coast.  If in other countries or territories, the mini SIM card can be changed to adapt to that particular location.

 

 

 

LOLA works with any digital communications device: i-Phone 4S, i-Phone 5,  i-Pad 3, i-Pad4, i-Pad Mini, New i-Pad Touch, Samsung Galaxy S3 & S4, Samsung Galaxy Note 2.

 LOLA FEATURES:

                         

SOS Alert

The SOS button, when pressed, immediately opens up a 2-way conversation with a designated phone, and someone you know, who can respond quickly to your emergency situation.  At the same time, a text message of the exact location and time of emergency will be sent to the designated e-mail and accessed through any digital communication device.

                         

G-Shock Motion Sensor                                                                 

The LOLA has a programmable accelerometer that can be set for 8 different levels of impact, from falls or a vehicle accident. When an impact occurs, 2-way conversation is automatically initiated and a text message of the location is sent.

                                                             

Real Time Location                                                                          

The LOLA has AGPS & GXM/GPRS so family members and caregivers can find their loved one should they wander and become lost (via LocationNow). Invaluable real time position reporting and automatic alerts are sent (entering/leaving geo-fences)

                          

Speaker Phone

When the LOLA user is in an emergency situation, they simply press the SOS Button and a 2-way conversation begins with the designated caregiver. No phone numbers to remember, just the press of a button.  If the caregiver cannot reach the LOLA user through regular means, they can contact the LOLA device directly. When the LOLA is called the 2-way communication opens automatically.

                          

Geo-fencing

On the LocationNow.com dashboard, Geo-fences can be created to alert when a person exits a "safe area" or enters a "restricted or dangerous" area.  Multiple Geo-fences can be created for to control movements of the LOLA user.

                         

Personal Emergency Info

LocationNow.com has a built in data logger to record events, personal profiles, medical history and medications plus much more.  At the click of a mouse, all of the information is at hand.

LOLA has many, many more features that bring an enhanced freedom and less anxiety to loved ones and to caregivers..... a greater peace of mind.

Getting the word out about LOLA!

                

 Round Table Associates is a partner in Life2Go Inc.providing marketing and  promotional services, primarily videos, to corporations and not-for-profit-organizations.  Recently, we discovered the amazing LOLA (mPERS) that can remove stress and anxiety for those that are looking after their elders or children with challenges. There are over 720,000 in Canada alone who are burdened with both the raising of children and care of their elders.  They are called the "sandwich generation". The aging of our population is growing rapidly and is putting an increased demand on our medical system and resources.

There is such a need for LOLA and LocationNow system, that we applied and received the distribution rights for Laipac Technology products in Canada. In the first phase, our plans are to produce at least a dozen specifically targeted introductory and promotional videos.  These will be widely distributed, along with an attractive Media package, to key venues, such as the multitude of Senior's Residences in Canada, through Care Giving Agencies, Family Care Givers and through Social Media. Our goal is to publicize LOLA through live event presentations, interactive video media, and selective advertising.

Launch: Sept/Oct 2013.

Stretch Funding

In the second phase, as funds are available, we will launch a TV advertising campaign.  If you help us reach our goal and beyond, we will apply the funds to create 30, 60, 120 second promos and a 15 and 30 minute infomercials for airing on TV. Launch: Nov/Dec 2013.

 How LOLA Changes Lives and Solves Problems

Many of you can relate to elders, children and vulnerable members in your family who could benefit from the freedom and peace of mind that LOLA offers.  You know the burden of anxiety and worry over the expenses incurred in care giving. For example. Note the sample statistic regarding those suffering from Alzheimer's and dementia:

                          

"Wandering has proven such a common behavior that Alzheimer's experts predict that 60% to 70% of all people with Alzheimer's will wander away from safety at least once during the course of their illness. Many will wander 6 to 8 times before they are placed into a residential facility or an outside, qualified caretaker is brought into the home to help." 

Then there are the millions of dollars a year spent on expenses in recovering a host of victims that wander and become lost.  

                      

"Without effective procedures and equipment, searches can involve multiple agencies, hundreds of officers, countless man hours and thousands of dollars. More importantly, because time is of the essence, every minute lost increases the risk of a tragic outcome for the Alzheimer's patient, their caregivers and their families," says Christine M. Platz, Director of Media and Communications for Project Lifesaver.

LOLA and LocationNow.com is the instant and affordable solution. With mobile 2-way location and pinpoint location features. People seeking a very small real-time tracker to oversee a child or senior with memory illness and other challenges, will find the LOLA a true assset.  It can be used for other applications where a person is alone and isolated in a given situation.

 

Even if you can not contribute, we need your help in getting the word out about this latest technology that can have a tremendous impact on individual lives requiring instant mobile emergency access. For the user there is safety, security, independence and freedom.  For the caregiver there is peace of mind, less anxiety and improved quality of caregiving.  Indiegogo has some share tools that you can use to spread the news. Please use them if you can. Thank you for your participation in making LOLA known and accessible.

 

                                

 

For those that will help us with this campaign, we would like to acknowledge your contribution as generously as we can with some gift gestures of appreciation. Check out the perks.

story:
ADULT DAY CARE LAUNCH// NEAREST SERVICES ARE 65 MILES AWAY FROM THIS COMMUNITY

 

 

After being a nurse in the geriatric field for 5 years ive come to the realistic conclusion that there are very limited choices for family members  when it comes to their loved ones care. Its nursing home or paying someone to come to the home. Both methods add up to hundreds of dollars a day!! But why cant family members have a affordable choice?, not to mention a guilt free one? The choice im describing is Adult Day Care. A program that is open everyday Mon-Friday 8-5p with the exact same staff that you would be hiring for home care or at a nursing home( Registered nurses, licensed nursing assitants and expericened activites coordinators )all at a incredable low rate!

My father and I have decided that now could not be a better time to start a much needed service to our community! And we need your help!


OUR VISION: To have a safe, fun and relaxing gathering place for senior citizens during the day while their caregivers/realitives are working or enjoying some independent respite.


THE PURPOSE: To create a special place for the elderly generation to include but not limited to: craft activities, live entertainment, music, great food, great care and great staff The goal of my business is to have a higher quality of care and service at a more affordable rate than a traditional adult day center. 


KEY principals for my business : Quality of care, guilt free respite for family members and a community for the elderly full of fun and laughter! Also a chance to create new well deserved friendships!



REALITY: The state only offers a few options for the elderly, they can stay at home with significant others/relatives or be admitted to a Nursing Home or Assisted Living Community; both costing hundreds of dollars a day and loss of independence. My business will offer a great alternative!


CONCLUSION: Every penny counts! Please consider helping this overlooked cause! It’s time for us to give back to the people that have given us so much, and to the family members taking care of them! Thank you EVERYONE for your support, and the potential clients of Seniority, thank you!

 

CANT DONATE?? Thats ok, instead spread the word!!! :D

 
 
(The projected grand opening is August 1st in Littleton NH)

story:
Our Story

Thanks for reading our story.  We are Sal & Val and have been happily married for 14 years now.  Completly blessed with finding a love that many wait their entire life for.  We waited 42 years, surviving previous  marriages.  We cherish and appreciate each other and remain grateful no matter what we go through. Times changed for  us  a few years ago when the economy took a dive.  We fell on very hard financial times.  Never thought we would be in this place.  We had great jobs.  When the recession hit we both were laid off.  We felt like we were thrown out with the dirty bath water.  We tried to find new employment. I went back to work again but at a much reduced wage. Still I was happy to be working again.  But I was laid off again last May, double blow.  Discouraged  after many  rejections we decided to listen to our friends, and follow our dream by making our pasta sauces to sell.  It blessed our Italian hearts to feed friends by making them comfort food that is also healthy. Thats where our name came from. Italian Hearts.  Our  friend Nick Barouch painted us our fabulous art work that is our cover pic. Just waiting for funds to make it into a label.  We have been working our business for about 6 months now. We love working and being together, for us its great joy. We are better when we are together.  It shows in what we cook, hey we are Italians! We also believe God ordains our steps and nothing is ever wasted, each step brings us closer to our dreams being fulfilled. We know our foundation is being laid. So far  most of our money goes right back into the business advancing our steps.  We have learned a lot in 8 months and met many wonderful people.  Problem is we are hanging unto our home by a thread and barely keeping our utilities on with some food. We lost both our cars, currently we drive a friends car. We both have lost about 40lbs over this last year by food rationing.  We eat healthy so instead of eating processed or refined foods we ate much less.  Our hearts and passion is for organic healthy foods.  So in these hard financial times we wanted to create a healthy meal that is delicious,  fast and inexpensive.  Costs the same to serve our sauce with pasta for a quick meal as it costs to buy fast food that is not good for you at all.  Its easy to be a great cook, we help you by doing most of the work for you!  We saw others embrace this concept as our Christmas sales were wonderful praise God.  Many people gave our sauces as their Christmas gifts.  We did our first local show with rave reviews as we had samples for tasting.  All this has helped to sustain  us thus far!  We appreciate and understand this has been a journey as we grow and learn with each new step. We love our friends that have been so supportive and helped us on a local level. We're ready for more exposure.   As you invest in us and our business you will be a life changer!    And we will be forever grateful.  We have been  knocked down but not out!  Our spirits press forward daily. Word  to "Foodies"  have you heard comfort foods are in especially Italian?!  WE can do this!   Please help us follow our dream.  We can produce fabulous food!  And there is something amazing that happens when we step out of our own little world and help someone else in need, its called compassion. You get to be a piece of someone elses journey, pieces that come together to release the dream.   Really leaving a positive footprint.  What if our entire economy was rebuilt on this concept of people helping people?  What a world we would have, be a life changer starting with us! That my friend is a Grassroots Movement!  PLEASE help make our dream happen.  Make a difference = be a difference.  We believe in this concept of building business by people helping other people so much that  we can't wait to be in position to do the same for someone else.  Let's  take back America on this concept of people helping other people. We are launching this business, and need some sponsorships to met goals.  


The Impact

"Italian Hearts" - Loving mankind one bowl of Pasta at a time.Our sauces are incredible! They provide a quick healthy meal that is restaurant quality but much less expensive and much better for you.  Just boil a pound of pasta and heat up our sauce.  The aroma will be amazing. Lets bring families and friends back to the supper table.  Something wonderful is released when we share a meal together and talk.  Turning off the TV, cell phones etc, sharing a meal is sharing life. Statistics show a family that shares dinner together builds healthy lives. However not all of us have the time to prepare a great meal, let us do the work for you. For you on the go singles this will keep you going providing  a wonderful fast meal that is healthy Really the perfect meal for anyone young or old. We cook our sauces for two days  using  only the finest of ingredients that are full of flavor and nutrition.  We use as many organics as possible, our meats are free of hormones and antibiodics.  And grass fed beef for that awesome flavor. Our sauces are made in small batches giving them that personal loving touch. We now have 3 different varities of sauces.  Our original 3 meat sauce is Papa Sal's Sauce, then we have Bella Amore' which is cooked with Val's spicy meatballs.  The flavor is amazing!  And then we have our Tahoe Pines which is our vegetarian gourmet sauce.  Two are gluten free.  They all are spectacular!  Please what we need for our business is help completing our start up process. Once we complete these steps we will be store ready.  Our sauces have already been perfected for the canning process. They are pasta sauces but the uses go way beyond pasta.  They are incredible over meats, seafood, vegetables, used for pizza sauce, anything really.  People have said our sauce is better than any other they have ever tasted. Please check us out at italianhearts@etsy.com our humble little store front so you can shop from home. We also have a catering license, ready for events. Things may have tried to beat us down but we have spirits that still believe in the American dream of starting a grassroots small business. At our shop you can read the story that goes with each sauce by clicking unto the picture as well as our profile story. We believe we can get there we just need a helping hand up. Also in our gallery are pictures with info about us and our sauces. We say knocked down but not out! Our entrepreneurial  spirits soar.  We believe our product is awesome and so do many of our customers, read some of the comments and may your heart be moved to help us.  Whatever you donate, big or small it will be used to help us and be deeply appreciated.  We have many stores waiting to carry our sauces! Comfort Food at its finest because its from the heart, people can feel it.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,000.00 to catch up our household 4 walls, basic living expenses . Mortgage pmt   ( NEED MET)

We need $1,000.00 to obtain the rest of our license and business insurance

We need $1,500.00 to obtain our UPC and nutritional facts for the label,  500.00 per sauce X 3

We need 1,500.00 to make the label, it can be in sections $800.00 for the picture by its self

We need 2,000.00 to restock our inventory

We need 1,500.00 for the use of a commercial kitchen 

We need $500.00 - $1,000.00 for advertising on facebook

The rest is to live conservativly on until our business takes off, just for living expenses

SINCE THIS CAMPAIGN STARTED OUR PERSONAL NEEDS HAVE BEEN MET THE REST NOW GOES INTO THE BUSINESS!

 

We believe we will make it as we have had fabulous reviews and stores waiting to carry our sauces.  After we secure our living expenses so we do not become homeless we will use all and any funds to advance to new levels in our business.  We started with just great sauce and zero money! Friends helped us buy supplies to make our first batch to sell. We are people of faith and believe in Miracles. We also know by experience that God likes to use people who have hearts to help others to bring forth those miracles.  We hope you are one of those people.  We have already experienced this along the journey that we have been on up to this point.  Please spread the word of our story.  We had a call the other day from someone we did not know that said " word on the streets is that you have the best sauce in the land, we want some!"  We love those street people!  We see this story involves many wonderful people, its bigger than just us.  We have watched God build people as He is building our business.  Please help us by being a people builder.

 

 


Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

Our sauces are made in small batches giving them that personal loving touch. We now have 3 different varities of sauces.  Our original 3 meat sauce is Papa Sal's Sauce, then we have Bella Amore' which is cooked with Val's spicy meatballs.  The flavor is amazing!  And then we have our Tahoe Pines which is our vegetarian gourmet sauce.  Two are gluten free.  They all are spectacular!  Please what we need for our business is help completing our start up process. Once we complete these steps we will be store ready.  Our sauces have already been perfected for the canning process. They are pasta sauces but the uses go way beyond pasta.  They are incredible over meats, seafood, vegetables, used for pizza sauce, anything really.  People have said our sauce is better than any other they have ever tasted. Please check us out at italianhearts@etsy.com our humble little store front so you can shop from home. We also have a catering license, ready for events. Things may have tried to beat us down but we have spirits that still believe in the American dream of starting a grassroots small business. At our shop you can read the story that goes with each sauce by clicking unto the picture as well as our profile story. We believe we can get there we just need a helping hand up. Also in our gallery are pictures with info about us and our sauces. We say knocked down but not out! Our entrepreneurial  spirits soar.  We believe our product is awesome and so do many of our customers, read some of the comments and may your heart be moved to help us.  Whatever you donate, big or small it will be used to help us and be deeply appreciated.  We have many stores waiting to carry our sauces! Comfort Food at its finest because its from the heart, people can feel it.


What We Need & What You Get
We need $3,000.00 to catch up our household 4 walls, basic living expenses . Mortgage pmt   ( NEED MET)
We need $1,000.00 to obtain the rest of our license and business insurance 
We need $1,500.00 to obtain our UPC and nutritional facts for the label,  500.00 per sauce X 3
We need 1,500.00 to make the label, it can be in sections $800.00 for the picture by its self
We need 2,000.00 to restock our inventory
We need 1,500.00 for the use of a commercial kitchen 
We need $500.00 - $1,000.00 for advertising on facebook
The rest is to live conservativly on until our business takes off, just for living expenses
SINCE THIS CAMPAIGN STARTED OUR PERSONAL NEEDS HAVE BEEN MET THE REST NOW GOES INTO THE BUSINESS!
 
We believe we will make it as we have had fabulous reviews and stores waiting to carry our sauces.  After we secure our living expenses so we do not become homeless we will use all and any funds to advance to new levels in our business.  We started with just great sauce and zero money! Friends helped us buy supplies to make our first batch to sell. We are people of faith and believe in Miracles. We also know by experience that God likes to use people who have hearts to help others to bring forth those miracles.  We hope you are one of those people.  We have already experienced this along the journey that we have been on up to this point.  Please spread the word of our story.  We had a call the other day from someone we did not know that said " word on the streets is that you have the best sauce in the land, we want some!"  We love those street people!  We see this story involves many wonderful people, its bigger than just us.  We have watched God build people as He is building our business.  Please help us by being a people builder.
 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
The Reeves family...

Hello everyone,

   My name is David...Im posting this to help my sister and her family. I live in Michigan and they live all the way in Ingleside Texas, so there is only so much I can do to help. Just 3 days ago, my sister's neighbors house caught fire. The fire was so intence, it spread to her house. The entire section of the house is a complete loss due to fire, smoke and water damage. The areas effected are, the laundry room, garage, living room, the kids play/class room and some of the kitchen. Everyone including the pets made it out ok.  

   My sister Candice and her husband Derrick have five children. Cayder-8, Parker-6, Aubrey-4, Aleisa-2 and last but not least, Kylie is only 5 months old. They also have 3 dogs. Candice is a stay at home mom and she home schools the older kids. Derrick works full time as a truck driver. As I was speaking with Candice today, they just found out that because the home owners insurance was not in their name, NOTHING inside of the house will be covered.

   PLEASE, ANY HELP WOULD BE SO GREATFUL!! They don't have the money to start over, so ANYTHING would help!!

   Any donations will go to a deposit to a new place to live, every day household items, school supplies and hope to a new beginning.

   Thank you for reading this post, and possiably donating.

story:
Stick & Stone Artisan Bakery will be an expression of bread-making perfection using old-world style of bread-baking using a wood-fired oven, similar to the ones used in France, today.

Who are we?

David Bryan: principal owner and baker

        Loves: My wife, my family and cooking with all-natural, 

                  organic ingredients!

Sarah Bryan: wife, cheerleader, and marketing manager.

        Loves: David's bread!

 

About the Oven

Traditional wood-burning ovens

  • uses a gentle, but substantial heat to cook foods
  • gives bread that crusty-outside, chewy inside texture
  • low maintenance cost
  • energy efficient!
  • sustainable (less fuel is required)
  • similar to the ovens used for centuries to bake the best breads in France.

 

Our marketing plan & Why we need your help

  • Sell at several farmers markets around the Eastern Nebraska/Western Iowa areas.
  • Individual orders to be delivered via mail, pick-up points, and available for pick-up from the bakery, itself.
  • Sell 3-4 year-round varieties of bread and 3-4 seasonal varieties.

 

We will update the website with pictures of our progress.  Thanks for supporting us in this venture!

 

What You Get

All donations $25 and more are rewarded with at least one loaf of bread and other great stuff! Long-distance donors have the option of receiving their bread via the mail or contributing it to the homeless shelter in Omaha in their name.

 

The Impact

Our little oven is just the beginning for us. :

  • This oven will provide an excellent product at a reasonable price
  • We will use our gifts for the benefit of others.
  • As our success builds, we will hire and train others in this craft.
  • We’ll be able to assist in feeding others.
  • Our ability to make a difference will grow with our business. To some it might be “just” a loaf of bread. To us, it’s a tool for changing the world. And it tastes amazing! What’s better than feeding the masses and feeding them well?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute money? That’s okay – we need more than just money! Some other ways to be involved include:

  • Send us a note of encouragement, thoughts, or even suggestions. If we were in your neighborhood, what kind of bread would you want (i.e. Sprouted wheat varieties for those with gluten sensitivities, favorite flavor combos, etc.)
  • Spread the word! If 100 people gave $10 and then forwarded to their five closest friends, who then gave $10, we’d have more than enough to build our oven! Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Have knowledge in masonry or want to help us build? We’re planning on doing the actual oven and workspace building ourselves. Many hands make light work. We would love your “sweat equity” and company for our project. We’ll even share some bread with you to say “thanks!”

story:
Hello,

My name is Tamara Horton and I am trying to take the necessary steps in pursuing my passions in a more professional setting. I need your help with taking these steps.

A little about me:

I live on beautiful Whidbey Island, where I was born and raised. I am truly passionate about living in tune with nature in a modern way. I am an active community member, volunteering at multiple local non-profits. After attending college I chose to move back to my home town to help make a positive change in myself and my community.

I began my college career at Edmonds CC, where I received a General AA and Small Business Management/Entreprenuership Certificate. During my time at Edmonds I attended a study abroad program in Florence, Italy, Spring Quarter of 2005, after which I chose to travel Europe alone for the summer, it was an experience of a lifetime. After recieving the WAVE Grant (WA Award for Vocational Excellence) which paid for 2 more years tuition, I attended The Evergreen State College, receiving my Bachelor of Arts focused in Sustainability.

I have volunteered with WSU Extension Program: Waste Wise (waste remediation outreach program), Transition Whidbey, South Whidbey Commons Coffeehouse/Bookstore, Good Cheer Food Bank Garden, Outdoor Classroom (K-5 environmental education program), Americorps, and several others. These have all been and will continue to be truly fulfilling and educational experiences for me.

I have held a wide variety of jobs, but 90% of them have nothing to do with any of my ultimate goals. I am currrently a green housecleaner and milk woman...though I do enjoy my work I am trying to move more towards where my passions, abilities and community demand coincides.

My goal is to become a Sustainability Consultant, helping people and businesses function in a more sustainable way. I plan to start off by working with individuals and small businesses, as a sort of Sustainability Organizer or Assistant. Helping to gather together the information, insight and people necessary to achieve whatever the client is trying to do. I would do the footwork so they don't have to, whether that is analysis, research, correpsondance, organizing, referrals, project management, or actual implementation of a project. I might also incorporate selling retail products. I estimate I could increase my rate from $10-20/hr to $25-50/hr once I have completed these steps, with a possibility of more, but I want to keep my rates reasonably affordable.

Example of work:

Someone wants to do a lifestyle face-lift to reduce bills and carbon footprint while improving health and emergency preparedness/resilience. I might:

  • organize an Energy Auditor to do a site analysis for them
  • help them change daily habits
  • purchase low-energy appliances and cost saving gadgets
  • choose healthier, lower impact food at a moderate price
  • introduce them to green cleaning methods
  • start a small garden/greenhouse or other landscaping projects
  • research and install a rain catchment system
  • help stock a pantry for emergencies
  • look into installing off-grid energy source alternatives
  • greywater remediation systems
  • composting systems
  • composting toilets
  • options for remodeling to better align with green building practices
  • researching permits, zoning, codes etc.
  • customized research reports, action plans and maybe even personal reminders
  • and much more

I do have relevant degrees as welll as experience in this field through various jobs, volunteer work, personal projects and research...but I need more specific training/credentials in order to pursue this career path. These will all help me pursue several careers within this field. The early steps in this process are:

#1 Permaculture Design Course*=$1,200 (in July) 
http://www.wildernesscollege.com/permaculture-s...

#2 ISSP Sustainability Professional Certificate=$2,600 (starts in September)
http://www.sustainabilityprofessionals.org/issp...

#3 LEED Green Associate Training=$550 (anytime online)
http://www.usgbc.org/credentials/leed-ga/overview

#4 Necessary materials (books, forms, business cards etc.)

#5 Website

and more...I also have the goal of going back to college for an engineering degree, but I feel strongly that experiential learning is best for me at this time.

*"Permaculture is a branch of ecological design, ecological engineering, and environmental design which develops sustainable architecture and self-maintained agricultural systems modeled from natural ecosystems."-- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permaculture

 ********

This Campaign:

The first step is attending a Permaculture Design Course coming up in July. I need to raise at least $1,600 ($1,200 for class + $300 for work missed + IndieGoGo fee). This course provides an internationally recognized certificate and experiential education in most of the areas I need training in at this moment. If I do not get the funds raised in time for the upcoming Permaculture program I will apply the money raised towards one or two of the other steps or find a Permaculture program at a different establishment.

********

Last year I had an overwhelmingly positive response to my request for help attending Generation Waking Up Leadership Training...I raised over $1,000 in ONE DAY, just from FB, word of mouth and a local list serve. My community has shown me time and time again that it is willing to invest in my future. This has moved me in ways I cannot describe, and I am very greatful for their support. It was difficult for me to ask for money, just as it is now.

The world needs more people helping to show how to have a smaller physical impact while having a larger societal and environmental impact. If we are to continue living on this planet we must do so in a way which balances financial and material wealth with the wealth of the natural world. I wish to help my community incorporate concepts such as: Whole systems approach, cradle to cradle, think globally act locally, triple bottom line, permaculture, 7 generations thinking, LEED, and zero net impact. By functioning in smarter ways in our daily lives both at home and at work, we can shift from a destructive society to a constructive one (see pic above), while still living a modern lifestyle. In order to do this there need to be guides...I seek to be one of those guides.

 

Will you help make my dream a reality?

 

 

I truly appreciate your time.

Best Wishes,

Tamara Horton

 

PS-I am also working on a local small business rewards network...stay tuned!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone and thank you so much for taking the time to come here. My name is Mandy Lee and I am a recent culinary graduate that entered the food industry not too long ago. I want to share my story in hopes that you'll be able to help me get my life started again.  It is and has always been my dream to travel and cook all over the world and one day be able to share my passion and love of food with everyone.  I hope you are able to help me get steps closer to making that dream of mine come true.

story:
Help Us Fill The Pantry - And Keep Our Services Running

Everyone Needs Support Sometimes.  

Anglicare Mackay Whitsunday Region is a not-for-profit organisation that provides food hampers, emergency relief, and counselling and support services to those in need in our community.  Our branch receives no government funding and relies entirely on the generosity of those who use our services and community members.

Our Pantry Is Bare - Despite contributions of groceries from the community we cannot keep up with demand.

We need to raise funds to continue to provide these services - we cannot currently keep up with demand which is increasing every month.  In April 2014 alone, we handed out  117 food hampers to people in need, valued at about $60 each - $7020 worth of food in one month. This number has doubled from the same month last year.  We also provided over $5000 worth of emergency relief support, and over  1200 counselling sessions at low cost/no cost to those in need since the beginning of this year. 

Currently in Mackay unemployment is rising, and the cost of living is increasing - this means more people require help and support.  If we can not raise funds by the end of this financial year, we may struggle to continue to provide these essential services.  Anglicare Mackay Whitsunday relies on volunteers and community donations - but we need more help!!! 

What We Need

We need at least $50, 000 by the end of this financial year to break even - just to cover the costs of expenses this year.  Without these funds we may not be able to continue to provide our services.  A further $10,000 would allow us to purchase food to give out in hampers and set up an emergency relief fund.  At the moment we can not keep up with the amount of food hampers that are required, and we need to purchase supplies immediately.

Anglicare Mackay Whitsunday is the only service in the region where people can access food hampers whenever their need arises.  We never turn anyone away. 

If we do not reach our target goal - any money raised will go towards purchasing food supplies. 

Why We Need Help

Anglicare Mackay Whitsunday has been providing food hampers and emergency relief for eight years.  Each year the number of people who need our help has increased.  In the last three years the amount of food hampers provided has doubled each year. 

We cannot continue to provide these services without increased funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate, please let others know about our plea!! Share our campaign with others in your network!

If you live in our region,  we are always looking for volunteers to help us in our work and to help in our fundraising appeals.

Visit our website http://500clubmackay.com.au or our Facebook https://www.facebook.com/anglicare.mackaywhitsundayregion for more information.

story:
Hello! Our names are April and Chris, and we love food. For as long as I can remember we have been food motivated, and that didn't change when I had to go Gluten Free. It just got a little more difficult to find food to get really excited about.

We are working to make that search a little easier. Between us, Chris and I have almost 30 years in the restaurant industry. Food is our passion and our calling. Almost nothing on Earth makes us happier than seeing people enjoy good food with good company. Good food doesn't have to be fancy. It’s your mother’s fried chicken or your grandmother’s pie crust.  It’s chocolate cake on your birthday. It’s a big bowl of corn chowder in the winter or fresh fruit cobbler in the summer. It’s crusty, chewy bread you can slather with butter. It’s tasty, and it’s real, and it makes you feel good from the inside out.

After finding out four years ago that my daughter and I have Celiac, we found that a lot of the baking products on the market were made with only rice flour and starches. They didn't provide much nutrition and our recipes came out gritty or gummy. It took over a year and a LOT of trial and error, but I developed an all-purpose flour mixture that really mimics wheat flour for most applications. AND it is 40% whole grains, which was important to me. 

Chris and I are here today to ask for your help in expanding the Angry Duck Bakery. Your donation will help us build a professional production kitchen and bring our flour and flour mixes to the table. Angry Duck flours are free of all eight major allergens: wheat, milk, soy, tree nuts, peanuts, fish, shellfish, and eggs. We use it every day in our house and our bakery. 

Our goal is to open the Angry Duck Bakery in a permanent location within 6 months. We currently do custom baking, including wholesale, and our cakes and focaccia rolls are carried at Hazel in Brattleboro, VT, and the Flat Iron Exchange in Bellows Falls, VT. We want to expand our reach in Vermont, New Hampshire, the capital region of New York, Western Massachusetts, and beyond. We’re willing to put in the time, passion, dedication, and energy. We’re asking for your help with funding. Your donation will allow us to buy professional equipment like a standing oven, a 30 qt Hobart mixer, and a bread proofing cabinet.  The more money we can raise, the shorter our timeline.

As people and as a company, we believe in giving back. After our first year in business, we will donate 10% of our profits to food banks in the Connecticut River Valley region of New Hampshire and Vermont. There is no limit on this gift; the more we make, the more we will donate.

If you fund us, you will receive our undying gratitude and an enthusiastic thank you! Along with that, and some fun little perks like stickers, mugs, and t-shirts, you will also receive a gift certificate for 10% of your total donation amount which you can keep for yourself, give to others, or donate back to us and we will pass on the equivalent amount of money or goods to our local food banks.

You can help us realize our dreams. If you can, donate. If you can’t, help us get the word out! Share our story with your friends, help us get people interested; the Angry Duck is off the ground, you can help us make her soar. Thank you for your support.
story_txt:
Hello! Our names are April and Chris, and we love food. For as long as I
can remember we have been food motivated, and that didn't change when I had to
go Gluten Free. It just got a little more difficult to find food to get really
excited about.
We are working to make that search a little easier. Between us, Chris
and I have almost 30 years in the restaurant industry. Food is our passion and
our calling. Almost nothing on Earth makes us happier than seeing people enjoy
good food with good company. Good food doesn't have to be fancy. It’s your
mother’s fried chicken or your grandmother’s pie crust.  It’s chocolate
cake on your birthday. It’s a big bowl of corn chowder in the winter or fresh
fruit cobbler in the summer. It’s crusty, chewy bread you can slather with
butter. It’s tasty, and it’s real, and it makes you feel good from the inside
out.
After finding out four years ago that my daughter and I have Celiac, we found that a lot of the baking products on the market were made with only rice flour and starches. They didn't provide much nutrition and our recipes came out gritty or gummy. It took over a year and a LOT of trial and error, but I developed an
all-purpose flour mixture that really mimics wheat flour for most applications.
AND it is 40% whole grains, which was important to me. 
Chris and I are here today to ask for your help in expanding the Angry
Duck Bakery. Your donation will help us build a professional production kitchen and bring our
flour and flour mixes to the table. Angry Duck flours are free of all eight
major allergens: wheat, milk, soy, tree nuts, peanuts, fish, shellfish, and eggs.
We use it every day in our house and our bakery. 
Our goal is to open the Angry Duck Bakery in a permanent location
within 6 months. We currently do custom baking, including wholesale, and our
cakes and focaccia rolls are carried at Hazel in Brattleboro, VT, and the Flat
Iron Exchange in Bellows Falls, VT. We want to expand our reach in Vermont, New
Hampshire, the capital region of New York, Western Massachusetts, and beyond.
We’re willing to put in the time, passion, dedication, and energy. We’re asking
for your help with funding. Your donation will allow us to buy professional equipment like a standing oven, a 30 qt Hobart mixer, and a bread proofing cabinet.  The more money we can raise, the shorter our timeline.
As people and as a company, we believe in giving back. After our first
year in business, we will donate 10% of our profits to food banks in the
Connecticut River Valley region of New Hampshire and Vermont. There is no limit
on this gift; the more we make, the more we will donate.
If you fund us, you will receive our undying gratitude and an
enthusiastic thank you! Along with that, and some fun little perks like
stickers, mugs, and t-shirts, you will also receive a gift certificate for 10%
of your total donation amount which you can keep for yourself, give to others,
or donate back to us and we will pass on the equivalent amount of money or
goods to our local food banks.
You can help us realize our dreams. If you can, donate. If you can’t,
help us get the word out! Share our story with your friends, help us get people
interested; the Angry Duck is off the ground, you can help us make her soar.
Thank you for your support.

story:
Our Dream


We believe in keeping the party going. Why leave the birthday bash, backyard barbecue or intimate cocktail mixer to restock your booze supply and miss out on the fun?

We keep festivities uninterrupted, conveniently and responsibly, by bringing your favorite alcohol beverage straight to your door through our simple to use website. Let us be your quickest link to drink, Drinklinkdelivery.com


Our Story


It was another long desert ride back on the highway of cruelty. The engine roared through the night as the moon pierced the darkness. Gripping the wheel, his knuckles went white with ambition. A family of three siblings thirst for entrepreneurial desire. They ripped through a barrage of twisted ideas to better the haven they call, 'The City of Sin'.
The union of soul and raw body, in which we call life, has been fed with the ultimate convenience through crushing metal technology, presenting more free time for pure thrashing enjoyment and treasures this world has to offer. The trinity siblings decided to grab hold a mighty industry that had been traditional for too long. Alcohol. The youthful liquid we drown our sorrows and fill with the amusement of festivity and rock and roll. There was no doubt that the three could not ignore a concept of such marvel. With the power of blackened dreams, DrinkLink was called upon.


The Way of DrinkLink




Perks




FAQ

What is DrinkLink's purpose, why do we exist?
  • We believe in preserving the life of the party. We believe in bringing enjoyment through convenience. The way we preserve the life of the party is by making our alcohol delivery service easy to use, quick and reliable. Refill your fun on our mobile website at Drinklinkdelivery.com
How does DrinkLink work?
  • DrinkLink is a mobile website that is the fastest, most responsible way for online consumers to get their favorite beer, wine and liquor delivered to their doorstep. Consumers of legal drinking age simply log on to the website on their smartphone or computer and with a few clicks of the mouse or finger, in under 60 minutes the consumer's order will be delivered. Upon delivery, drivers then ask for ID to match the order to the buyer or verify age. 
What is DrinkLink's coverage area?
  • We will eventually cover areas of Las Vegas that have high demand of alcohol delivery services. 
How long do deliveries take?
  • Our goal is to deliver your order within an hour or less
Are there any delivery fees?
  • Yes. There is a minimum order of $40 for delivery. Delivery fees, tax, and tipping are also included within the total of each item for simple pricing and consumer convenience.
Is DrinkLink a part of the three-tier system of alcohol distribution?
  • No, although DrinkLink is designed to uphold the laws and spirit of the three-tier system to its most stringent practice while bringing value to each tier.
How does DrinkLink ensure responsible delivery to legal drinkers?
  • Every profile created or order placed will ask to authenticate identification and verify age. There will be a third party that will scan your ID using your computer's webcam or phone's camera to validate your information in real time. The faster you fill out, the faster you get the party started. (IDs will also be manually checked in person in certain circumstances).
What platforms will DrinkLink be using for their online ordering menu?
  • Consumers will be able to purchase beverages on DrinkLink's website or mobile app.
When is the launch date?
  • The launch date is in the works. Follow us on our facebook fanpage and social media links below to stay updated on when we go live!

story:
Do you enjoy cooking? Why not cook a little bit more to cover the cost of ingredients and share with other people your delicious meal? It could be very easy...

Are you working late and don't have a freshly-cooked meal waiting for you at home? Or maybe you're tired of spending a fortune in restaurants or of eating unhealthy fastfood? We have the solution for you..

Who are we?

    

Hello! We are two software engineers currently working in Ireland. We are very enthusiastic about technology, but our interests are not only in it. We have a shared passion for healthy food and a good culinary culture. We conceived the idea for homefood4u while having lunch one day.

 

The idea was born as we realized that we do not like fastfood, but do not always have time to prepare home-cooked meals. Believing that there can be cooperation between people on food, we started working on this project during the our free time. We hope that homefood4u can be a start for people to see food in a different way.

How are we going to spend the money?

We have developed our application for free so far, during our spare time, week end, etc..But unfortunately not everything is for free. We'd need money for web hosting (in particular cloud services). Licences for software tools, designers, further developments like support new countries and languages and advertisement.

How does our idea work?

Visit web page www.homefood4u.com !

When you access to the website, your position will be retrieved and daily offers around you will be shown in the map.

Figure 1. Homepage Map.


If you want to check all the offers available per date, position, name..etc..You can access the offers section. All the offers will be shown in order of distance.

     Figure 2. Offer List

Clicking on an offer you can discover more like the chef description, the chef reviews and other useful information..and of course, purchase the offer! 

attached here is a screenshot of the mobile version.

                                       

                                          Figure 3. Mobile Site

In order to buy a meal you need to register in the website. When you place an order, the system will connect you with the cook..allowing both of you to communicate to each other through the messages section.. In the feedback section you can also leave a feedback and a review and let other knows about your experience.

Of course, when you are registered to our website, you can also create offers. To insert an offer, just type the name, a description, when the order can be collected by your "customers" and when the offer will expire. Insert a fare price and add a picture to make the offer more attractive.

        Figure 4. Creating an offer.

When an order has been placed by a customer, you will receive a notification message and the pick up information (the one set in your profile) will be sent to the customer.

Please visit www.homefood4u.com

Thank you

story:
Hi,

my name is Marie, I'm the chair of Chagos Refugees Group UK.

This campaign is about Chagos Day which we Chagossians celebrate with all the natives who have been deported from their homeland, the Chagos Islands. It is a special day of commemoration of the deportation of the Chagossian community in recognition of their unyielding endurance. We want Chagossian natives (elderly Chagossians who were born on the islands) to know that we are here for them, so on the 3rd of November we invite all of them to a celebration in the church and after we have a traditional party.

The party is all about Chagossian food and drink, Chagossian Sega dancing and also we will share some memories. This is a place where all natives can meet and talk about their islands.

To make this happen we need your help to donate what ever you can. The money raised will help to buy all the stuff for the day and to hire a hall.

Please help me achieve this for my people.


If you want to know more about Chagos Day and the struggle of the Chagossian people please visit our website or visit us on Facebook or Twitter - @UKCRG

story:
Get KiddChris To Philly!!!

Do you remember KiddChris? Do you remember the countless hours of enjoyment KiddChris had provided you all these years? Well now is your chance pay KiddChris back!! KiddChris really wants to get back to Philadelphia to see his beloved Philadelphia Flyers play the Columbus Blue Jackets on November 22nd, 2014. 
KiddChris is a grown up now and being a grown up comes with grown up problems. He recently got his brakes worked on and that cost him 800.00 bucks. After getting his brakes done he realized he had dipped into his "GET TO PHILLY" fund.  You see KiddChris had planned on going to see the Philadelphia Flyers play the Columbus Blue Jackets on November 22nd, 2014 and see his friend Kris Shultz, but now that plan is on hold until he can make other arrangements.
KiddChris is a huge fans of hockey and love the Flyers!!! This was his one weekend to get away from all the hustle n' bustle of radio and get back to the city that he truly loves!!! You can help make this happen!!! You can help make dream come true for man that has showed up for up every morning!!

What He Need's  & What You Get

KiddChris needs 800.00 dollars to make this dream weekend come true.  This is the exact amount KiddChris spent on getting his brakes worked on. By raising this 800.00 dollars KiddChris will be able to take a break and get back to the City of Brotherly Love!!!

You are probably wondering - what's in it for you??

  • To be a part of a great weekend with a great person!!
  • A chance make a dream come true!!
  • A chance to press the flesh and break bread with KiddChris himself!!!

The Impact

  • To be able retain the title as the GREATEST CITY the KiddChris Show has ever worked in!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word and tell your friends!!!

story:
Short Summary


The Clock is a Website and App that treats your time as money. You can bank your time when you exchange talents within the "Clock" community. Or you can hire people to work with you buy exchanging the time you have saved  on the "Clock. 

We all do favors for friends and heres a way to track your time and use it like money with others.


The idea for creating the "Clock" came from  the need for resources on a micro to no budget project. Weather you are a college student,working professional, or you are part of the indie crowd who needs grass roots resources.  We all have called on  our friends and family for favors.  And we all have been on the other  end  of a favor thats left you feeling cautious about helping in the future.  This is where the "Clock" can help. 

People from all over the world with every skill set join "Clock" and form a virtual community. Everyone will post their skill sets and level of expertise. If you have a need simply  create a listings .  Everyone on the "Clock" will see your listings and if someone has the skills and time they can/  simple click and apply. 

The key to the "Clock"  is that your time is exchanged for payment. The more time you bank, the more time you have  to exchange for services you need.  If you are a college student and you have more time than money the "clock" is the perfect place to leverage your time. 


Let me tell You my story.

Ive worked in the Motion Picture industry for the past 16yrs. My goal has always become  the Director of Photography. One of the hurdles has been creating a show reel. The Reel must have examples of my work to show the same production value as the big studios . 

 The dilemma is how to show a professional product on a micro budget. The tried and true method is to use the relationships you have to produce your product. This leaves you owning  favors to a lot of people and through the years it becomes harder to do. Besides they might not have the resources you need in return. 

   But with the "Clock" its easier you are part of a  community of talented people. You can spend your time with whom ever you want, and you know your time is never wasted. You can spend/ save your time, and use it for whatever you need.  Its transforms a favor into a mutual exchange or for low budgets projects it can be used a perk program to add incentive to the job. 


"We are the resources that make the large companies flourish. We design the websites, use the apps, create the art, the music, we are the backbones of our society.  We need to place a personal value on our time and the resources we bring to the table. It's time we value ourselves as resources in the same way employers do and join a community that returns that value back to us. "

 



What We Need & What You Get


  • The Goal is to raise 15,000 dollars .This will cover the cost for the Website and App development , launch and database maintenance. 
  •  We already have one of Silicon Valley's top web designer waiting to begin development. 
  • Once we launched the Website and App we will use the remaining monies to promote and populate the site. 
  • For those who contribute to the fundraiser you will receive time on the "Clock" for your contributions.  
  • If we don't reach our goal we will use the monies to develop the Website and App and approach private equity to fund the promotion stage of the launch. 
  • We are firm believers in the power of a grass root campaign. 
  • We will be canvasing colleges and offering a variety of perks for those who are part of our launch team. 
  • The "clock" will be an open source site and will take any suggestions and use them in an attempt to create the best site for the community. 

The Impact 

  • The "Clock" is essential in today's socioeconomic climate. The vast majority of people can't  to afford resources to compete with large companies. How many people work for a company but can't afford to use the product their company produces?
  • The small business owner and mom and pop shops are becoming a thing of the past.  But with the "clock" we can level the playing field. 
  • We are the resources that make the large companies flourish. We design the websites use the apps, create the art, the music, are the backbones of ours society.  We need to place a personal value on our time and the resources we bring to the table, this is why time is money.  

Risks & Challenges


  • The challenges will be getting the concept to market, this is why the web development and maintenance has to have flawless execution.  In addition developing the community is  critical as well. 
  • We have designed a strategy that works with complete funding and a scaled version of the  launch if the funding goals aren't  met. 
  • This launch takes a multi platform approach to populating the site, it offers incentives for those members who help populate the site.  We will to team with various community organizations and charities to promote the site. And these organizations will partner post launch to provide opportunities for members to bank hours.  
  • This community is run on a open source concept which will encourage input by the uses updates or changes to the site will be voted on by the community. This is a site for the users not vice versa. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't donate , we understand! 
  • Please take the time to sign up for our newsletter  so we can keep you abreast of the sites developments. And of course no spam
  • And use the IndieGoGO tools to share this campaign with your friends and family 
  • Last but not least THANK YOU!

The Goal is to raise 15,000 dollars .This will cover the cost for the Website and App development , launch and database maintenance. 
 We already have one of Silicon Valley's top web designer waiting to begin development. 
Once we launched the Website and App we will use the remaining monies to promote and populate the site.  For those who contribute to the fundraiser you will receive time on the "Clock" for your contributions.   If we don't reach our goal we will use the monies to develop the Website and App and approach private equity to fund the promotion stage of the launch. 
We are firm believers in the power of a grass root campaign. 
We will be canvasing colleges and offering a variety of perks for those who are part of our launch team. 
The "clock" will be an open source site and will take any suggestions and use them in an attempt to create the best site for the community.  
  The Impact  
The "Clock" is essential in today's socioeconomic climate. The vast majority of people can't  to afford resources to compete with large companies. How many people work for a company but can't afford to use the product their company produces?
The small business owner and mom and pop shops are becoming a thing of the past.  But with the "clock" we can level the playing field. 
We are the resources that make the large companies flourish. We design the websites use the apps, create the art, the music, are the backbones of ours society.  We need to place a personal value on our time and the resources we bring to the table, this is why time is money.   
  Risks & Challenges
 
The challenges will be getting the concept to market, this is why the web development and maintenance has to have flawless execution.  In addition developing the community is  critical as well. 
We have designed a strategy that works with complete funding and a scaled version of the  launch if the funding goals aren't  met. 
This launch takes a multi platform approach to populating the site, it offers incentives for those members who help populate the site.  We will to team with various community organizations and charities to promote the site. And these organizations will partner post launch to provide opportunities for members to bank hours.   This community is run on a open source concept which will encourage input by the uses updates or changes to the site will be voted on by the community. This is a site for the users not vice versa.  
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
If you can't donate , we understand! 
Please take the time to sign up for our newsletter  so we can keep you abreast of the sites developments. And of course no spam And use the IndieGoGO tools to share this campaign with your friends and family 
Last but not least THANK YOU!

story:
Our Purpose

We are funding a grassroots ballot initiative to help Florida voters amend their state's constitution during the Fall 2016 elections. Currently, statutes and ordinances make it illegal to disconnect a Florida home from local utilities. Last year, those laws were used to jail Cape Coral, Florida resident Robin Speronis for five weeks, including two weeks in solitary confinement. Her crimes? Collecting rainwater and using solar power to meet her daily utilities needs. Speronis' story has made international headlines. See Bloomberg Businessweek  for a recent example. Contribute to this campaign if you agree that individuals should have the right to select reasonable alternatives to monopolized local utilities services.

Why Should You Care?

You may think such bullying could never occur where you live. Unfortunately, it probably already has. Last year in Texas, for example, S.W.A.T. teams were deployed to the peaceful Garden of Eden Community as a Gestapo-style intimidation tactic. Officers arrested only one individual, based on unrelated traffic tickets, and issued a handful of citations for city code infractions. Officials found absolutely no drug-related violations, and all inhabitants of the community were unarmed.

Each of the community members present in the group's house were initially handcuffed at gunpoint by heavily armed S.W.A.T. officers. This included the mother of a toddler and a two-week old baby. As part of the raid, many of the community's edible crops were destroyed. Officers removed a variety of materials the community had planned to use in sustainability projects.

Garden of Eden is a sustainable community which lives outside of the confines of the 'average lifestyle.' The community believes in coming together to produce the basic necessities of life, and members support one another through each step. They grow their own food and live quietly. Since 2009, the group has been providing food, shelter and sustainability education classes to the public for free.

We want Florida's ballot initiative to serve as the model for similar reform in other states. Contribute to this campaign if you share our belief that something is terribly wrong with state and local governments criminalizing responsible, sustainable living.

Our Financial Needs

Contributions will be used to collect the tens of thousands of signatures required to place our amendment on the 2016 ballot. In addition, we will hire attorneys to prepare for mandatory legal proceedings before the Florida Supreme Court. 

As a major campaign, we need election consultants and media advisers to assist us. In the six months leading up to the vote, we will need money for billboards, television commercials and radio ads, not to mention yard signs and bumper stickers.

Because we anticipate well-funded opposition from the fossil fuels and utilities industries, it is imperative that we assemble a team of highly-qualified campaign professionals to ensure our success. Between now and the November 2016 election, there will be fierce competition for public approval. Contribute to this campaign if you want to send a message to "Big Utilities" that paid lobbyists should not control public policy.

Our Philosophy

The late Nelson Mandela once said, "To be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others." Contribute to this campaign if you agree with that idea. 

For working together, like Mr. Mandela, we can change the world.
